en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria
ny: Zigawenga Zazigawenga Zayambitsa Zigawenga Zakupha ku Northeast Nigeria

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
ny: Zigawenga zigawenga zachisilamu zapha anthu osachepera asanu ndi awiri pakuchita chiwembu kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Borno ku Nigeria, omwe adachitira umboni adauza a Associated Press Lachitatu.

en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents. The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
ny: Zigawengazi zidaukira mudzi wa Kautukari mdera la Chibok ku Borno Lachiwiri madzulo, atero anthu. Kuwukiraku kudachitika nthawi yomweyo mlembi wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres anali m'boma kukakumana ndi anthu omwe adapulumuka pa ziwawa za Jihadi.

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
ny: Dera la Chibok lili pamtunda wa makilomita 115 (makilomita 71) kuchokera ku Maiduguri, likulu la boma, komwe Guterres adakumana ndi zigawenga zakale akubwezeretsedwanso m'gulu la anthu komanso anthu masauzande ambiri omwe adasamutsidwa chifukwa cha zigawenga.

en: "They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community," said Hassan Chibok, a community leader. Troops from a nearby military base were deployed to repel the attack but "the damage had been done," Chibok said, adding that "casualties are up to 10."
ny: "Adabwera ambiri ndi mphamvu zozimitsa moto (ndipo) adalanda anthu ammudzi," atero a Hassan Chibok, mtsogoleri wa anthu ammudzi. Asilikali a gulu lankhondo lapafupi adatumizidwa kuti athetse chiwembucho koma "zowonongeka zidachitika," adatero Chibok, ndikuwonjezera kuti "ovulala afika 10."

en: Another resident Yana Galang said at least seven people were killed in the latest violence before the Nigerian military intervened.
ny: Wina wokhalamo Yana Galang adati anthu osachepera asanu ndi awiri adaphedwa paziwawa zaposachedwa asitikali aku Nigeria asanalowererepo.

en: Nigerian police did not immediately respond to a request for confirmation of the attack.
ny: Apolisi aku Nigeria sanayankhe mwachangu pempho lofuna kutsimikizira za chiwembucho.

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province. The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.
ny: Nigeria, dziko lokhala ndi anthu ambiri mu Africa lomwe lili ndi anthu 206 miliyoni, likupitilizabe kulimbana ndi zigawenga zazaka 10 kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa zigawenga zachisilamu za Boko Haram ndi mphukira zake, Islamic State West Africa Province. Anthu ochita monyanyira akulimbana kuti akhazikitse malamulo a Shariah ndi kuletsa maphunziro a azungu.

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.
ny: Anthu oposa 35,000 afa ndipo mamiliyoni ambiri athawa kwawo chifukwa cha ziwawa zoopsa, malinga ndi bungwe la UN Development Program.

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
ny: Purezidenti wa Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari adanena kumayambiriro kwa sabata ino kuti nkhondo yolimbana ndi zigawenga "yatsala pang'ono kutha," ponena za kumenyana kwa asilikali ndi kupanduka kwa zikwi zikwi za omenyana, omwe ena mwa akatswiri akuti akuika zida zawo pansi chifukwa cha kulimbana mkati mwa nkhondo. gulu la jihadi.

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.
ny: Chiwawacho, komabe, chikupitirirabe m'madera akumalire ndi madera omwe ali pafupi ndi chigawo cha Lake Chad, malo olimba a gulu logwirizana ndi Islamic State, ISWAP.

en: "Things are getting worse" in Kautukari village in Chibok and adjourning areas closer to the forest, said community leader Chibok, saying the extremists' presence near the forest is a contributing factor.
ny: "Zinthu zikuipiraipira" mâ€TMmudzi mwa Kautukari ku Chibok komanso madera oyandikana ndi nkhalangoyi, adatero mtsogoleri wa anthu ammudzimo, Chibok, ponena kuti kupezeka kwa zigawenga pafupi ndi nkhalangoyi ndi zomwe zathandizira.

en: Reporting Under Attack in South Sudan, Sudan
ny: Malipoti Akuwopseza ku South Sudan, Sudan

en: Journalists in both Sudan and South Sudan say threats, intimidation and arbitrary arrests are part of everyday life, limiting their ability to inform the public.
ny: Atolankhani ku Sudan ndi South Sudan ati kuwopseza, kuwopseza komanso kumangidwa popanda chifukwa ndi gawo la moyo watsiku ndi tsiku, zomwe zimawalepheretsa kudziwitsa anthu.

en: South Sudan ranks 128th and Sudan ranks 151st out of 180 countries in Reporters Without Borders annual World Press Freedom Index, released Tuesday to coincide with the United Nations annual recognition of World Press Freedom Day. The bigger the number, the worse the environment for news media.
ny: Dziko la South Sudan lili pa nambala 128 ndipo dziko la Sudan lili pa nambala 151 mwa mayiko 180 a Reporters Without Borders pachaka World Press Freedom Index. Chiŵerengerocho chikakulirakulira, m’pamenenso malo oulutsira nkhani amaipiraipira.

en: Irene Ayaa of the Association for Media Development in South Sudan says government censorship in her country is widespread.
ny: Irene Ayaa wa Association for Media Development ku South Sudan ati kuwunika kwa boma m'dziko lake kwafalikira.

en: "Last month, we registered four articles removed from newspapers," she said.
ny: “Mwezi watha, tidalembetsa nkhani zinayi zochotsedwa m’nyuzipepala,” adatero.

en: Between January and March alone, security personnel removed dozens of articles from the Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, editor-in-chief of an English-language daily, told South Sudan in Focus. "They removed stories and we left the space blank. They say why we are not listening to them, so on 17th of March, they suspended the newspaper."
ny: Pakati pa Januware ndi Marichi okha, ogwira ntchito zachitetezo adachotsa zolemba zambiri ku Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, mkonzi wamkulu wa chilankhulo cha Chingerezi tsiku lililonse, adauza South Sudan ku Focus. "Anachotsa nkhani ndipo tidasiya malo opanda kanthu. Akuti chifukwa chiyani sitikuwamvera, ndiye pa 17 Marichi adayimitsa nyuzipepala."

en: In February, a handful of journalists were briefly detained for covering a press conference by opposition lawmakers in parliament. A Juba Monitor newspaper article about the incident was removed by security agents at the printing plant.
ny: M’mwezi wa February, atolankhani ochepa anatsekeredwa m’ndende mwachidule chifukwa chofotokoza msonkhano wa atolankhani wa aphungu otsutsa ku nyumba ya malamulo. Nkhani ya nyuzipepala ya Juba Monitor yokhudza zomwe zinachitika idachotsedwa ndi achitetezo pamalo osindikizira.

en: "We dont have freedom of the press in the country," Namiriano said. "The solution is let us do our work as media houses. We have the code of conduct, we have the media law to guide us, and removal of stories is really very bad."
ny: "Tilibe ufulu wa atolankhani mdziko muno," adatero Namiriano. "Yankho lake ndiloti tiyeni tigwire ntchito yathu ngati nyumba zofalitsa nkhani. Tili ndi malamulo a khalidwe, tili ndi malamulo ofalitsa nkhani kuti atitsogolere, ndipo kuchotsa nkhani ndizoipa kwambiri."

en: South Sudans information minister, Michael Makuei, insists press freedom is alive and well in his country.
ny: Nduna yofalitsa nkhani ku South Sudan a Michael Makuei ati ufulu wa atolankhani ukuyenda bwino m'dziko lake.

en: "South Sudan is the only place where journalists are free, where they enjoy absolute freedom according to the law. I say, 'according to the law,' because there is nothing absolute in this world," Makuei told South Sudan in Focus.
ny: "South Sudan ndi malo okhawo omwe atolankhani ali omasuka, komwe amakhala ndi ufulu wonse malinga ndi lamulo. Ndimati, 'malinga ndi lamulo,' chifukwa palibe mtheradi padziko lapansi, "Makuei anauza South Sudan ku Focus.

en: The United Nations Commission on Human Rights refutes that assertion. In a report issued last October, it said the government is harassing activists, journalists and their families, limiting their activities and targeting their work and finances. South Sudan is one of the most dangerous places in the world to be a journalist, according to the commission.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations loona za Ufulu wa Anthu likutsutsa mfundo imeneyi. Mu lipoti lomwe linatulutsidwa mu October watha, linanena kuti boma likuzunza anthu ogwira ntchito, atolankhani ndi mabanja awo, kuchepetsa ntchito zawo ndikuyang'ana ntchito ndi ndalama zawo. South Sudan ndi amodzi mwa malo owopsa kwambiri padziko lapansi kukhala mtolankhani, malinga ndi bungweli.

en: "South Sudan has a lot of work to do to establish and solidify the institutions that are critical to a well-functioning democratic state," David Renz, charge daffaires for the U.S. Embassy in South Sudan, said in a statement Tuesday, adding that the U.S. remains deeply concerned about the state of press freedom in South Sudan.
ny: "South Sudan ili ndi ntchito yambiri yoti ichite kuti ikhazikitse ndi kulimbitsa mabungwe omwe ali ofunikira kwambiri kuti dziko la demokalase liziyenda bwino," a David Renz, a daffaires ku ofesi ya kazembe wa US ku South Sudan, adatero Lachiwiri, ndikuwonjezera kuti. US ikadali yokhudzidwa kwambiri ndi momwe ufulu wa atolankhani ku South Sudan ulili.

en: "We have seen some of the local radio stations shut down over very trivial matters," Renz said. "And we also are aware that journalists of radio and television and even social media are self-censored" and wary of local and national governments actions "to penalize journalists who say things the government would prefer that they not say."
ny: "Tawona mawayilesi ena akumaloko atatsekedwa pazinthu zazing'ono," adatero Renz. "Ndipo tikudziwanso kuti atolankhani a pawailesi ndi wailesi yakanema komanso ngakhale malo ochezera a pa Intaneti amadziyesa okha" komanso amasamala ndi zomwe maboma ang'onoang'ono ndi mayiko akuchita "kulanga atolankhani omwe amanena zinthu zomwe boma lingafune kuti asanene."

en: Further complications from coup
ny: Mavuto ena obwera chifukwa cha coup

en: In Sudan, journalists in the capital city of Khartoum say harassment and threats have increased since the October 25 military takeover.
ny: Ku Sudan, atolankhani mu likulu la Khartoum ati kuzunzidwa ndi ziwopsezo zawonjezeka kuyambira pa Okutobala 25 pomwe asitikali adalanda.

en: Shoggi Abdulazeem, an investigative journalist in Sudan, said he received a death threat in November and was warned not to speak to international media.
ny: Shoggi Abdulazeem, mtolankhani wofufuza ku Sudan, adati adalandira chiwopsezo chakupha mu Novembala ndipo adachenjezedwa kuti asalankhule ndi atolankhani apadziko lonse lapansi.

en: "I was hosting live on Al Jazeera and after leaving their office, eight armed security men followed me in a pickup. They surrounded my car," Abdulazeem said. He told South Sudan in Focus he was blindfolded and moved around "for more than two hours" and was ordered "not to criticize the military again."
ny: "Ndinali ndikukhala ndi moyo pa Al Jazeera ndipo nditachoka ku ofesi yawo, asilikali asanu ndi atatu achitetezo adanditsatira m'galimoto. Anazungulira galimoto yanga, "adatero Abdulazeem. Adauza South Sudan ku Focus kuti adaphimbidwa m'maso ndikuyendayenda "kwa maola opitilira awiri" ndipo adalamulidwa kuti "asadzudzulenso asitikali."

en: Covering pro-democracy protests in Sudan continues to be a dangerous endeavor, Abdulazeem said.
ny: Kuphimba ziwonetsero zolimbikitsa demokalase ku Sudan kukupitilizabe kuchita zinthu zowopsa, Abdulazeem adatero.

en: "Many newspapers, TV channels and radio stations received directives not to host or conduct interviews with some named individuals" who criticize military leaders, Abdulazeem said. He added, "There are intelligence officers who are assigned to monitor this situation."
ny: "Manyuzipepala ambiri, ma TV ndi mawayilesi adalandira malangizo oti asamachite kapena kufunsa anthu ena otchulidwa" omwe amadzudzula atsogoleri ankhondo, adatero Abdulazeem. Iye adaonjeza kuti: “Pali akuluakulu a intelligence omwe apatsidwa ntchito yowunika momwe zinthu zilili.

en: Aisha Assamani, an executive member of the independent Sudanese Media Network, told South Sudan in Focus he has recorded more than 10 attacks on journalists and media houses since last year's coup.
ny: Aisha Assamani, membala wamkulu wa bungwe lodziyimira pawokha la Sudanese Media Network, adauza South Sudan ku Focus kuti adalemba ziwonetsero zopitilira 10 za atolankhani ndi nyumba zofalitsa nkhani kuyambira pomwe zidachitika chaka chatha.

en: "They are targeting freedom of speech with so much excessive force," Assamani said. "The majority of our journalists now are fearful and their lives are in danger. Most of them remain anonymous due to the danger of the situation."
ny: "Akulunjika ufulu wolankhula ndi mphamvu zambiri," adatero Assamani. "Atolankhani athu ambiri pano ali ndi mantha ndipo miyoyo yawo ili pachiwopsezo. Ambiri mwa iwo sakudziwika chifukwa cha kuopsa kwa zomwe zikuchitika."

en: On December 30, Sudanese security forces stormed the offices of three television stations — al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq — firing tear gas, assaulting staff and destroying broadcast equipment, according to local news media. That same day, security forces detained al-Sharq correspondents Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for hours before releasing them.
ny: Pa Disembala 30, asitikali achitetezo aku Sudan adalowa m'maofesi atatu a wailesi yakanema - al-Arabiya, al-Hadath ndi al-Sharq - kuwombera utsi okhetsa misozi, kumenya antchito ndikuwononga zida zoulutsira mawu, malinga ndi atolankhani akumaloko. Tsiku lomwelo, asitikali achitetezo adasunga olemba al-Sharq a Maha Al-Talb ndi Sally Othman kwa maola ambiri asanawatulutse.

en: On January 16, Sudanese authorities withdrew the broadcast license of Al Jazeera Live and closed its office in Khartoum. A letter from the Information Ministry to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan attributed the closing to an "unprofessional approach" and media content that "harmed the countrys higher interests and national security." The Doha-based network condemned the closure.
ny: Pa Januware 16, akuluakulu aku Sudan adachotsa chilolezo cha Al Jazeera Live ndikutseka ofesi yake ku Khartoum. Kalata yochokera ku Unduna wa Zazidziwitso kupita kwa mkulu wa kanema wawayilesi wa Al Jazeera ku Sudan idati kutsekedwaku kudachitika chifukwa cha "njira yosayenera" komanso zofalitsa zomwe "zinawononga zofuna zamayiko komanso chitetezo cha dziko." Network yochokera ku Doha idatsutsa kutsekedwaku.

en: In February, Sudanese authorities arrested a group of BBC reporters in Khartoum and questioned them for several hours before releasing them.
ny: Mu February, akuluakulu a boma la Sudan anamanga gulu la atolankhani a BBC ku Khartoum ndikuwafunsa mafunso kwa maola angapo asanawatulutse.

en: VOA repeatedly called Sudans government for comment, but those calls — to Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, press advisor to military leader Abdul Fattah al-Burhan — went unanswered.
ny: VOA idayitana boma la Sudan mobwerezabwereza kuti lipereke ndemanga, koma mafoni awo - kwa Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, mlangizi wa atolankhani kwa mtsogoleri wankhondo Abdul Fattah al-Burhan - sanayankhidwe.

en: Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar reported from Juba, South Sudan.
ny: Michael Atit adanenanso kuchokera ku Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng ndi Manyang David Mayar adanenanso kuchokera ku Juba, South Sudan.

en: At Least 30 Burundian AU Soldiers Killed in Al-Shabab Attack, Official Says
ny: Pafupifupi Asilikali 30 aku Burundi AU Aphedwa Pachiwopsezo cha Al-Shabab, Wapolisi watero.

en: At least 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in Tuesday's attack by al-Shabab militants on an African Union base in southern Somalia, according to a Burundian official.
ny: Asilikali pafupifupi 30 a mdziko la Burundi aphedwa ndipo ena 20 avulala pa zigawenga za al-Shabab zomwe zachitika Lachiwiri pa bwalo la bungwe la African Union kumwera kwa dziko la Somalia, malinga ndi mkulu wina mdziko la Burundi.

en: The official, who requested anonymity because he is not allowed to speak to media, told VOA Somali that 10 soldiers died on the spot, and the rest of the soldiers succumbed to their wounds. He confirmed that other soldiers are still missing.
ny: Mkuluyu yemwe wapempha kuti asatchulidwe dzina lake chifukwa saloledwa kuyankhula ndi atolankhani, wauza VOA Somali kuti asitikali 10 afera pomwepo, ndipo asilikali ena onse adafera pa mabala awo. Iye watsimikiza kuti asilikali ena akusowabe.

en: Al-Shabab said it killed 173 soldiers in the attack on the AU base in the village of El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu. The casualty figure has not been independently verified. A separate source told VOA Somali that 161 soldiers were at the camp at the time of attack. The Burundian official confirmed that number.
ny: Al-Shabab yati idapha asitikali 173 pachiwembu chomwe chidachitika ku bwalo la AU m'mudzi wa El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu. Chiwerengero cha ovulala sichinatsimikizidwe paokha. Bungwe lina lawuza VOA Somali kuti asitikali 161 anali pa msasawo panthawi yachiwembu. Mkulu wa ku Burundi adatsimikiza za nambalayi.

en: The Burundian official told VOA Somali that the soldiers had intelligence al-Shabab was gathering in a nearby village about 48 hours prior to the attack. He said the soldiers prepared to defend themselves and dug trenches.
ny: Mkulu wa dziko la Burundi adauza VOA Somali kuti asitikali amtundu wa al-Shabab anali atasonkhana m'mudzi wapafupi pafupifupi maola 48 chiwembuchi chisanachitike. Iye adati asilikaliwo adakonzekera kudziteteza ndikukumba ngalande.

en: He said what caught the soldiers by surprise was the enormity of al-Shabab explosives detonated at the camp. He said the militants used three truck bombs, one of which fell into a ditch. He estimated the militants detonated about 20 kilograms of explosives, and that 450 militants overran the camp.
ny: Iye adati chomwe chidadabwitsa asitikaliwo ndi kuchuluka kwa mabomba a al-Shabab omwe adaphulitsidwa pamsasawo. Iye wati zigawengazo zidagwiritsa ntchito mabomba atatu a galimoto, imodzi mwa zidazi idagwera m’mbuna. Anayerekeza kuti zigawengazo zidaphulitsa pafupifupi ma kilogalamu 20 a zophulika, ndikuti zigawenga 450 zidalanda msasawo.

en: The official said the suicide truck bombs caused most of the casualties.
ny: Mkuluyu adati mabomba omwe adadzipha adayambitsa anthu ambiri ovulala.

en: Earlier, the government of Burundi reported 10 of their soldiers were killed, with five others missing and 25 injured. Burundi also said 20 al-Shabab militants were killed in the attack.
ny: M'mbuyomu, boma la Burundi linanena kuti asitikali 10 aphedwa, ena asanu adasowa ndipo 25 adavulala. Dziko la Burundi latinso zigawenga 20 za al-Shabab zaphedwa pa chiwembuchi.

en: On Twitter, Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye said there are no words strong enough to condemn the terrorist attack against the Burundian contingent. He wrote, "I join with all of Africa which has just lost sons and daughters … to console the hard-hit families."
ny: Pa Twitter, Purezidenti wa Burundi Evariste Ndayishimiye adati palibe mawu amphamvu odzudzula zigawenga zomwe zikuchita motsutsana ndi gulu la Burundi. Iye analemba kuti, "Ndikugwirizana ndi Africa yonse yomwe yangotaya ana aamuna ndi aakazi ...

en: The African Union, the Somali government and the embassy of the United States in Mogadishu have all strongly condemned the al-Shabab attack.
ny: Bungwe la African Union, boma la Somalia komanso ofesi ya kazembe wa dziko la United States ku Mogadishu onse adzudzula mwamphamvu chiwembu cha al-Shabab.

en: AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian soldiers killed, and said the "heinous" attack will not lessen support of AU forces to Somalia.
ny: Mkulu wa AU Moussa Faki Mahamat adapereka msonkho kwa asitikali aku Burundi omwe adaphedwa, ndipo adati kuwukirako "koyipa" sikuchepetsa thandizo la asitikali a AU ku Somalia.

en: The Somali ministry of foreign affairs called on the international community to increase and provide higher-end capability to Somali security forces and AU forces so they can effectively combat terrorism in Somalia.
ny: Unduna wa Zachilendo ku Somalia udapempha mayiko kuti awonjezere ndikupereka luso lapamwamba kwa asitikali achitetezo aku Somalia ndi asitikali a AU kuti athe kuthana ndi uchigawenga ku Somalia.

en: The U.S. embassy in Mogadishu said the U.S. extends condolences to the families of the troops killed and wished a quick recovery to those injured.
ny: Kazembe wa US ku Mogadishu adati US ikupereka chipepeso kwa mabanja a asitikali omwe aphedwa ndipo ikufuna achire mwachangu kwa omwe avulala.

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that Tuesday's fighting at the camp was the heaviest the area has seen.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, adauza VOA kuti nkhondo yomwe yachitika Lachiwiri pamsasawo ndiyomwe yakula kwambiri mderali.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said, explaining that the violence also killed two civilians and injured 10 others. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: “Kumenyana kotere sikunachitikepo m’derali,” adatero, pofotokoza kuti ziwawazo zidaphanso anthu wamba awiri ndi kuvulaza ena 10. "Kunali ndewu yoopsa."

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Chochitikachi chinali choyamba chachikulu cha al-Shabab kuwukira asitikali a AU kuyambira pomwe gululi lidasintha dzina ndi momwe amagwirira ntchito mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, gave it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to the Somali government. The mission's mandate runs through the end of 2024.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe lidavomereza ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia, idapereka udindo wochepetsa chiwopsezo cha al-Shabab, kuthandizira kulimbikitsa mphamvu kwa asitikali aku Somalia, ndikugawana magawo achitetezo. ku boma la Somalia. Ntchito ya mishoniyi idzatha kumapeto kwa 2024.

en: This story comes from VOA's Somali and Central African services.
ny: Nkhaniyi ikuchokera ku VOA ku Somali ndi Central Africa.

en: Kenya Trains Domestic Workers in Middle East About Rights
ny: Kenya Imaphunzitsa Ogwira Ntchito Zam'nyumba ku Middle East Za Ufulu

en: Kenyan authorities are training domestic workers who accept jobs in the Middle East about their rights after years of reported abuses there, including beatings, rapes and deaths.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma ku Kenya amaphunzitsa anthu ogwira ntchito zapakhomo omwe amavomereza ntchito ku Middle East za ufulu wawo pambuyo pa zaka zambiri za nkhanza zomwe zanenedwa kumeneko, kuphatikizapo kumenyedwa, kugwiriridwa ndi kuphedwa.

en: It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a domestic worker for three years.
ny: Patha chaka chimodzi kuchokera pomwe Bernard Njenga adamva kuti mkazi wake, Esther Thuku, adamwalira ku Saudi Arabia, komwe adagwira ntchito yapakhomo kwa zaka zitatu.

en: Saudi authorities reported that his wife had committed suicide at her employer's home, Njenga said, but he believes the mother of four was murdered.
ny: Akuluakulu aku Saudi adanena kuti mkazi wake adadzipha kunyumba kwa abwana ake, Njenga adati, koma akukhulupirira kuti mayi wa ana anayi adaphedwa.

en: Njenga said his wife's body did not have any marks that would show that she had hanged herself. It appeared the body had been buried because it was very dirty and looked like she had been stabbed on the left side, he added.
ny: Njenga adati thupi la mkazi wake linalibe zizindikiro zomwe zingasonyeze kuti adadzipachika. Zikuoneka kuti thupilo linali litakwiriridwa chifukwa linali lodetsedwa kwambiri ndipo likuwoneka ngati labayidwa kumanzere, anawonjezera motero.

en: Kenyan authorities say that since November, at least 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East. Most of those deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia, according to labor officials.
ny: Akuluakulu aku Kenya ati kuyambira Novembala, osachepera 23 ogwira ntchito zapakhomo amwalira akugwira ntchito ku Middle East. Ambiri mwa anthu omwe anamwalira anachitika ku Saudi Arabia, malinga ndi akuluakulu ogwira ntchito.

en: Saudi authorities have reported that all 23 of those deaths resulted from cardiac arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu aku Saudi ati anthu onse 23 amwalira chifukwa cha kumangidwa kwamtima.

en: In April of 2020, rights advocacy group Amnesty International reported that Kenyans who have jobs as domestic workers in the Middle East often complain of lack of payment, forced labor, physical abuse, rape and dangerous working conditions.
ny: Mu Epulo 2020, gulu lomenyera ufulu la Amnesty International linanena kuti anthu aku Kenya omwe amagwira ntchito zapakhomo ku Middle East nthawi zambiri amadandaula chifukwa chosowa malipiro, kukakamizidwa, kuzunzidwa, kugwiriridwa komanso malo oopsa.

en: Now, Kenya is offering safety training for domestic workers who take jobs abroad.
ny: Tsopano, Kenya ikupereka maphunziro achitetezo kwa ogwira ntchito zapakhomo omwe amagwira ntchito kunja.

en: "When you don't train them, basically, you are exposing them to a lot of exploitation and abuse," said Edith Murogo, director at East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi. "Part of the training also includes labor rights awareness. They have to know how to bargain and talk to employees about decent terms and conditions of employment."
ny: "Mukapanda kuwaphunzitsa, kwenikweni, mumawawonetsa kuzunzidwa ndi kuzunzidwa," adatero Edith Murogo, mkulu wa East Africa Institute of Homecare Management ku Nairobi. "Mbali ina ya maphunzirowa ikuphatikizanso kuzindikira za ufulu wa anthu ogwira ntchito. Ayenera kudziwa momwe angagulitsire ndi kukambirana ndi ogwira ntchito pazantchito zabwino."

en: An estimated 30,000 Kenyans migrate to the Middle East to find work each year.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 a ku Kenya amasamukira ku Middle East kuti akapeze ntchito chaka chilichonse.

en: Kenya's cabinet secretary for labor, Simon Chelugui, said his department is working with Saudi officials on labor law reforms.
ny: Mlembi wa nduna ya zantchito ku Kenya, a Simon Chelugui, adati dipatimenti yake ikugwira ntchito ndi akuluakulu aku Saudi pakusintha malamulo a ntchito.

en: "We would want them also to upscale their law to protect workers and employers equally, not to discriminate and have the attitude of the employer is right always," Chelugui said. "Number two is the pay is reasonable and commensurate to the work."
ny: "Tikufuna kuti nawonso akweze malamulo awo kuti ateteze ogwira ntchito ndi owalemba ntchito mofanana, osasankhana komanso kukhala ndi maganizo a olemba anzawo ntchito nthawi zonse," adatero Chelugui. "Nambala yachiwiri ndiyo malipiro ake ndi oyenera komanso ogwirizana ndi ntchitoyo."

en: VOA reached out to the Saudi embassy in Nairobi for comment on alleged mistreatment and deaths of Kenyan workers. In an email response, the embassy said the kingdom does not condone illegal and ill treatment of anyone and said Riyadh is working with Nairobi to protect citizens from any offense.
ny: VOA idafikira ku ofesi ya kazembe wa Saudi ku Nairobi kuti afotokozepo za nkhanza zomwe akuti akuzunzidwa komanso kufa kwa ogwira ntchito aku Kenya. Poyankha pa imelo, kazembeyo adati ufumuwo sulola kuzunzidwa kosaloledwa ndi aliyense ndipo adati Riyadh ikugwira ntchito ndi Nairobi kuteteza nzika ku zolakwa zilizonse.

en: Meanwhile, officials say with an estimated 2 million young people graduating each year, according to national figures, and only about 800,000 new jobs, many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to find work.
ny: Pakadali pano, akuluakulu a boma ati ndi achinyamata pafupifupi 2 miliyoni omwe amamaliza maphunziro awo chaka chilichonse, malinga ndi ziwerengero za dziko, ndipo pafupifupi 800,000 ntchito zatsopano, aku Kenya ambiri apitiriza kupita kunja kukafuna ntchito.

en: South Africa Urges Africa’s First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant to Keep Its Doors Open
ny: Dziko la South Africa Likulimbikitsa Chomera Choyamba cha Katemera ku Africa cha COVID-19 Kuti Chitseke Zitseko Zake

en: South African health officials are urging COVID-19 vaccine manufacturer Aspen to keep its plant in the Eastern Cape province open. This follows a Reuters article quoting Aspens senior director saying they may have to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.
ny: Akuluakulu azaumoyo ku South Africa apempha wopanga katemera wa COVID-19 Aspen kuti asunge chomera chake ku Eastern Cape. Izi zikutsatira nkhani ya Reuters yogwira mawu mkulu wa Aspens akunena kuti akuyenera kutseka chifukwa sipanakhalepo malamulo a katemera wawo wa COVID.

en: A South African-owned subsidiary of pharmaceutical giant Aspen struck a deal with American company Johnson & Johnson in March to package, price, sell and distribute its vaccine in Africa.
ny: Kampani ina ya ku South Africa ya chimphona chamankhwala cha Aspen idachita mgwirizano ndi kampani yaku America Johnson & Johnson mu Marichi kuti ipange, kugulitsa, kugulitsa ndi kugawa katemera wake ku Africa.

en: This vaccine was rebranded as Aspenovax.
ny: Katemerayu adasinthidwa kukhala Aspenovax.

en: The move was hailed by many as there had been much concern about Africas reliance on imported vaccines which were often costly and at times in short supply.
ny: Izi zidayamikiridwa ndi anthu ambiri chifukwa pakhala pali nkhawa yayikulu pakudalira kwa Africa kudalira katemera wochokera kunja omwe nthawi zambiri amakhala okwera mtengo komanso osowa nthawi zina.

en: But there have been no orders for Aspenovax. South Africas National Health Department Spokesperson Foster Mohale said the lack of orders is due to low vaccination rates not only at home, but globally.
ny: Koma sipanakhalepo madongosolo a Aspenovax. Mneneri wa dipatimenti ya zaumoyo ku South Africa Foster Mohale adati kusowa kwa malamulo kudachitika chifukwa cha kuchepa kwa katemera osati kunyumba kokha, komanso padziko lonse lapansi.

en: "Vaccine hesitancy is one of the factors which contribute to these low vaccination rates or demand for more vaccines which also affect the production. Because obviously we understand that they are in a business, they cant keep on producing vaccines when they know that the demand for vaccines is very low. So, we understand the situation where they are, and we sympathize with them," he said.
ny: "Kukayikakayika kwa katemera ndi chimodzi mwazinthu zomwe zimapangitsa kuti katemerayu achepe kapena kufunikira kwa katemera wambiri zomwe zimakhudzanso kupanga. Chifukwa mwachiwonekere timamvetsetsa kuti ali mubizinesi, sangathe kupitiliza kupanga katemera akudziwa kuti kufunikira Katemera ndi wotsika kwambiri. Chifukwa chake, timamvetsetsa momwe alili, ndipo timawamvera chisoni, "adatero.

en: Mohale said for now, South Africa has enough vaccines. He adds that in March, 100,000 vaccines expired. And more are due to expire in June and July.
ny: Mohale adati pakadali pano, South Africa ili ndi katemera wokwanira. Ananenanso kuti mu Marichi, katemera 100,000 adatha. Ndipo zina zikuyembekezeka kutha mu June ndi Julayi.

en: However, he said that Aspens vaccine plant is important because no one knows what the future holds.
ny: Komabe, adati chomera cha katemera wa Aspens ndichofunika chifukwa palibe amene akudziwa zomwe zili m'tsogolo.

en: "We will try to engage them not to rush their decision precisely because we anticipate especially our scientists, our epidemiologists, we anticipate that the fifth wave might hit the country, South Africa, during the winter season which is a few weeks away from now. As you can see the number of daily COVID-19 patients has been rising for the past seven days," he said.
ny: "Tiyesetsa kuwalimbikitsa kuti asafulumire chisankho chawo chifukwa tikuyembekezera makamaka asayansi athu, akatswiri athu a miliri, tikuyembekeza kuti funde lachisanu likhoza kugunda dziko la South Africa, nthawi yachisanu yomwe yatsala milungu ingapo kuti ifike pano. Monga mukuwonera kuchuluka kwa odwala a COVID-19 tsiku lililonse kwakhala kukwera kwa masiku asanu ndi awiri apitawa, "adatero.

en: Professor Petro Terblanche, who is the managing director of South African company, Afrigen, which in a continent-first made an mRNA COVID vaccine using Modernas data — said the situation at Aspen is a tragedy for the industry.
ny: Pulofesa Petro Terblanche, yemwe ndi woyang'anira wamkulu wa kampani yaku South Africa, Afrigen, yemwe poyamba adapanga katemera wa mRNA COVID pogwiritsa ntchito zidziwitso za Modernas - adati zomwe zikuchitika ku Aspen ndizovuta kumakampani.

en: "This is just indicating again how important it is that this continent looks at policy reform. This is about how are we going to make sure that we give preferential procurement to local companies. How are we going to make sure that we create a marketplace and eco-system that will absorb local capacity? Otherwise, we will not have capacity locally in a sustainable manner and were going to get the next pandemic and we will be unprepared, and we will not have health security," said Terblanche.
ny: "Izi zikungosonyezanso kufunikira kofunikira kuti dziko la Africa liyang'ane za kusintha kwa ndondomeko. Izi ndi za momwe tidzawonetsetsa kuti tikupereka zinthu zogulira mwachisawawa ku makampani a m'deralo. Tiwonetsetse bwanji kuti tikupanga msika? Kupanda kutero, sitikhala ndi mphamvu mdera lanu mokhazikika ndipo tikhala ndi mliri wotsatira ndipo tidzakhala osakonzekera, ndipo sitidzakhala ndi chitetezo chaumoyo, "atero Terblanche.

en: She believes money should also be put into educating people on the importance of vaccines.
ny: Akukhulupirira kuti ndalama ziyeneranso kuperekedwa pophunzitsa anthu kufunika kwa katemera.

en: "We need to ensure that we also put effort into advocacy for vaccination. Because we now have 17% of the continent that is vaccinated. We need to get them to at least 40% to ensure that we fully arrest this pandemic," she said.
ny: "Tiyenera kuwonetsetsa kuti tikuyikanso khama pakulimbikitsa katemera. Chifukwa tsopano tili ndi 17% ya dziko lonse lapansi lomwe lili ndi katemera. Tiyenera kuwafikitsa osachepera 40% kuti tiwonetsetse kuti tikumanga bwino mliriwu," adatero. .

en: Mohale was unable to say when the Health Department would be meeting with Aspens executives.
ny: Mohale sanathe kunena kuti ndi liti pomwe unduna wa zaumoyo udzakumana ndi akuluakulu a Aspens.

en: Journalists in Ethiopia Say Press Freedom is at 'Crossroads'
ny: Atolankhani ku Ethiopia Ati Press Freedom ili pa 'Crossroads'

en: When Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based group that promotes press freedom, raised Ethiopia's ranking in its international press freedom index by 40 places.
ny: Pamene Prime Minister waku Ethiopia Abiy Ahmed adatenga udindo zaka zinayi zapitazo, gulu la Reporters Without Borders, lochokera ku Paris lomwe limalimbikitsa ufulu wa atolankhani, lidakweza udindo wa Ethiopia pazambiri za ufulu wa atolankhani padziko lonse lapansi ndi malo 40.

en: It was a giant leap forward after decades of media repression by the state. But since the war between federal government forces and rebels in the Tigray region began in late 2020, Ethiopia has dropped in the rankings.
ny: Zinali zodumphira patsogolo pambuyo pazaka makumi ambiri akuponderezedwa ndi boma. Koma kuyambira pomwe nkhondo yapakati pa magulu ankhondo aboma ndi zigawenga mdera la Tigray idayamba kumapeto kwa 2020, Ethiopia idatsika.

en: To mark World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA spoke to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to carry out their work.
ny: Pokumbukira tsiku la World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA idalankhula ndi atolankhani aku Ethiopia za momwe alili omasuka kugwira ntchito yawo.

en: Elias Meseret, who worked with the Associated Press, told VOA that press freedom in Ethiopia is at a crossroads.
ny: Elias Meseret, yemwe adagwira ntchito ndi Associated Press, adauza VOA kuti ufulu wa atolankhani ku Ethiopia uli pamphambano.

en: "Overall, I can say that lack of professionalism and also extreme views have become the hallmarks of the state of the media in Ethiopia, at this point in time," Elias said. "For this to change, I think the government has a responsibility to let media professionals do their job freely. This means without any harassment and intimidation."
ny: "Ponseponse, nditha kunena kuti kusowa kwaukadaulo komanso malingaliro onyanyira akhala zidziwitso zapa media ku Ethiopia, pakadali pano," adatero Elias. "Kuti izi zisinthe, ndikuganiza kuti boma lili ndi udindo wolola akatswiri ofalitsa nkhani kuti azigwira ntchito yawo momasuka. Izi zikutanthauza kuti popanda kuzunzidwa kapena kuwopseza."

en: Assegid Mulugeta, a radio presenter for the government-owned broadcaster, the Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, or EBC, thinks press freedom has improved in recent years. In 2018, the prime minister released all journalists from prison, However, that progress has since been reversed according to Ethiopian journalists, who documented that 46 journalists were detained in the country in 2021, making Ethiopia one of the worst jailers of journalists in Africa.
ny: Assegid Mulugeta, wofalitsa wailesi ya wailesi ya boma, Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, kapena EBC, akuganiza kuti ufulu wa atolankhani wapita patsogolo zaka zaposachedwapa. Mu 2018, Prime Minister adatulutsa atolankhani onse mndende, Komabe, kupita patsogolo kumeneku kwasinthidwa malinga ndi atolankhani aku Ethiopia, omwe adalemba kuti atolankhani 46 adamangidwa mdziko muno mu 2021, zomwe zidapangitsa Ethiopia kukhala m'modzi mwa osunga ndende oyipa kwambiri ku Africa.

en: The state-backed Ethiopian Human Rights Commission released a statement Tuesday expressing concern for journalist Gobeze Sisay, whose whereabouts are unknown since plainclothes officers arrested him on Sunday.
ny: Bungwe lothandizidwa ndi boma la Ethiopian Human Rights Commission latulutsa chikalata Lachiwiri lodandaula ndi mtolankhani Gobeze Sisay, yemwe sakudziwika komwe ali kuyambira pomwe apolisi osavala yunifolomu adamumanga Lamlungu.

en: Another journalist, Amir Aman Kiyaro, and his colleague Thomas Engida were arrested in November and released in March. But they still may face years in prison if convicted of violating the country's wartime state of emergency law and anti-terrorism law.
ny: Mtolankhani wina, Amir Aman Kiyaro, ndi mnzake Thomas Engida adamangidwa mu Novembala ndikumasulidwa mu Marichi. Koma atha kukhala m'ndende kwa zaka zambiri ngati atapezeka olakwa pophwanya malamulo okhudza zadzidzidzi komanso odana ndi uchigawenga.

en: Still, radio presenter Assegid said he sees improvement.
ny: Komabe, wowonetsa wailesi, Assegid adati akuwona kusintha.

en: Under the pre-2018 government where the Tigray People's Liberation Front political party dominated, he said, there were "lots of stifling systems, there was lots of censorship, there was beating of journalists, there was lots of pressures and censorship against journalists and now we are seeing the booming of YouTube and online media … this is a good thing to hear."
ny: Pansi pa boma la 2018 lisanafike pomwe chipani cha Tigray People's Liberation Front chinkalamulira, adati, "pali njira zambiri zopunthwitsa, kuwunika kochulukirapo, kumenyedwa kwa atolankhani, kukakamizidwa ndi kuwunika kwa atolankhani ndipo tsopano. tikuwona kuchulukirachulukira kwa YouTube ndi media pa intaneti ... ichi ndi chinthu chabwino kumva. "

en: Sisay Sahlu, editor at The Reporter, a private newspaper based in Addis Ababa, said independent media often get stonewalled by the government.
ny: Sisay Sahlu, mkonzi ku The Reporter, nyuzipepala yapayekha yomwe ili ku Addis Ababa, adati zofalitsa zodziyimira pawokha nthawi zambiri zimasokonezedwa ndi boma.

en: "My experience and the experience of my friends from public media is totally different," he said. "As a private newspaper employee, it's tough to get information for me."
ny: "Zochitika zanga komanso zomwe anzanga amakumana nazo pagulu la anthu ndizosiyana kwambiri," adatero. "Monga wogwira ntchito m'nyuzipepala, ndizovuta kuti ndidziwe zambiri."

en: Sisay said that for a simple story, he might call 10 officials, who all may be unwilling to answer his questions.
ny: Sisay adati chifukwa cha nkhani yosavuta, atha kuyimba akuluakulu 10, omwe mwina sangafune kuyankha mafunso ake.

en: "When you call them, they don't give us any clue," he said. "We write a letter to them, they are not talking. Finally, when we publish [the story], they are coming to our office. Sometimes they are on the phone and start a verbal fight. Either they are giving us information or not."
ny: Ukawaimbira sakutiuza chilichonse,” adatero. “Timawalembera kalata sakulankhula, pomaliza tikamasindikiza [nkhaniyo] akubwera kuofesi yathu, nthawi zina amaimba foni n’kuyamba kumenyana ndi mawu, mwina akutiuza kapena ayi. ."

en: A government spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
ny: Mneneri wa boma sanapezekepo kuti ayankhepo kanthu.

en: In the latest World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia is ranked 114th, down 13 places from its ranking in 2021.
ny: Mu World Press Freedom Index yaposachedwa, Ethiopia ili pa nambala 114, kutsika malo 13 kuchokera pomwe idasankhidwa mu 2021.

en: Editor's note: The story has been updated with additional information about the arrests of journalists.
ny: Ndemanga za mkonzi: Nkhaniyi yasinthidwa ndi zina zokhuza kumangidwa kwa atolankhani.

en: As Tigray Aid Blockade Continues, Nearby Areas Also in Desperate Need of Food, Medicine
ny: Pamene Tigray Aid Blockade Ikupitilira, Madera Oyandikira Komanso Akufunika Chakudya, Mankhwala

en: Despite Ethiopias declared humanitarian cease-fire with Tigrayan rebels, aid groups said they are struggling to get food and medicine to those in need. Even outside the worst affected areas in Tigray, which are off limits to reporters, providing aid is fraught with risks and challenges.
ny: Ngakhale anthu aku Ethiopia adalengeza kuti asiya kumenyana ndi zigawenga za ku Tigrayan, magulu othandizira ati akuvutika kuti apeze chakudya ndi mankhwala kwa omwe akufunika thandizo. Ngakhale kunja kwa madera okhudzidwa kwambiri ku Tigray, omwe sali malire kwa olemba nkhani, kupereka chithandizo kumakhala ndi zoopsa komanso zovuta.

en: In Ethiopias northern Amhara region, burned tanks and other ruined military equipment lie at the roadside four months after occupying forces of the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, or TPLF, left the area. As the region recovers from a brutal civil war, the U.N. said some 9.4 million people in the Amhara region and neighboring Afar and Tigray regions need humanitarian assistance. But aid has been slow to arrive.
ny: Ku Etiopiya kumpoto kwa Amhara, akasinja otenthedwa ndi zida zina zankhondo zomwe zidawonongeka zili m'mphepete mwa msewu patadutsa miyezi inayi gulu la Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, kapena TPLF, litachoka m'derali. Pamene chigawochi chikuchira ku nkhondo yapachiweniweni yoopsa, bungwe la UN linanena kuti anthu pafupifupi 9.4 miliyoni m'chigawo cha Amhara ndi madera oyandikana nawo a Afar ndi Tigray akusowa thandizo. Koma thandizo lachedwa kufika.

en: Seventeen-year-old Ahmed Nuru was living in the Oromia region, but said he had to flee after facing persecution for his Amhara ethnicity. He lost his mother when he was young. Last year, his father died after being unable to get lifesaving treatment due to the wars impact on the local health care system.
ny: Ahmed Nuru wazaka khumi ndi zisanu ndi ziwiri amakhala mdera la Oromia, koma adati adathawa atakumana ndi chizunzo chifukwa cha mtundu wake wa Amhara. Mayi ake anamwalira ali wamng’ono. Chaka chatha, abambo ake adamwalira atalephera kupeza chithandizo chopulumutsa moyo chifukwa cha nkhondo zomwe zidakhudza chisamaliro chaumoyo.

en: Now, Nuru is left to take care of his sisters, ages 10 and 8. He said life is very difficult and doesnt know how he will be able to raise his sisters.
ny: Tsopano Nuru watsala kuti azisamalira azilongo ake azaka 10 ndi 8. Iye adati moyo ndi wovuta kwambiri ndipo sadziwa kuti akwanitsa bwanji kulera azilongo ake.

en: Daniel Tigabu, a public health officer based in the camp for the displaced where Ahmed lives, said there is not enough medical equipment or medicine. The center is running out of basic medical kits, as well as a shortage of kits for malaria, hepatitis and HIV testing.
ny: A Daniel Tigabu, wogwira ntchito zachipatala yemwe amakhala pamsasa wa omwe asamukira komwe Ahmed amakhala, adati kulibe zida kapena mankhwala okwanira. Pamalowa akusowa zida zofunika kwambiri zachipatala, komanso kusowa kwa zida zogwiritsira ntchito malungo, matenda a chiwindi ndi kuyesa HIV.

en: Tens of thousands live in camps for the displaced in the Amhara region. Others live in host communities, like Tsgenet Tibebu, who lost her husband during the conflict with the TPLF.
ny: Makumi zikwizikwi amakhala m'misasa ya anthu othawa kwawo m'chigawo cha Amhara. Ena amakhala m'madera omwe akukhala nawo, monga Tsgenet Tibebu, yemwe mwamuna wake anamwalira panthawi ya nkhondo ndi TPLF.

en: Tibebu said she and her son rely on what her husbands friends provide as charity, which includes a room to stay in. As tears begin to flow, she said she is a housewife who has nothing and is waiting for support to help her raise her two children. She believes she should pay rent even though the owners have given her a place to stay. She wonders how she can plan for the future when she has nothing.
ny: Tibebu adati iye ndi mwana wake amadalira zomwe amnzake amapereka monga chithandizo, zomwe zimaphatikizapo chipinda chokhalamo. Misozi itayamba kutuluka, adati iye ndi mayi wapakhomo alibe kalikonse ndipo akuyembekezera thandizo kuti limuthandize kulera awiri. ana. Amakhulupirira kuti ayenera kulipira lendi ngakhale eni ake ampatsa malo okhala. Amadabwa kuti angakonzekere bwanji zam'tsogolo pomwe alibe kalikonse.

en: Mulugeta Kebede, an aid worker who works in the Hayk camp, spoke to VOA and said stories like Nurus and Tibebus are not uncommon across Amhara.
ny: Mulugeta Kebede, wogwira ntchito wothandizira yemwe amagwira ntchito ku msasa wa Hayk, adalankhula ndi VOA ndipo adanena kuti nkhani monga Nurus ndi Tibebus si zachilendo ku Amhara.

en: He said the situation makes aid workers cry day and night. He said if someone is hungry, they cant sleep because they think about their empty stomach. He said he has seen displaced people sell pans or mattresses to surved and added that the situation is at a critical stage.
ny: Iye adati izi zikupangitsa ogwira ntchito yopereka chithandizo kulira usana ndi usiku. Iye anati ngati wina ali ndi njala, sagona chifukwa amaganizira za m’mimba mwake. Iye adati adawona anthu othawa kwawo akugulitsa mapoto kapena matiresi kuti apulumuke ndipo adawonjezera kuti zinthu zafika povuta.

en: About 30,000 people displaced by conflict live just north of Hayk, in Weldiya. A local government representative, Habtemariam Assefa, North Wollo Zone spokesperson, said there was a little support shortly after TPLF left, after the area had been a conflict zone for months. But, he said, aid has been distributed only twice since and the aid provided by the U.N. or the federal government is not enough.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 omwe anathawa kwawo chifukwa cha nkhondo amakhala kumpoto kwa Hayk, ku Weldiya. Woimira boma laling'ono, Habtemariam Assefa, mneneri wa North Wollo Zone, adati panali thandizo pang'ono TPLF itachoka, derali litatha miyezi ingapo. Koma, adati, thandizo lagawidwa kawiri kokha kuyambira pamenepo ndipo thandizo loperekedwa ndi UN kapena boma la federal silokwanira.

en: North of the Amhara region, in Tigray where journalists are banned from entering, the U.N. said the situation is worse, with famine-like conditions. Tigray is under a de facto humanitarian blockade, according to the U.N.
ny: Kumpoto kwa dera la Amhara, ku Tigray komwe atolankhani amaletsedwa kulowa, bungwe la UN linanena kuti zinthu zikuipiraipira, zomwe zimakhala ngati njala. Tigray ali pansi pachitetezo cha anthu, malinga ndi UN

en: For now, all Ahmed Nuru and his sisters can do is try to scrape by and hope more assistance arrives soon.
ny: Pakadali pano, zomwe Ahmed Nuru ndi azilongo ake angachite ndikungoyang'ana ndikuyembekeza kuti thandizo lina lifika posachedwa.

en: State Group Investigates Video Allegedly Showing Abuse by Ethiopian Army
ny: Gulu La Boma Lifufuza Kanema Womwe Akuwonetsa Kuzunzidwa ndi Asitikali Aku Ethiopia

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission is investigating a video shared online that appears to show government troops abusing and shooting an ethnic Tigrayan boy.
ny: Bungwe la Ethiopian Human Rights Commission likufufuza vidiyo yomwe idagawidwa pa intaneti yomwe ikuwoneka kuti ikuwonetsa asitikali a boma akuzunza ndi kuwombera mnyamata wamtundu wa Tigrayan.

en: The four-minute video shows an alleged ethnic Tigray teenager being surrounded by men in Ethiopian army uniforms. The forces are seen abusing the boy, who they refer to as being from Abbi Adi, a location in the northern Tigray region of Ethiopia.
ny: Kanema wa mphindi zinayi akuwonetsa wachinyamata wina wamtundu wa Tigray atazunguliridwa ndi amuna ovala yunifolomu yankhondo yaku Ethiopia. Asilikali akuwoneka kuti akuzunza mnyamatayo, yemwe amamutchula kuti wochokera ku Abbi Adi, dera la kumpoto kwa Tigray ku Ethiopia.

en: In response to a query from VOA, the state-run Human Rights Commission said it was "gathering information regarding the incident."
ny: Poyankha funso lochokera ku VOA, bungwe la Human Rights Commission m'boma lati "likusonkhanitsa zambiri zokhudzana ndi zomwe zachitika."

en: In the video, the boy, with blood on his face, is seen sitting while the men in uniform surround him and threaten him with death. One of the men in uniforms calls for the boy to suffer rather than being killed immediately.
ny: Muvidiyoyi, mnyamatayo, ali ndi magazi kumaso, akuwoneka atakhala pamene amuna ovala yunifolomu akumuzungulira ndikumuopseza kuti amupha. Mmodzi mwa anthu ovala yunifolomu akupempha kuti mnyamatayo avutike m’malo mophedwa mwamsanga.

en: They tell a teenage girl to forcefully feed the boy. Finally, one man steps forward and shoots the boy, and the video ends.
ny: Amauza mtsikana kuti adyetse mnyamatayo mokakamiza. Pomaliza, mwamuna mmodzi akubwera kutsogolo ndi kuwombera mnyamatayo, ndipo vidiyoyo inatha.

en: VOA cannot independently verify the location of the incident or the identities of the individuals in the footage. Asked about the video, both the Ethiopian government communication minister and Ethiopian ministry of defense spokesperson declined to comment.
ny: VOA siingathe kutsimikizira paokha malo omwe chochitikacho kapena zidziwitso za anthu omwe ali pazithunzizo. Atafunsidwa za kanemayo, nduna yolumikizana ndi boma la Ethiopia komanso mneneri wa Unduna wa Zachitetezo ku Ethiopia adakana kuyankhapo.

en: A similar incident was reported by rights groups in January 2021 in which Ethiopian army members were seen executing a number of civilians in Mahibere Dego, in central Tigray.
ny: Chochitika chofananacho chidanenedwa ndi mabungwe omenyera ufulu mu Januware 2021 pomwe asitikali aku Ethiopia adawonedwa akupha anthu wamba angapo ku Mahibere Dego, m'chigawo chapakati cha Tigray.

en: Rights group Amnesty International has verified the killing of 11 civilians in that incident.
ny: Bungwe loona za ufulu wa Amnesty International latsimikiza za kuphedwa kwa anthu wamba 11 pamwambowu.

en: Forces from the rebel Tigray People's Liberation Front also have been accused of committing human rights violations. In February 2022, Amnesty International reported that TPLF forces and their affiliates have killed more than a dozen people and gang raped women in towns of the Amhara region they occupied.
ny: Asilikali a gulu lopanduka la Tigray People's Liberation Front nawonso akuimbidwa mlandu wophwanya ufulu wa anthu. Mu February 2022, Amnesty International inanena kuti gulu lankhondo la TPLF ndi mabungwe omwe amagwirizana nawo apha anthu opitilira khumi ndi awiri ndipo zigawenga zidagwiririra azimayi m'matauni achigawo cha Amhara omwe adawalanda.

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission recently reported that more than 740 civilians were killed in the Tigray war between July 2021 and March 2022.
ny: Bungwe la Ethiopian Human Rights Commission posachedwapa linanena kuti anthu wamba opitilira 740 adaphedwa pankhondo ya Tigray pakati pa Julayi 2021 ndi Marichi 2022.

en: Both the government and the TPLF deny accusations of rights violations, saying their operations do not target civilians.
ny: Boma ndi TPLF akukana milandu yophwanya ufulu, ponena kuti ntchito zawo sizikukhudzana ndi anthu wamba.

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom
ny: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
ny: Motsogozedwa ndi chitsanzo cha Kremlin, kukwera kwapadziko lonse kwa nkhani zabodza komanso zabodza zikuwononga kwambiri nkhani zodziyimira pawokha padziko lonse lapansi, lipoti latsopano lapeza.

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.
ny: Mu 2022 World Press Freedom Index yomwe idatulutsidwa Lachiwiri, a Reporters Without Borders (RSF) aku Paris adati kuwukira kwa Russia ku Ukraine kwathandizira kwambiri kufalitsa nkhani zabodza komanso zabodza.

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
ny: Gulu loyang'anira atolankhani lidati zomwe apeza ndi zodetsa nkhawa, chifukwa zikuwonetsa kugawanikana kwakukulu pakati pa atolankhani m'maiko komanso pakati pa mayiko padziko lonse lapansi.

en: "In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new," said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA. He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
ny: "Mu 2022, ndizosatsutsika kuti kusamvana kwapa media komanso chipwirikiti chazidziwitso kukuyambitsa magawano m'njira zatsopano," atero a Clayton Weimers, wachiwiri kwa director wa RSF ku United States, adauza VOA. Iye adati kufalikira kwa nkhani zachipani padziko lonse lapansi kwabwera chifukwa cha utolankhani weniweni.

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism. This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
ny: Lipoti lapachaka la gululi limayika mayiko 180 potengera chilengedwe cha utolankhani wodziyimira pawokha. Komabe, chaka chino, RSF idati idagwiritsa ntchito njira yatsopano yomwe imagwirizanitsa dziko lililonse pazandale, zamalamulo, zachuma, zachikhalidwe komanso chitetezo.

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom." That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
ny: Tsopano, mlozerawu umayika maiko 28 "okhala ndi ufulu woipa kwambiri wapa media." Gululi likuphatikizanso China, yomwe ikutumiza zowunikira kunja kwa malire ake ndikukulitsa zofalitsa za Kremlin pankhondo yowononga ya Russia yolimbana ndi Ukraine.

en: Russia, China among worst
ny: Russia, China mwa zoyipa kwambiri

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
ny: Chiyambireni kuukira Ukraine pa February 24, dziko la Russia lakhala likufuna kuwongolera nkhani zonse, ndikukhazikitsa lamulo latsopano lomwe limakhala ndi zaka 15 m'ndende chifukwa cholengeza "nkhani zabodza" pazankhondo, komanso kuletsa kutcha nkhondoyi "nkhondo."

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
ny: Izi zakakamiza mabungwe ambiri odziyimira pawokha omwe atsala, kuphatikiza nyuzipepala yotchuka ya Novaya Gazeta, wailesi ya Ekho Moskvy ndi Dozhd TV, kuti atseke kapena asamuke kunja kwa Russia kuti apitirize kugwira ntchito.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
ny: Ndi mawu odziyimira pawokha palibe, akatswiri akutero, boma la Russia latha kusefukira ma airwaves oyendetsedwa ndi boma ndi mabodza omwe amatsitsa nkhondoyo ndikufalitsa zifukwa zabodza kapena zosokeretsa za kuwukira kwa Kremlin.

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
ny: Kuponderezedwa kwa TV ku Russia kuli pa 155 mwa mayiko a 180 omwe akuphatikizidwa mu ndondomeko ya RSF, pomwe imodzi ndi yaulere kwambiri ndi 180 yochepa.

en: "It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia," Clayton said.
ny: "Ndizotetezeka kunena pakadali pano kuti makina osindikizira aulere ndi zakale ku Russia," adatero Clayton.

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
ny: Pazaka zonse 22 za Purezidenti wa Russia Vladimir Putin, Moscow yakhala ikuyang'ana atolankhani komanso atolankhani odziyimira pawokha, adatero.

en: "But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia," Clayton said. "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
ny: "Koma kuyambira kuukira kwa Ukraine, zikuwoneka kuti Putin wamalizadi kufalitsa zodziyimira pawokha ku Russia," adatero Clayton. "Pakadali pano, n'zosatheka kufotokoza molondola za nkhondo ya ku Ukraine."

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
ny: China idakhala pa nambala 175 mu lipoti latsopanoli. Ndipo tsopano popeza ili m'chikoka cha Beijing, Hong Kong idatsikanso kwambiri, yomwe ili pa nambala 148 mwa 180 kutsatira zigawenga ndi kumangidwa kwanthawi yayitali komwe kudatsekereza masamba ankhani olimbikitsa demokalase.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
ny: Fayilo ya dziko la RSF ku China ikuti ndiye woyang'anira ndende wamkulu padziko lonse lapansi wa atolankhani, ndipo 120 ali mndende. Ulamulirowu umagwiritsa ntchito kukakamiza, kuzunza, kuwopseza komanso kuyang'anira kuti atolankhani odziyimira pawokha komanso akunja afotokozere nkhani zomwe zimaonedwa kuti ndi "zovuta."

en: "President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime," RSF's country file states.
ny: "Purezidenti Xi Jinping, yemwe ali ndi mphamvu kuyambira 2013, wabwezeretsa chikhalidwe cha atolankhani choyenera nthawi ya Maoist, momwe kupeza zidziwitso mwaufulu kwakhala mlandu komanso kupereka zidziwitso mlandu wokulirapo," fayilo ya RSF idatero.

en: Rising authoritarianism
ny: Kukwera kwa ulamuliro waulamuliro

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
ny: North Korea idakali dziko loyipitsitsa pamasanjidwe a 180. Kumalo ena ku Asia-Pacific, chipwirikiti chandale, mikangano ndi kukwera kwa ulamuliro wankhanza zawononga zaka zambiri za kupita patsogolo.

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile. Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
ny: Kuukira boma mu 2021 ku Myanmar kunakhala zaka 10 zolepheretsa ufulu wa atolankhani, atolankhani adatsekeredwa, ziphaso zoulutsidwa ndi ma TV zidathetsedwa, komanso manyuzipepala ambiri akubwerera ku ukapolo. Pansi pa gulu lankhondo, dziko la Myanmar, lomwe lili pa nambala 176, ndi m'modzi mwa oyang'anira ndende akuluakulu padziko lonse lapansi.

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021. Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, zigawenga za Taliban zinalonjeza kuti zidzateteza ufulu wa atolankhani pamene adatenga mphamvu mu August 2021. M'malo mwake, RSF inati "kulanda mphamvu kwa Taliban kwawonjezera kuipiraipira kwa atolankhani ndi mabungwe atolankhani, omwe ali zolinga za mitundu yonse ya mantha ndi chiwawa. ." Afghanistan ili pa nambala 154.

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
ny: Ku Africa konse, malamulo oletsa utolankhani wapaintaneti akhudzanso ufulu wachidziwitso, RSF idatero, pomwe kufalikira kwa mphekesera, zabodza, komanso kufalitsa nkhani zabodza kwathandizira kusokoneza mwayi wopeza zidziwitso zabwino.

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index. Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
ny: Ku Ethiopia, nkhondo ya m'chigawo cha Tigray, ndi kuyimitsidwa kwake kwa kuyankhulana ndi kulepheretsa kupeza, ndizo zifukwa zazikulu zomwe zinayika dziko la 114 pamndandanda. Mayiko oyandikana nawo a Eritrea ndi Djibouti ndi oipitsitsa kwambiri, omwe ali pafupi ndi 179 ndi 164 motsatira.

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.
ny: Atolankhani aku Africa akupitilizabe kuvutikira pazachuma, RSF idati kusanthula kwake kotsatira.

en: "Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks," the group said.
ny: "Ngakhale kuti m'zaka za m'ma 1990 pali anthu ambiri omasuka, nthawi zambiri pamakhala milandu yofufuza mosavomerezeka, makamaka pa intaneti, ndi kutsekedwa kwa maukonde nthawi zina m'mayiko ena, kumangidwa kwa atolankhani ndi ziwawa," gululo linatero.

en: Clayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
ny: Clayton adati kukwera kwa ulamuliro waulamuliro kumangodzidyetsa.

en: "When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect," he said. "It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same."
ny: “Tikalola kuti chikhalidwe chopanda chilango chikhalepo pomwe olamulira amaloledwa kutsata atolankhani, kuwazunza, kuwamanga, kuwamenya m’misewu ndi kuwapha, zimadzetsa mpungwepungwe,” adatero. "Zimalimbikitsa wolamulira yemweyo kuti azichitanso nthawi ina, ndipo zimalimbikitsa olamulira ena omwe akuyang'ana kuchita zomwezo."

en: US not perfect
ny: US si yangwiro

en: After a period of seeing its media attacked as "fake news" by former President Donald Trump, the United States retained a relatively high ranking of 42 in RSF's index. That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.
ny: Pambuyo pakuwona atolankhani ake akuwukiridwa ngati "nkhani zabodza" ndi Purezidenti wakale a Donald Trump, United States idasungabe ma 42 pamndandanda wa RSF. Izi ndichifukwa chakubwereranso kwa White House ndi atolankhani a federal agency.

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
ny: Koma RSF idati mavuto akupitilirabe, kuphatikiza "kuzimiririka kwa manyuzipepala am'deralo, kusokoneza mwadongosolo kwa media, komanso kuwonongeka kwa utolankhani ndi nsanja za digito pomwe pali chidani komanso nkhanza kwa atolankhani, pakati pa ena."

en: Barriers exist, for instance, when it comes to covering state governments and protests.
ny: Zolepheretsa zilipo, mwachitsanzo, zikafika pakuphimba maboma ndi zionetsero.

en: "We typically find that this is either due to just a blatant disregard for the laws governing open records or meetings, or they're simply misinterpreting them. An individual is misinterpreting whether a journalist can be present at a particular event," said Beth Francesco, senior director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.
ny: "Nthawi zambiri timapeza kuti izi zimachitika chifukwa chonyalanyaza momveka bwino malamulo okhudza zolembedwa kapena misonkhano, kapena akungowatanthauzira molakwika. Munthu akutanthauzira molakwika ngati mtolankhani atha kupezeka pamwambo wina," adatero Beth Francesco. , mkulu wamkulu wa National Press Club Journalism Institute.

en: A few bright spots
ny: Mawanga ochepa owala

en: Despite an overall trend of decline, Clayton said there are positives.
ny: Ngakhale kutsika kwakukulu, Clayton adati pali zabwino.

en: Some governments provide funding for news media without interfering in their operations, to ensure independence from political influence.
ny: Maboma ena amapereka ndalama zothandizira zoulutsira nkhani popanda kusokoneza zochita zawo, pofuna kuonetsetsa kuti palibe chilichonse chokhudza ndale.

en: "If you look at the top of our list, some of the things that stand out are these are countries that have robust public funding for media," he said, noting that "it's always important to separate state funding for media and state-controlled media."
ny: "Mukayang'ana pamwamba pamndandanda wathu, zina mwazinthu zomwe zimadziwika bwino ndi izi ndi mayiko omwe ali ndi ndalama zopezera ndalama zofalitsa nkhani," adatero, ponena kuti "nthawi zonse ndikofunikira kulekanitsa ndalama za boma pazofalitsa ndi zoyendetsedwa ndi boma. media."

en: Three Scandinavian countries — Norway, Denmark and Sweden — respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.
ny: Maiko atatu aku Scandinavia - Norway, Denmark ndi Sweden - motsatana amabwera pamwamba pa mndandanda wa RSF. Estonia, yomwe kale inali lipabuliki ya Soviet Union, inali pa nambala 4.

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.
ny: RSF idati ntchito yaulere ya utolankhani imathandizira kwambiri ma demokalase omwe akubwera monga East Timor, yomwe ili pa 17, Bhutan, yomwe ili pa 33, ndi Mongolia, yomwe ili pa 90.

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places. But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
ny: East Timor ndi dziko limodzi limene chiwerengero chake chinakwera kwambiri, n’kukwera malo 54. Koma RSF inachenjeza kuti chifukwa cha kusintha kwa kachitidwe chaka chino, "chisamaliro chiyenera kutengedwa poyerekezera masanjidwe a 2022 ndi ziwerengero ndi za 2021."

en: UN’s Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
ny: A Guterres a UN akumana ndi Atsogoleri aku Nigeria Atayendera Borno Borno

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa. On Tuesday, he visited internally displaced people (IDPs) in northeast Nigeria and called for them to be safely returned to their homes. Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.  Antonio Guterres arrived the United Nations house in Abuja around 9 a.m. Wednesday and met with U.N. local coordinators before holding talks with Nigerian womens representatives.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres adakumana ndi atsogoleri aku Nigeria Lachitatu kumapeto kwa ulendo wa masiku awiri ku Nigeria ndi ulendo wa mayiko atatu ku Africa. Lachiwiri, adayendera anthu othawa kwawo (IDPs) kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Nigeria ndipo adawapempha kuti abwerere kwawo. Akuluakulu aku Nigeria akukonzekera kutseka makampu onse a IDP m'zaka zingapo zikubwerazi ngakhale ali ndi nkhawa zachitetezo. Antonio Guterres adafika kunyumba ya United Nations ku Abuja cha m'ma 9 koloko Lachitatu ndipo adakumana ndi ogwirizanitsa a UN asanayambe kukambirana ndi oimira amayi aku Nigeria.

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
ny: Nthumwizo, motsogozedwa ndi nduna yoona za amayi ku Nigeria, Pauline Kedem Tallen, adakambirana za kusamvana pakati pa amuna ndi akazi komanso kulowetsa amayi pazandale ndi mlembi wamkulu wa UN.

en: "His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws," said Tallen.
ny: Kubwera kwake ku Nigeria lero kwatipatsa chiyembekezo, chifukwa tikudziwa kuti apereka mawu ake pazovuta zonse zomwe zimakhudza amayi, nkhanza za amayi, kukwatiwa ali adakali aang'ono, kusakwaniritsa malamulo athu ena,” adatero Tallen.

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
ny: Pambuyo pake a Guterres adakumana ndi atsogoleri azipembedzo ku Nigeria ndipo pambuyo pake adapita nawo ku mwambo woyika nkhata ku nyumba ya UN kukumbukira anthu 23 omwe adaphedwa pakuphulitsidwa kwa bomba mu 2011.

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
ny: Anayamba ulendo wake wa mayiko atatu ku Africa Lamlungu ku Senegal monga gawo la ulendo wake wa mgwirizano wa Ramadan, ndipo kenako anapita ku Niger.

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
ny: Lachiwiri, adayendera kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Borno ndipo adakumana ndi bwanamkubwa wa boma komanso a IDP ndi mabanja omwe akhudzidwa ndi nkhondo ya Boko Haram.

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
ny: Guterres adayenderanso zigawenga zolapa za Boko Haram ndipo adayamika pulogalamu yobwezeretsa anthu opitilira 1,000 omwe kale anali omenya nkhondo.

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.  "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said. "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity. The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
ny: Anayamikiranso zomwe akuluakulu aboma achita pofuna kubweretsa anthu othawa kwawo kuti abwerere kumadera awo ndipo adapempha thandizo kuti amangidwenso derali. "Borno yomwe ndapeza lero ndi Borno ya chiyembekezo, Borno yokhala ndi tsogolo ndipo ndidachita chidwi kwambiri kuwona ndondomeko yomwe ikugwiritsidwa ntchito pano, pozindikira kuti simukulimbana ndi uchigawenga ndi zida zankhondo, mukulimbana ndi uchigawenga polimbana ndi zigawenga. zomwe zimayambitsa uchigawenga," adatero. "Anthu omwe ndidakumana nawo lero m'misasa ya IDP akufuna kubwerera kwawo mwachitetezo komanso mwaulemu. Njira yothanirana ndi uchigawenga ndikungopereka chiyembekezo komanso tsogolo lenileni."

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026. More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Nigeria akhala akutseka makampu a IDP kuyambira kumapeto kwa chaka chatha ndipo akufuna kutseka makampu onse pofika chaka cha 2026. Anthu oposa 2 miliyoni achotsedwa m'nyumba zawo kuyambira chiyambi cha zigawenga za Boko Haram ku 2009.

en: But aid groups have been warning some communities may still be attacked.
ny: Koma magulu othandizira akhala akuchenjeza madera ena kuti azunzidwabe.

en: "There are multiple solutions when it comes to resettlement. We need to get people stabilized," said Adenike Oladosu, a climate justice activist, met with the U.N. secretary-general. "Climate change is leading to the rise of armed conflicts affecting people in the region and around and the need for us to see that we have more climate action and not always military action."
ny: "Pali mayankho angapo pankhani yokhazikitsanso anthu. Tikuyenera kuti anthu akhazikike," adatero Adenike Oladosu, wolimbikitsa zanyengo, adakumana ndi mlembi wamkulu wa UN. "Kusintha kwanyengo kumabweretsa kukwera kwa mikangano yankhondo yomwe ikukhudza anthu m'derali komanso kuzungulira komanso kufunikira kwakuti tiwone kuti tili ndi zochitika zambiri zanyengo osati nthawi zonse kuchita zankhondo."

en: The U.N. secretary-general ended his visit at the Abuja presidential village, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his top Cabinet members.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN adamaliza ulendo wake kumudzi wa Purezidenti wa Abuja, komwe adakumana ndi Purezidenti Muhammadu Buhari ndi mamembala ake apamwamba a nduna.

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base
ny: Al-Shabab Anaukira Gulu Lankhondo la African Union

en: Al-Shabab fighters stormed an African Union military base in the village of El-Baraf in Somalias Middle Shabelle region early Tuesday, local officials and security sources say.
ny: Zigawenga za Al-Shabab zidaukira bwalo lankhondo la African Union m'mudzi wa El-Baraf m'chigawo cha Middle Shabelle ku Somalia kumayambiriro Lachiwiri, akuluakulu aboma komanso magwero achitetezo atero.

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma adauza VOA Somali kuti zigawengazo zidalanda malowa mwachidule asanachokepo. Atolankhani aboma ati ogulitsa aku Burundi omwe ali pamalopo adanyansidwa ndi chiwembucho.

en: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
ny: "Boma la Federal of Somalia likudzudzula mwamphamvu kuukira koopsa komwe kunakhudza gulu la African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia lomwe likugwira ntchito ku Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," Unduna wa Zachilendo ku Somalia udalemba patsamba lake lovomerezeka la Facebook.

en: "We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families."
ny: "Tikupereka chipepeso chathu chachikulu kwa anthu omwe akhudzidwa ndi zigawengazi komanso mabanja awo."

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs. He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, adati zigawenga zidayamba kuwukira ndi mabomba awiri odzipha. Ananenanso kuti zigawengazo zidamenyera malowo.

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces. The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war. Both claims could not be independently verified. AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
ny: Al-Shabab adati kuphedwa kwa asitikali 173 a African Union. Gululi linanenanso kuti ndilomwe likugwira asilikali a AU ngati akaidi ankhondo. Zonena zonse ziwiri sizikanatsimikiziridwa paokha. Likulu la gulu lankhondo la AU komanso akuluakulu ankhondo aku Somalia sanapezekepo nthawi yomweyo kuti apereke ndemanga.

en: In an interview with VOA, Muhumed, who was not at the village at the time of the attack, said he was told there were "many deaths" among Burundian forces but could not give an exact figure.
ny: Poyankhulana ndi VOA, Muhumed, yemwe sanali pamudzipo pa nthawi ya chiwembucho, adati adauzidwa kuti pali "akufa ambiri" pakati pa asilikali a Burundi koma sakanakhoza kupereka chiwerengero chenichenicho.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: “Kumenyana kotere sikunachitikepo m’derali,” adatero. "Kunali ndewu yoopsa."

en: He said two civilians were also killed and more than 10 others injured.
ny: Iye adatinso anthu wamba awiri afa ndipo ena opitilira 10 avulala.
