en: Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab militants withdrew from the base. He also reported airstrikes targeting the militants as they left the base but did not say who was responsible for the strikes.
ny: Muhumed adatsimikizira ku VOA kuti zigawenga za al-Shabab zachoka pamalopo. Adanenanso za zigawenga za ndege zomwe zikulimbana ndi zigawengazo pomwe amachoka pamalopo koma sananene kuti ndi ndani yemwe adayambitsa sitiraka.

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
ny: El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu, ndi amodzi mwa magulu ankhondo a African Union ochokera ku Burundi.

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Chochitikachi chinali choyamba chachikulu cha al-Shabab kuwukira asitikali a AU kuyambira pomwe gululi lidasintha dzina ndi momwe amagwirira ntchito mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia. The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe linavomereza ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia (ATMIS), ikupereka udindo wochepetsa chiwopsezo cha al-Shabab, kuthandizira kulimbikitsa mphamvu za asilikali a ku Somalia, ndikuyendetsa pang'onopang'ono. kupereka udindo wachitetezo ku Somalia. Ntchitoyi ili ndi mpaka kumapeto kwa 2024 kuti igwire ntchito mdziko muno.

en: India’s Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
ny: Asilamu aku India a Mark Eid al-Fitr Pakati pa Ziwawa Zamagulu

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
ny: Asilamu ku India konse adayika chizindikiro cha Eid al-Fitr Lachiwiri popemphera kunja kwa mzikiti, ngakhale zikondwerero za chaka chino zidachitika pambuyo pa ziwonetsero zaposachedwa zolimbana ndi anthu m'mwezi wa Ramadan.

en: "We will not have the same kind of festivity" this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai. "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
ny: "Sitidzakhala ndi zikondwerero zamtundu womwewo" nthawi ino, atero a Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, mainjiniya wamba ku likulu lazachuma ku India, Mumbai. "Iyi ndiye Eid yowawa kwambiri yokhala ndi zokumbukira zoyipa kwambiri za Asilamu aku India."

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
ny: Malingaliro odana ndi Asilamu afalikira mdziko lonse mwezi watha, kuphatikiza kugenda miyala pakati pa magulu achi Hindu ndi Asilamu panthawi ya zipembedzo komanso kugwetsa nyumba zingapo zomwe makamaka za Asilamu ndi aboma.

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance. Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it. Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
ny: Anthu ammudzi, omwe amapanga 14% ya anthu aku India okwana 1.4 biliyoni, akuopa kunyozedwa ndi anthu achihindu okhwima omwe akhala akutsutsana kwanthawi yayitali ndi Asilamu. Atsogoleri ena aku India omwe akulamulira chipani cha Hindu Bharatiya Janata Party adathandizira ziwawazo, pomwe Prime Minister Narendra Modi mpaka pano sanalankhulepo za izi. Eid al-Fitr nthawi zambiri imakhala ndi mapemphero apagulu, maphwando okondwerera zakudya komanso zovala zatsopano, koma zikondwerero ku India zaka ziwiri zapitazi zasokonezedwa ndi zoletsa za COVID-19.

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic. The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
ny: Ku Kashmir yolamulidwa ndi India, chikondwerero cha Asilamu chagonjetsedwa kwa zaka zitatu zapitazi chifukwa cha kutsekeka kwankhondo komwe sikunachitikepo pambuyo poti India idalanda madera odzilamulira mu 2019, ndikutsatiridwa ndi mliri. Derali lidawonanso ziwawa zikuchulukirachulukira mu Ramadan, pomwe zigawenga 20, anthu wamba awiri ndi apolisi asanu ndi asitikali aphedwa.

en: "As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.
ny: "Pamene tikukonzekera kukondwerera Eid, malingaliro amphamvu amitsuko yotayika," atero a Bashir Ahmed, wochita bizinesi ku Srinagar.

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades. Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
ny: Kashmir ndi dera lomwe Asilamu ambiri amakangana komwe kuli ziwawa zotsutsana ndi ulamuliro waku India komanso chipwirikiti cha New Delhis chakhala chikuchitika kwazaka zopitilira makumi atatu. Anthu masauzande ambiri amwalira pankhondoyi.

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
ny: Pakadali pano likulu, New Delhi, mazana adasonkhana ku Jama Masjid, umodzi mwamizikiti yayikulu kwambiri ku India, pomwe amapemphera mapemphero a Eid komweko koyamba pazaka ziwiri chifukwa choletsa mliri. Mabanja adasonkhana m'mawa Lachiwiri m'mawa pomwe anthu ambiri adakumbatirana ndi zokhumba zawo.

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
ny: Okhala ku Beijing Athamangira ku COVID-19 Lockdown

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19. Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Shanghai, Beijing sinafunebe kuti onse okhala kwawo azikhala kunyumba kuti athetse kufalikira kwa COVID-19. Komabe, anthu ambiri m'chigawo chake cha Chaoyang ndi kwina akukonzekera izi.

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system. They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
ny: Lachitatu, akuluakulu a mzindawo adatseka masiteshoni 60 apansi panthaka, opitilira 10% ya machitidwe akulu aku Beijing. Sananene kuti ntchito iyambiranso liti, malinga ndi ABC News.

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
ny: Beijing, mzinda wa anthu 21 miliyoni, wakhala tcheru kuti afalikire COVID-19, pomwe malo odyera ndi mipiringidzo zikuyenda, malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi amakhala pafupi ndipo masukulu amayimitsa makalasi mpaka kalekale, malinga ndi CNBC.

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
ny: Anthu omwe amakhala m'malo "olamulidwa", madera omwe milandu yapezeka, adauzidwa kuti azikhala mumzinda, ndipo onse okhalamo ayenera kuyezetsa kachilomboka katatu pa sabata, malinga ndi ABC.

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
ny: Akuluakulu aku China adanenanso za milandu 5,489 m'dziko lonselo Lachitatu, pomwe 4,982 anali ku Shanghai, yomwe yakhala ikutsekedwa kwa milungu ingapo.

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
ny: Beijing idanenanso zazizindikiro 46 ndi zisanu za asymptomatic Lachitatu. Chiwerengero chonse cha mzindawu kuyambira pa Epulo 22, chomwe chimawona kuyambika kwa omicron, ndi 544.

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
ny: A Zhang, wokhala ku Beijing, adati adagula chakudya ndi madzi owonjezera, ngakhale sakuganiza kuti Beijing itsekeredwa ngati Shanghai. Anapempha kuti VOA isagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse chifukwa akuwopa kukopa chidwi cha akuluakulu.

en: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week. He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.
ny: "Ndili ndi matumba asanu ndi limodzi a mpunga, matumba awiri a Zakudyazi, ndi mabokosi angapo amadzi, Zakudyazi nthawi yomweyo ndi mabisiketi (odzaza ndi thanzi), ndipo sindinasunge zambiri," Zhang adauza VOA Mandarin poyankhulana pafoni sabata yatha. Iye adati adagula zakudya zake pa intaneti chifukwa mu supermarket muja munali anthu ambiri.

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
ny: Mayi Yao, omwe amakhala m’chigawo cha Chaoyang, anauza VOA Mandarin kuti wakhala akusunga zinthu zofunika kwambiri kuyambira kuchiyambi kwa chaka chino, pambuyo poti Unduna wa Zamalonda unanena kuti aliyense achite zimenezo. Adafunsa kuti VOA Mandarin isagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse chifukwa akufuna kupewa kubwezera.

en: "I have always maintained a good habit of reserving food. So I have a lot of rice, noodles and oil at home," she said, adding that she figured her family would be fine even if Beijing locked down for a month.
ny: "Nthawi zonse ndakhala ndi chizolowezi chosunga chakudya. Chifukwa chake ndili ndi mpunga wambiri, Zakudyazi ndi mafuta kunyumba," adatero, ndikuwonjezera kuti akuwona kuti banja lake lingakhale bwino ngakhale Beijing atatsekeredwa kwa mwezi umodzi.

en: And while Beijing has not yet closed the city, citizens' lives have been disrupted.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale Beijing sinatseke mzindawo, miyoyo ya nzika yasokonekera.

en: On April 28, the Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital issued a notice that the outpatient and emergency departments of the hospital would suspend the admission of patients.
ny: Pa Epulo 28, chipatala cha Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital chidapereka chidziwitso kuti ma dipatimenti omwe akudwala komanso azadzidzidzi pachipatalachi ayimitsa kulandila odwala.

en: On the same day, Chaoyang Hospital, one of the largest hospitals in Beijing, announced on its official Weibo account that its emergency department would also suspend the admission of patients. Weibo is China's equivalent of Twitter.
ny: Tsiku lomwelo, Chipatala cha Chaoyang, chimodzi mwa zipatala zazikulu kwambiri ku Beijing, adalengeza pa akaunti yake ya Weibo kuti dipatimenti yake yadzidzidzi idzayimitsanso kuvomereza kwa odwala. Weibo ndi China chofanana ndi Twitter.

en: Angry Chinese netizens left more than 800 messages under the official WeChat account "Beijing Headline."
ny: Omvera okwiya aku China adasiya mauthenga opitilira 800 pansi pa akaunti yovomerezeka ya WeChat "Beijing Headline."

en: "Why do you stop the emergency room as soon as there is a new COVID case, and how many people will be killed due to the secondary disaster caused by the COVID?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.
ny: "N'chifukwa chiyani mumayimitsa chipinda chadzidzidzi mukangopezeka mlandu watsopano wa COVID, ndipo ndi anthu angati omwe aphedwa chifukwa cha tsoka lachiwiri lomwe labwera chifukwa cha COVID?" wogwiritsa ntchito intaneti adafunsa mu positi ya Weibo.

en: Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about a Shanghai-like lockdown.
ny: Ena okhala ku Beijing adati alibe nkhawa ndi kutsekeka ngati Shanghai.

en: "Basically, I'm not afraid," said Mr. Wang, who asked VOA Mandarin to not use his full name so he could avoid attracting authorities' attention. "The party, government and military are here, and the people are here."
ny: "Kwenikweni, sindikuopa," adatero Bambo Wang, yemwe adapempha VOA Mandarin kuti asagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse kuti apewe kukopa chidwi cha akuluakulu. "Chipani, boma ndi asilikali ali pano, ndipo anthu ali pano."

en: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in the Changping district for 21 days.
ny: Komabe, Wang adauza VOA Mandarin, mkati mwa Okutobala chaka chatha, munthu m'modzi m'nyumba yake atapezeka kuti ali ndi chiyembekezo, anthu pafupifupi 600 ochokera m'mabanja opitilira 200 adakakamizika kudzipatula m'mahotela angapo m'boma la Changping kwa masiku 21.

en: Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room at their hotel.
ny: Wang ndi mkazi wake sanaloledwe kugawana chipinda ku hotelo yawo.

en: What particularly puzzled and annoyed Wang was that on the last day of the mandatory hotel quarantine, in addition to routine nasal and oral swabs during testing, authorities added anal swabs to the regimen.
ny: Chomwe chidadodometsa komanso kukwiyitsa Wang chinali chakuti patsiku lomaliza la malo ovomerezeka kukhala kwaokha ku hotelo, kuphatikiza pazakudya zapamphuno ndi pakamwa nthawi zonse poyesedwa, aboma adawonjezera ma anal swabs ku regimen.

en: Kasim Abdurehim contributed to this report.
ny: Kasim Abdurehim anathandizira nawo lipotili.

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch’s Yacht
ny: Ku US Kulimbikitsa, Fiji Ilanda Yacht ya Oligarch ya ku Russia

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
ny: Yacht ina ya oligarchs yaku Russia idagwidwa Lachinayi ngati gawo loyesera kulanga Russia chifukwa cha nkhondo yake ku Ukraine.

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.
ny: Pofunsidwa ndi United States, akuluakulu aku Fiji adatenga yacht ya $ 300 miliyoni ya Suleiman Kerimov, Dipatimenti Yachilungamo idatero. Akuluakulu ati bwatoli lili ku Lautoka, Fiji.

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
ny: Kerimovs yacht, yomwe ili ndi mbendera yaku Cayman Island, Amadea, akuti idakhala ku Fiji kuyambira mwezi watha, ikubwera kuchokera ku Mexico. Maloya oteteza adati sitimayo inali ya oligarch wina.

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also sanctioned him.
ny: Kerimov anali ataloledwa kale ndi US mu 2014 ndi 2018 chifukwa cha zochitika za Russia ku Syria ndi Ukraine. European Union idamupatsanso chilango.

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
ny: M'mwezi wa Marichi, boma la US lidalengeza kuyesetsa kwakukulu kuti lizindikire ndi kulanda chuma cha anthu olemera aku Russia omwe athandizira boma la Purezidenti wa Russia Vladmir Putin, monga gawo loyankha ku Moscows February 24 kuwukira ku Ukraine.

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
ny: Ntchitoyi, motsogozedwa ndi Dipatimenti Yachilungamo, imatchedwa Task Force KleptoCapture.

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime." He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."
ny: Attorney General wa US Merrick Garland adati Lachinayi m'mawu ake "palibe malo obisalira katundu wa zigawenga zomwe zimathandizira boma la Russia." Ananenanso kuti, "Dipatimenti Yachilungamo idzakhala yosalekeza poyesa kuyankha anthu omwe amathandizira imfa ndi chiwonongeko chomwe tikuwona ku Ukraine."

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
ny: M'mwezi wa Epulo, atalimbikitsidwa ndi US, akuluakulu aku Spain adalanda yacht ya oligarch waku Russia Viktor Vekselberg, mwini wa gulu la Russia Renova Group.

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.
ny: Sabata yatha, Nyumba Yoyimira Nyumba ya US idapereka njira yomwe ingalole kuti boma la US ligulitse katundu waku Russia omwe adalandidwa mtengo wopitilira $ 2 miliyoni kuti apindule ku Ukraine. Njira yotsatira ndi Senate.

en: (Some information in this report comes from Reuters.)
ny: (Zambiri mu lipoti ili zikuchokera ku Reuters.)

en: WHO Report Says COVID Cases Decline, Except in Americas, Africa
ny: Lipoti la WHO Likuti Milandu ya COVID Ichepa, Kupatula ku America, Africa

en: The World Health Organization said Wednesday that the number of newly reported coronavirus cases and deaths globally continued to fall in the last week, continuing a decline that began in March.
ny: Bungwe la World Health Organisation lati Lachitatu kuti chiwerengero cha anthu omwe angomwalira kumene ku coronavirus padziko lonse lapansi chikupitilira kutsika sabata yatha, ndikupitilira kutsika komwe kudayamba mu Marichi.

en: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.
ny: Mu lipoti lake la sabata la mliriwu, bungwe la UN la zaumoyo lati pali matenda atsopano pafupifupi 3.8 miliyoni ndipo opitilira 15,000 afa sabata yatha, kutsika 17% ndi 3% sabata motsatana. Koma ziwerengerozi zikukhulupirira kuti ndizosawerengeka kwenikweni za kuchuluka kwa COVID-19 chifukwa mayiko omwe akuchulukirachulukira akusiya kuyesedwa komanso kuwunika.

en: Still, WHO noted that cases rose by about a third in Africa and 13% in the Americas. There was also a nearly 70% jump in deaths reported in India, although that was attributed to delayed reporting rather than a recent surge of disease.
ny: Komabe, WHO idawona kuti milandu idakwera pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu ku Africa ndi 13% ku America. Panalinso kulumpha pafupifupi 70% mwaimfa zomwe zanenedwa ku India, ngakhale izi zidachitika chifukwa chakuchedwa kupereka lipoti m'malo mochita kudwala kwaposachedwa.

en: Last week, authorities in South Africa said they had noted an uptick in COVID-19 cases attributable to the BA.4 mutant of omicron, although they said it was too early to tell if that would result in a significant new wave of disease. Although the BA.4 version of COVID-19's omicron variant appears more infectious than omicron, WHO said there was no evidence yet that it was leading to substantially higher rates of hospitalization or death.
ny: Sabata yatha, akuluakulu aboma ku South Africa adati awona kuchuluka kwa milandu ya COVID-19 yobwera chifukwa cha BA.4 mutant of omicron, ngakhale adati kunali koyambirira kwambiri kuti anene ngati izi zitha kuyambitsa matenda. Ngakhale mtundu wa BA.4 wa COVID-19's omicron mitundu ikuwoneka yopatsirana kuposa omicron, WHO idati palibe umboni pano kuti zikupangitsa kuti anthu azigonekedwa m'chipatala kapena kufa.

en: Salim Abdool Karim, a public health expert at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that while only a "modest" rise in cases had been noted, South Africa was also in the middle of a holiday period and testing had dropped significantly. He said the cases were slowing and were "not following a rocket-like upward trajectory we would expect" in another spike of disease.
ny: A Salim Abdool Karim, katswiri wa zaumoyo ku yunivesite ya KwaZulu-Natal, adati ngakhale kukwera "kwapang'onopang'ono" kwadziwika, South Africa nayo inali mkati mwa nthawi ya tchuthi ndipo kuyezetsa kwatsika kwambiri. Anatinso milanduyi ikucheperachepera ndipo "sikutsata njira yokwera ngati roketi yomwe tingayembekezere" pakukula kwina kwa matenda.

en: At a press briefing on Wednesday, WHO emergencies chief Dr. Michael Ryan said it was too soon to tell if COVID-19 was entering a seasonal pattern and warned against countries dropping all of their restrictions too quickly — as many in the West have done.
ny: Pamsonkhano wa atolankhani Lachitatu, mkulu wa zadzidzidzi za WHO Dr. Michael Ryan adati kwatsala pang'ono kunena ngati COVID-19 ikulowa munyengo yanyengo ndipo anachenjeza kuti mayiko asiya ziletso zawo zonse mwachangu - monga momwe ambiri akumadzulo achitira.

en: "The jury is still out as to how seasonal this virus will become," he said, explaining that it wasn't proven yet that COVID-19 would naturally drop off in the summer and that the world could yet face more unsettling variants. "If people are crowded together in conditions where a new variant is spreading, you will see high levels of transmission," he said.
ny: "Oweruza akadadziwabe momwe kachilomboka kadzakhalira nyengo," adatero, akufotokoza kuti sizinatsimikizidwebe kuti COVID-19 idzagwa nthawi yachilimwe komanso kuti dziko lapansi likhoza kukumana ndi zovuta zina. "Ngati anthu achulukana m'malo omwe mtundu watsopano ukufalikira, mudzawona kufalikira kwakukulu," adatero.

en: Meanwhile in China, authorities continued to crack down on cities, including Beijing, where more than 10% of the subway system was shut down in an effort to curb the virus' spread, after authorities in the capital already closed down indoor dining, gyms and school classes.
ny: Pakadali pano ku China, akuluakulu aboma adapitilizabe kuwononga mizinda, kuphatikiza Beijing, pomwe njira zopitilira 10% zamayendedwe apansi panthaka zidatsekedwa pofuna kuthana ndi kufalikira kwa kachilomboka, akuluakulu aboma likulu atseka kale malo odyera, malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi komanso malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi. makalasi akusukulu.

en: In Shanghai, rigid and widely derided restrictions have led to shortages of food and medical aid along with a wider — though likely temporary — impact on the national economy. Desperate, outraged citizens have confronted authorities at barricades and online, screamed out of their windows and banged pots and pans in a sign of frustration and anger.
ny: Ku Shanghai, ziletso zokhwima komanso zonyozedwa kwambiri zadzetsa kusowa kwa chakudya ndi chithandizo chamankhwala komanso kukhudzika kwakukulu - ngakhale kuli kwakanthawi - pachuma cha dziko. Nzika zosimidwa, zokwiya zakumana ndi akuluakulu aboma pazitsekera komanso pa intaneti, akukuwa kuchokera m'mazenera awo ndikumenya mapoto ndi mapoto kusonyeza kukhumudwa komanso kukwiya.

en: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges
ny: Khothi Lalikulu ku Myanmar Lakana Apilo ya Aung San Suu Kyi pa Mlandu Waziphuphu

en: An appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.
ny: Apilo ya chigamulo cha zaka zisanu m'ndende kwa mtsogoleri wochotsedwa ku Myanmar Aung San Suu Kyi yakanidwa Lachitatu ndi Khothi Lalikulu la dzikolo.

en: The decision reportedly came as soon as the claim for an appeal was lodged, and the court didn't entertain arguments from either side in the case.
ny: Chigamulochi akuti chidabwera pomwe pempho la apilo lidaperekedwa, ndipo khotilo silinatengere mikangano mbali zonse za mlanduwo.

en: Suu Kyi, 76, was sentenced last week after being found guilty of 11 counts of corruption, including taking a bribe of cash and gold bars worth $600,000.
ny: Suu Kyi, wazaka 76, adaweruzidwa sabata yatha atapezeka ndi milandu 11 ya katangale, kuphatikiza kutenga chiphuphu cha ndalama ndi golide zokwana $600,000.

en: Her lawyer called the charge absurd.
ny: Loya wake ananena kuti mlanduwu ndi wopusa.

en: Suu Kyi had already been sentenced to six years for actions against the military, breaking COVID-19 rules and breaking a telecommunications law.
ny: Suu Kyi anali ataweruzidwa kale zaka zisanu ndi chimodzi chifukwa chotsutsana ndi usilikali, kuphwanya malamulo a COVID-19 komanso kuphwanya lamulo lolankhulana ndi matelefoni.

en: She faces many more charges, and if found guilty could be sentenced to more than 150 years in jail.
ny: Iye akuyang’anizana ndi milandu ina yambiri, ndipo ngati atapezeka kuti ndi wolakwa akhoza kulamulidwa kukhala m’ndende zaka zoposa 150.

en: Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.
ny: Suu Kyi wakhala ali pa ukaidi wosachoka panyumba kuyambira pomwe asilikali adalanda dzikolo chaka chatha.

en: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).
ny: Chiyambire kulanda boma, pa Feb. 1, 2021, pakhala ziwonetsero zotsutsana ndi boma lankhondo. Boma lidachita zachiwawa nthawi zambiri, kupha anthu wamba oposa 1,800 ndipo oposa 10,000 adamangidwa, kuimbidwa mlandu kapena kuweruzidwa, malinga ndi bungwe la Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).

en: Some information in this report comes from Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zambiri mu lipotili zimachokera ku Reuters ndi Agence France-Presse.

en: Foreign Tourists Begin Arriving in New Zealand After COVID Restrictions Lifted.
ny: Alendo Akunja Ayamba Kufika ku New Zealand Zoletsa za COVID Zikachotsedwa.

en: For the first time in over two years, overseas tourists have been allowed to enter New Zealand starting Monday.
ny: Kwa nthawi yoyamba m'zaka zopitilira ziwiri, alendo akunja aloledwa kulowa New Zealand kuyambira Lolemba.

en: The island nation known for its natural beauty enacted some of the strictest lockdown measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, including very restrictive travel limitations.
ny: Dziko la pachilumbachi lomwe limadziwika ndi kukongola kwake kwachilengedwe lidakhazikitsa njira zotsekera kwambiri pa nthawi ya mliri wa COVID-19, kuphatikiza malire oletsa kuyenda.

en: The country had reopened for tourists from Australia weeks ago, but the new relaxation of restrictions now allows tourists from over 60 countries to visit, including most European countries and the U.S.
ny: Dzikoli lidatseguliranso alendo ochokera ku Australia masabata apitawa, koma kutsitsimula kwatsopano kwa ziletso tsopano kulola alendo ochokera m'maiko opitilira 60 kuyendera, kuphatikiza mayiko ambiri aku Europe ndi US.

en: "Today is a day to celebrate and is a big moment in our reconnection with the world," said Tourism Minister Stuart Nash.
ny: "Lero ndi tsiku lokondwerera ndipo ndi mphindi yofunika kwambiri pakulumikizana kwathu ndi dziko lapansi," atero nduna ya zokopa alendo Stuart Nash.

en: Tourists must show they are fully vaccinated and test negative for the virus.
ny: Alendo akuyenera kuwonetsa kuti ali ndi katemera mokwanira komanso kuti alibe kachilomboka.

en: Citizens of China, India and other countries not given a waiver Monday are still not allowed to visit.
ny: Nzika zaku China, India ndi mayiko ena omwe sanapatsidwe chilolezo Lolemba saloledwa kuyendera.

en: Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for 5% of the countrys economic activity and 20% of its foreign income.
ny: Mliriwu usanachitike, zokopa alendo zidatenga 5% yazachuma zamayiko ndi 20% ya ndalama zake zakunja.

en: On Monday, 43 international flights carrying around 9,000 passengers were scheduled to leave or arrive at Auckland International Airport, Reuters reported.
ny: Lolemba, ndege 43 zapadziko lonse lapansi zonyamula anthu pafupifupi 9,000 zidayenera kunyamuka kapena kukafika ku Auckland International Airport, Reuters idatero.

en: Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.
ny: Zambiri mu lipotili zimachokera ku The Associated Press ndi Reuters.

en: Report: Iran to Execute Swedish-Iranian National by May 21.
ny: Nenani: Iran Idzapha Dziko la Sweden-Iranian pofika Meyi 21.

en: Iran will later this month execute a Swedish-Iranian national whom it has imprisoned since 2016 and convicted of spying for Israel, media reported.
ny: Iran kumapeto kwa mwezi uno idzapha mzika yaku Sweden-Irani yomwe idamangidwa kuyambira 2016 ndikumupeza kuti ndi akazitape ku Israeli, atolankhani anena.

en: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency on Wednesday released a report in which Iranian officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.
ny: Bungwe lofalitsa nkhani ku Iran la ISNA Lachitatu latulutsa lipoti pomwe akuluakulu aku Iran adati Tehran ipereka chilango cha imfa kwa Ahmad Reza Jalali pofika Meyi 21.

en: Jalali, a researcher and physician who specializes in disaster relief, was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, Jalali was sentenced to death in Iran after he had been found guilty of passing information about two Iranian nuclear scientists to Israel to help it assassinate several nuclear scientists.
ny: Jalali, wofufuza komanso dokotala yemwe amagwira ntchito yothandiza pakagwa tsoka, adamangidwa paulendo wake ku Iran mu Epulo 2016. Mu 2017, Jalali adaweruzidwa kuti aphedwe ku Iran atapezeka kuti ndi wolakwa popereka chidziwitso cha asayansi awiri aku Iran ku Israel thandizani kupha asayansi angapo a nyukiliya.

en: Rights groups have condemned Jalalis detention, citing Irans pattern of detaining dual nationals and expatriates without due process.
ny: Magulu a ufulu adadzudzula kumangidwa kwa a Jalalis, ponena za chikhalidwe cha Iran chomangira anthu amitundu iwiri komanso othawa kwawo popanda chifukwa.

en: Iran does not recognize dual nationals.
ny: Iran sizindikira mayiko awiri.

en: The announcement came as authorities in Stockholm wrapped up the trial of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian prosecution official whom Swedish officials arrested in November 2019.
ny: Chilengezochi chidabwera pomwe akuluakulu aku Stockholm adamaliza mlandu wa Hamid Nouri, yemwe kale anali woimira boma ku Iran yemwe akuluakulu aku Sweden adamumanga mu Novembala 2019.

en: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Irans Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma ati Nouri adachitapo kanthu pa imfa ya akaidi a ndale omwe anaphedwa pa lamulo la boma la Iran kundende ya Irans Gohardasht panthawi yomaliza ya nkhondo ya Iran ndi Iraq mu 1988. Nouri wakhala akusungidwa m'ndende ku Sweden kuyambira pamene anamangidwa.

en: On Wednesday, the final day of Nouri's trial, a Stockholm district court judge set the date of the verdict for July 14.
ny: Lachitatu, tsiku lomaliza la mlandu wa Nouri, woweruza wa khothi la Stockholm adakhazikitsa tsiku lachigamulo cha Julayi 14.

en: Amnesty International put the number of those executed at the prison at 5,000 but said in a 2018 report that the number could be higher.
ny: Amnesty International idati chiwerengero cha omwe adaphedwa kundendeyi ndi 5,000 koma lipoti la 2018 linanena kuti chiŵerengerochi chikhoza kuwonjezereka.

en: Human Rights Watch, in a recent report, said, "Iran continues to be one of the worlds leading implementers of the death penalty."
ny: Bungwe la Human Rights Watch, mu lipoti laposachedwa, linanena kuti, "Iran ikupitilizabe kukhala m'modzi mwa atsogoleri padziko lonse lapansi omwe akutsata chilango cha imfa."

en: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.
ny: Ngati Nouri atapezeka kuti ndi wolakwa, adzaweruzidwa kuti akhale m'ndende moyo wake wonse pamilandu yapadziko lonse lapansi komanso kuphwanya ufulu wa anthu. Iran posachedwa idayitanitsa nthumwi yaku Sweden pochita ziwonetsero pamilandu ya Nouris.

en: Maja Aberg, senior policy adviser with Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.
ny: Maja Aberg, mlangizi wamkulu wa ndondomeko ku Amnesty International Sweden, akuti sizodabwitsa kuti Iran idalengeza Jalalis akudikirira kuti aphedwe pambuyo poti ozenga mlandu aku Sweden atasuntha mlandu wa Nouris.

en: "It indicates that (Iran) sees him as a kind of piece in the jigsaw puzzle, which is very worrying," Aberg told Sweden's TT news agency.
ny: "Izi zikusonyeza kuti (Iran) amamuwona ngati chidutswa cha jigsaw puzzle, zomwe zimadetsa nkhawa kwambiri," Aberg adauza bungwe la TT la Sweden.

en: Swedish law allows for the prosecution of Swedish citizens and other nationals for crimes against international law committed abroad.
ny: Lamulo la Sweden limalola kuimbidwa mlandu kwa nzika zaku Sweden ndi mayiko ena pamilandu yotsutsana ndi malamulo apadziko lonse lapansi ochitidwa kunja.

en: Some information for this report came from The Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zambiri za lipotili zidachokera ku The Associated Press, Reuters ndi Agence France-Presse.

en: Erdogan Goes to Riyadh to Seal Rapprochement
ny: Erdogan Amapita ku Riyadh ku Seal Rapprochement

en: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.
ny: Purezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan apita ku Saudi Arabia Lachinayi paulendo wa masiku awiri wofuna kuthetsa mikangano yakale pakati pa Ankara ndi Riyadh.

en: The Turkish leaders visit with the Saudi king comes after years of rivalry between their once-close countries.
ny: Atsogoleri aku Turkey amacheza ndi mfumu ya Saudi ikubwera pambuyo pa zaka za mkangano pakati pa mayiko omwe anali oyandikana nawo.

en: Mehmet Ogutcu is the head of the London Energy Club, a grouping of government and energy sector leaders. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.
ny: Mehmet Ogutcu ndi wamkulu wa London Energy Club, gulu la atsogoleri aboma ndi mphamvu. Ogutcu ati ulendowu ndi pachimake pa zokambirana zapadziko lonse lapansi.

en: "President Erdogan has good relations with the king; with the crown prince Muhammad Bin Salman, we had serious difficulties," said Ogutcu. "Now it looks that I believe the*(Britons), and Americans, and the Qataris of course played some role, even the Azeris might have done this. And things are changing and relaxing a bit more, and now at the presidential level, it's going to be sealed."
ny: "Pulezidenti Erdogan ali ndi ubale wabwino ndi mfumu; ndi kalonga wa korona Muhammad Bin Salman, tinali ndi mavuto aakulu," adatero Ogutcu. "Tsopano zikuwoneka kuti ndikukhulupirira kuti * (Britons), ndi Achimereka, ndi Qatari ndithudi adachitapo kanthu, ngakhale Azeri akanatha kuchita izi. Ndipo zinthu zikusintha ndikupumula pang'ono, ndipo tsopano pa pulezidenti, idzasindikizidwa."

en: Erdogan and the crown prince have been bitter rivals. The Turkish president led international condemnation over the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside Saudi Arabias consulate in Istanbul.
ny: Erdogan ndi kalonga wa korona akhala otsutsana kwambiri. Purezidenti wa Turkey adadzudzula dziko lonse lapansi pakupha kwa mtolankhani waku Saudi Jamal Khashoggi, yemwe adaphedwa mkati mwa kazembe wa Saudi Arabia ku Istanbul.

en: The killing was linked to the crown prince, a charge he denied. But the decision earlier this month to move the Khashoggi murder trial from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a gesture by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.
ny: Kuphaku kunali kogwirizana ndi kalonga wachifumu, mlandu womwe adaukana. Koma chigamulo chakumayambiriro kwa mwezi uno chosuntha mlandu wakupha Khashoggi kuchokera ku Istanbul kupita ku Riyadh chikuwoneka ngati chizindikiro cha Ankara, kutsegula njira ya ulendo wa Erdogan.

en: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.
ny: Ogutcu akuti ndi chisankho cha pulezidenti chomwe chidzachitike chaka chamawa, Erdogan akuyang'ana thandizo la Saudi kuti athetse mavuto a zachuma ku Turkey.

en: "Turkey has an interest in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."
ny: "Turkey ili ndi chidwi chokonzanso ubale ndi Riyadh chifukwa dziko la Turkey likufunika thandizo la ndalama," adatero Ogutcu. "Chuma cha Turkey sichikukopa mabizinesi ofunikira kapena ndalama zodziyimira pawokha zomwe zikubwera kudzagulitsa dziko la Turkey. Koma izi zitha kukhala mgwirizano wapadziko lonse wokhudza mayikowa. Chifukwa chake, pali zokonda zachuma ndi ndale zomwe zikukhudzidwa."

en: Shared concerns over Iran's growing influence in the region -- along with its nuclear energy program -- provide important common ground between Riyadh and Ankara, says international relations professor Soli Ozel of Istanbul's Kadir Has University, especially as American attention is expected to pivot away from the Middle East and toward China.
ny: Zodetsa nkhawa zomwe Iran ikuchulukira mderali - komanso pulogalamu yake yamphamvu ya nyukiliya - ikupereka mfundo zofunika kwambiri pakati pa Riyadh ndi Ankara, atero pulofesa wa ubale wapadziko lonse Soli Ozel wa ku yunivesite ya Kadir Has ku Istanbul, makamaka chifukwa chidwi cha America chikuyembekezeka kuchotsedwa. ku Middle East ndi ku China.

en: "Turkey does propose itself as a counterweight to Iran. Both countries have an interest along with all the western countries for Iran not to be as influential throughout the region as it is today," said Ozel. "And the Iranians are also constantly sending signals that they are not going to let others draw them away from those countries - Iraq, Lebanon and Syria - where they have quite a lot of influence."
ny: "Turkey imadziwonetsera yokha ngati yotsutsana ndi Iran. Mayiko onsewa ali ndi chidwi pamodzi ndi mayiko onse akumadzulo kuti Iran asakhale ndi mphamvu kudera lonselo monga momwe zilili lero, "anatero Ozel. "Ndiponso anthu aku Irani akutumizanso zidziwitso kuti salola ena kuwachotsa kumayiko amenewo - Iraq, Lebanon ndi Syria - komwe ali ndi mphamvu zambiri."

en: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
ny: Ulendo wa Erdogan waku Saudi ndi gawo limodzi la mfundo zambiri zofuna kukonza ubale mdera lonselo pofuna kuthetsa kudzipatula. Purezidenti wa Turkey adayendera posachedwapa ku United Arab Emirates ndipo kumayambiriro kwa mwezi uno adalandira pulezidenti wa Israeli, Isaac Herzog.

en: But analyst Ozel warns Ankara is in a vulnerable position.
ny: Koma wopenda Ozel akuchenjeza kuti Ankara ali pachiwopsezo.

en: "Turkey alienated, insulted, offended a lot of countries with which it had at least decent relations. And they all recognize that this burst of diplomacy is coming out of weakness rather than strength," said Ozel.
ny: "Turkey idasiyanitsidwa, kunyozedwa, kukhumudwitsa mayiko ambiri omwe anali ndi ubale wabwino. Ndipo onse amazindikira kuti kuphulika kwa zokambiranazi kukuchokera ku kufooka osati mphamvu, "adatero Ozel.

en: But analysts say Ankara is banking on its importance as a potential bulwark to Iranian ambitions, a factor that may help overcome any remaining hostility among the neighbors it is trying to win back.
ny: Koma akatswiri akuti Ankara ikuyang'ana kufunikira kwake ngati chitetezo chothandizira zilakolako zaku Iran, zomwe zingathandize kuthana ndi chidani chilichonse pakati pa oyandikana nawo omwe akuyesera kuti abwerere.

en: Executions, Detentions Hang Over Saudi Legal Reforms
ny: Kuphedwa, Kutsekeredwa M'ndende Kumatengera Zosintha Zamalamulo ku Saudi

en: Saudi Arabia is pushing to revamp its harsh justice system but reforms are overshadowed by executions and tough treatment of dissidents, raising questions about how much will change.
ny: Saudi Arabia ikukakamizika kukonzanso machitidwe ake achilungamo koma zosintha zimaphimbidwa ndi kupha komanso kuzunza anthu otsutsa, zomwe zikubweretsa mafunso okhudza momwe zingasinthire.

en: The kingdom is known for its strict interpretation of Islamic sharia law, which forms the basis of its judicial system.
ny: Ufumuwu umadziwika chifukwa cha kumasulira kwake momveka bwino malamulo a sharia achisilamu, omwe ndi maziko a kayendetsedwe ka milandu.

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.
ny: Koma m’miyezi yaposachedwa idapita patsogolo ndi zosintha zomwe akatswiri akuti zingapangitse makhothi ake kuti azigwira ntchito ngati ena ku Middle East.

en: That effort hinges on a series of new laws for sensitive issues like women's divorce rights and judges' power to determine criminal sentences.
ny: Kuyesayesa kumeneku kumadalira pamindandanda ya malamulo atsopano okhudza nkhani zovuta monga ufulu wachisudzulo wa amayi ndi mphamvu za oweruza kuti apereke zigamulo zaupandu.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
ny: Adalengezedwa chaka chatha ndi wolamulira wa Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, miyeso, kuphatikiza malamulo oyamba olembedwa, akuwoneka kuti akugwirizana ndi cholinga cha Saudi Arabia chotsegulira dziko lapansi ndikufewetsa chithunzi chake chonyanyira.

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.
ny: Ngakhale otsutsa amavomereza kuti kusinthaku kungapangitse makhothi a Saudi kukhala odziwika bwino, nthawi zina.

en: But there is no expectation that restrictions on free speech will ease, or that the legal system will treat more favorably perceived opponents of the government.
ny: Koma palibe chiyembekezero chakuti ziletso za ufulu wa kulankhula zidzachepeka, kapena kuti dongosolo lazamalamulo lidzachitira bwino otsutsa boma omwe amalingaliridwa bwino.

en: And despite the reforms, authorities have simultaneously provided reminders of what gave Saudi Arabia its ruthless reputation in the first place, notably the mass execution of 81 men in a single day in March for offenses related to "terrorism."
ny: Ndipo ngakhale kusinthaku, akuluakulu aboma adaperekanso zikumbutso zomwe zidapatsa Saudi Arabia mbiri yake yankhanza, makamaka kuphedwa kwaunyinji kwa amuna 81 tsiku limodzi mu Marichi chifukwa cha zolakwa zokhudzana ndi "uchigawenga."

en: 'Notorious' system
ny: 'Notorious' system

en: Two new laws have already been approved by the Saudi Cabinet. One governs the admissibility of evidence, previously at the judges' discretion.
ny: Malamulo awiri atsopano avomerezedwa kale ndi nduna ya Saudi. Mmodzi amalamulira kuvomerezedwa kwa umboni, m'mbuyomu mwakufuna kwa oweruza.

en: The second, a family law, is to take effect in June. In a traditionally male-dominated system, it expands the rights of divorced women to alimony and custody of their children.
ny: Lachiwiri, lamulo la banja, liyenera kugwira ntchito mu June. M’dongosolo lamwambo lolamulidwa ndi amuna, limakulitsa maufulu a akazi osudzulidwa ku kulera ndi kulera ana awo.

en: Announcing the new law in March, Prince Mohammed said it represented "a major qualitative leap" for women's rights and "family stability."
ny: Polengeza lamulo latsopano mu Marichi, Prince Mohammed adati likuyimira "kudumpha kwakukulu" kwa ufulu wa amayi ndi "kukhazikika kwa banja."

en: The reforms seem partly to cater to foreign firms whose investment the kingdom is courting, said Adel al-Saeed, vice president of the European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.
ny: Zosinthazi zikuwoneka kuti zikuthandizira makampani akunja omwe ufumu wawo ukuyenda nawo, adatero Adel al-Saeed, wachiwiri kwa purezidenti wa European Saudi Organisation for Human Rights.

en: "The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image," he said.
ny: “Eni malipilo akuwopa kuyika ndalama m’dziko muno, lomwe ndi lodziwika bwino pankhani yazamalamulo, ndiye malamulowa akufuna kusintha chithunzithunzi,” adatero.

en: The new penal code, yet to be unveiled, could bring further dramatic changes.
ny: Chilango chatsopano, chomwe sichidzaululidwa, chingabweretse kusintha kwakukulu.

en: Under sharia, only apostasy, theft, revolt, armed robbery, adultery, drinking alcohol and slander carry prescribed sentences. Judges are left to determine punishment in other cases.
ny: Pansi pa sharia, mpatuko, kuba, kuwukira, kuba ndi zida, chigololo, kumwa mowa ndi miseche zimatengera ziganizo zoperekedwa. Oweruza amasiyidwa kuti asankhe chilango pa milandu ina.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.
ny: Pokhala ndi malamulo a zilango, "boma lidzayembekezera kuti oweruza asadalire maphunziro awo a sharia koma m'malo mwake pa malamulo alamulo (otengera sharia) ovomerezedwa ndi boma," anatero Nathan Brown, wophunzira pa yunivesite ya George Washington.

en: "As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region," said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.
ny: "Chotsatira chake, Saudi Arabia idzawoneka ngati malamulo a boma, mofanana ndi mayiko ambiri m'derali," adatero Brown, yemwe adaphunzira za kusintha kwa Saudi.

en: The result should be more "predictability," said Abdullah Alaoudh, a U.S.-based legal expert and government critic, as new rules "take away from the leeway ... that the judges used to have."
ny: Zotsatira zake ziyenera kukhala "zodziwikiratu," adatero Abdullah Alaoudh, katswiri wa zamalamulo ku US komanso wotsutsa boma, monga malamulo atsopano "amachotsa njira ... yomwe oweruza anali nayo."

en: But tighter regulation by the monarchy also "creates a larger problem: lack of independence," he added.
ny: Koma kulamuliridwa mwamphamvu ndi ufumuwo "kumabweretsanso vuto lalikulu: kusowa kwa ufulu," adawonjezera.

en: The king is the head of the Saudi judiciary and acts as the final court of appeal.
ny: Mfumuyo ndi mutu wa bwalo lamilandu la Saudi ndipo ndi khoti lomaliza la apilo.

en: Alaoudh's own father, prominent cleric Salman al-Awdah, has been held since 2017, seemingly in retaliation for a Twitter post that clashed with Saudi Arabia's policy at the time of isolating Qatar.
ny: Abambo ake a Alaoudh, mtsogoleri wodziwika bwino Salman al-Awdah, adasungidwa kuyambira 2017, akuwoneka kuti akubwezera zomwe adalemba pa Twitter zomwe zidasemphana ndi mfundo za Saudi Arabia panthawi yodzipatula Qatar.

en: He is one of many detained in an apparent crackdown on dissent and those who could challenge Prince Mohammed's power.
ny: Iye ndi m'modzi mwa ambiri omwe amangidwa chifukwa chotsutsana ndi omwe akutsutsa komanso omwe angatsutse mphamvu za Prince Mohammed.

en: One of the most prominent examples is former crown prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the CIA ally respected in the West for his efforts to counter violent extremism, but who King Salman ousted from the line of succession.
ny: Chimodzi mwazitsanzo zodziwika bwino ndi kalonga wakale Mohammed bin Nayef, mnzake wa CIA wolemekezedwa Kumadzulo chifukwa choyesetsa kuthana ndi ziwawa, koma yemwe Mfumu Salman adamuchotsa pamzere wotsatira.

en: Prince Nayef has not been seen in public since reports of his arrest in March 2020. His detention was never officially confirmed.
ny: Prince Nayef sanawonekere pagulu kuyambira pomwe malipoti akumangidwa mu Marichi 2020. Kumangidwa kwake sikunatsimikizidwe mwalamulo.

en: Shadow of Khashoggi
ny: Mthunzi wa Khashoggi

en: For government opponents, such cases reinforce questions about what difference the ongoing justice reforms will make.
ny: Kwa otsutsa boma, milandu yotereyi imalimbitsa mafunso okhudza kusiyana kwa kusintha kwa chilungamo komwe kukuchitika.

en: "In my view, this is all window-dressing," said Madawi al-Rasheed, a U.K.-based academic and spokesperson for the opposition National Assembly Party founded by exiles.
ny: "Malingaliro anga, zonsezi ndi zongovala zenera," atero a Madawi al-Rasheed, wophunzira waku UK komanso wolankhulira chipani chotsutsa cha National Assembly Party chomwe chinakhazikitsidwa ndi anthu omwe ali ku ukapolo.

en: "It's very, very difficult to see what the meaning is of these reforms apart from the project of portraying (Prince Mohammed) as a reformer."
ny: "Ndizovuta kwambiri kuwona tanthauzo la zosinthazi kupatula ntchito yowonetsera (Prince Mohammed) ngati wokonzanso."

en: Hanging over any discussion of justice and legal reform in Saudi Arabia is the 2018 murder and dismemberment of critic and columnist Jamal Khashoggi in the kingdom's Istanbul consulate.
ny: Zomwe zatsala pang'ono kukambirana za chilungamo ndi kusintha kwalamulo ku Saudi Arabia ndi kuphedwa kwa 2018 ndi kuchotsedwa kwa wotsutsa komanso wolemba nkhani Jamal Khashoggi mu kazembe wa ufumu wa Istanbul.

en: A U.S. intelligence assessment found Prince Mohammed himself "approved" an operation to capture or kill Khashoggi, though Saudi officials deny this and say it was a "rogue" operation.
ny: Kafukufuku wanzeru waku US adapeza kuti Prince Mohammed mwiniyo "adavomereza" ntchito yolanda kapena kupha Khashoggi, ngakhale akuluakulu aku Saudi amakana izi ndikuti ndi "ntchito yoyipa".

en: In April, before Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan visited Riyadh on Thursday and embraced Prince Mohammed, Turkey transferred the trial in absentia of 26 suspects in the Khashoggi case to Saudi Arabia.
ny: M'mwezi wa Epulo, Purezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan asanapite ku Riyadh Lachinayi ndikukumbatira Prince Mohammed, Turkey idasamutsa mlanduwo popanda anthu 26 omwe akuwakayikira pa mlandu wa Khashoggi kupita ku Saudi Arabia.

en: Turkey's decision drew anguished protest from lawyers and Khashoggi's fiancée, who insisted Saudi courts couldn't possibly hold a credible trial.
ny: Chigamulo cha Turkey chidadzutsa ziwonetsero zomvetsa chisoni kuchokera kwa maloya komanso bwenzi la Khashoggi, yemwe adanenetsa kuti makhothi aku Saudi sakanatha kuzenga mlandu wodalirika.

en: For the loved ones of those locked away, Khashoggi's killing fuels a uniform fear of speaking out.
ny: Kwa okondedwa a omwe adatsekedwa, kupha kwa Khashoggi kumapangitsa mantha a yunifolomu kuti alankhule.

en: "I want to, many do, but we're scared," said a friend of Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, who has been detained along with his father since 2018.
ny: "Ndikufuna, ambiri amatero, koma tili ndi mantha," adatero mnzake wa Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, yemwe wamangidwa ndi abambo ake kuyambira 2018.

en: "Everyone knows what happened to Khashoggi."
ny: "Aliyense akudziwa zomwe zidachitikira Khashoggi."

en: Moroccan Prison Program Sets Out to De-Radicalize IS Veterans
ny: Pulogalamu Yandende Yaku Moroccan Imayamba Kuthetsa Magulu Ankhondo a IS

en: As a combatant for the Islamic State group who left his native Morocco to join what he felt was a holy fight in Syria, Mohsin says he saw all the horrors of war. "A terrifying experience," he says.
ny: Monga msilikali wa gulu la Islamic State yemwe adachoka kwawo ku Morocco kuti akalowe nawo ku nkhondo yomwe ankaganiza kuti inali yopatulika ku Syria, Mohsin akuti adawona zoopsa zonse za nkhondo. "Zochitika zochititsa mantha," akutero.

en: Now a prisoner, the 38-year-old claims he is no longer the fanatic he was then, enraged with a murderous hatred for non-Muslims. Captured in Turkey and extradited to Morocco, he is serving a 10-year prison term on terrorism charges.
ny: Tsopano mkaidi, wazaka 38 akuti salinso wotentheka yemwe anali panthawiyo, wokwiya ndi chidani chakupha anthu omwe si Asilamu. Atagwidwa ku Turkey ndikutumizidwa ku Morocco, akugwira ukaidi wazaka 10 pa milandu yauchigawenga.

en: Now the former fighter has graduated with 14 other prisoners convicted of terror offenses from a Morocco de-radicalization program that might make them more eligible for an early release.
ny: Tsopano wankhondo wakaleyo adamaliza maphunziro ake ndi akaidi ena 14 omwe adapezeka ndi zigawenga kuchokera ku pulogalamu ya Morocco de-radicalization yomwe ingawapangitse kukhala oyenera kumasulidwa msanga.

en: The Associated Press and other media were invited to observe their graduation ceremony Thursday in a prison in Sale near the Moroccan capital, Rabat, and to interview some prisoners under monitored and controlled conditions. Prison administration officials picked out three men they said were willing to be interviewed.
ny: A Associated Press ndi atolankhani ena adaitanidwa kuti akawone mwambo wawo womaliza maphunziro Lachinayi kundende ku Sale pafupi ndi likulu la Morocco, Rabat, ndikufunsa akaidi ena omwe amayang'aniridwa ndikuwongolera. Akuluakulu oyang'anira ndende adasankha amuna atatu omwe adanena kuti akufuna kufunsidwa mafunso.

en: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma adalamula kuti akaidiwo asadziwike ndi mayina awo onse komanso kuti nkhope zawo zisamawonekere potchula zifukwa zachinsinsi.

en: But prison officials didn't listen to the interviews or intervene to shut down media lines of questioning or inmates' answers.
ny: Koma akuluakulu andende sanamvere zoyankhulanazo kapena kulowererapo kuti atseke mizere ya mafunso kapena mayankho a akaidi.

en: The 15 inmates in crisp shirts and trousers stood solemnly for Morocco's national anthem and were handed certificates. Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business. These most recent graduates were the ninth batch since the program started in 2017.
ny: Akaidi 15 ovala malaya owoneka bwino komanso mathalauza adayimilira mwachidwi nyimbo ya fuko la Morocco ndipo adapatsidwa ziphaso. Akuluakulu a ndende anati pulogalamu yothetsa mikanganoyi inali ya miyezi itatu ya makalasi a m’ndende a zachipembedzo, zamalamulo ndi zachuma, komanso kuti akaidiwo anaphunzitsidwanso za mmene angayambitsire bizinesi. Omaliza maphunziro aposachedwa kwambiri anali gulu lachisanu ndi chinayi kuyambira pomwe pulogalamuyi idayamba mu 2017.

en: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."
ny: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, mkulu wa chikhalidwe cha chikhalidwe cha anthu ndi kubwezeretsedwa kwa akaidi ku ndende ya Morocco, adati pulogalamuyi ndi yodzifunira ndipo imagwira ntchito ndi akaidi "kusintha khalidwe lawo ndikusintha moyo wawo."

en: "It enables prisoners to form an awareness of the gravity of their mistakes," he said.
ny: "Zimathandiza akaidi kuzindikira kukula kwa zolakwa zawo," adatero.

en: Graduating from the program doesn't make inmates automatically eligible for early release, but does increase their chances of getting a royal pardon or a reduced sentence. That's been the case for just over half the program's 222 graduates so far, the prison administration says. Since 2019, the training has also been offered to women convicted under Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act. Ten women have graduated so far — all of them since released, including eight with pardons.
ny: Kumaliza maphunzirowa sikumapangitsa kuti akaidi akhale oyenerera kumasulidwa msanga, koma kumawonjezera mwayi wawo wolandira chikhululukiro chachifumu kapena chigamulo chocheperako. Izi zakhala zikuchitika kwa opitilira theka la omaliza maphunziro 222 mpaka pano, atero oyang'anira ndende. Kuyambira 2019, maphunzirowa aperekedwanso kwa amayi omwe ali ndi mlandu pansi pa lamulo la Morocco la Anti-Terrorism Act. Azimayi khumi amaliza maphunziro mpaka pano - onse kuyambira pomwe adatulutsidwa, kuphatikiza asanu ndi atatu omwe adakhululukidwa.

en: Called "Moussalaha," meaning "reconciliation" in Arabic, the program is offered to prisoners who have demonstrated a readiness to disavow extremism.
ny: Pulogalamuyi imatchedwa "Moussalaha," kutanthauza "chiyanjanitso" m'Chiarabu, pulogalamuyo imaperekedwa kwa akaidi omwe asonyeza kuti ali okonzeka kukana kuchita zinthu monyanyira.

en: Mohsin said he left to fight in Syria in 2012. A school dropout as a teen, he said he "was virtually illiterate and couldn't discern good from bad." He said he was radicalized by people who showed him extremist videos "about the divine obligation to battle those who don't follow Islamic principles and to murder non-Muslims."
ny: Mohsin adati adachoka kuti akamenye nkhondo ku Syria mu 2012. Atasiya sukulu ali wachinyamata, adanena kuti "sanaphunzire ndipo sankatha kusiyanitsa chabwino ndi choipa." Ananenanso kuti adanyansidwa ndi anthu omwe amamuwonetsa mavidiyo owopsa "okhudza udindo waumulungu wolimbana ndi omwe satsatira mfundo zachisilamu komanso kupha anthu omwe si Asilamu."

en: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."
ny: Ku Syria, "ndinawona kuphana, kugwiriridwa, ndi kuba," adatero. "Ndidazindikira patapita nthawi kuti nkhondo yomwe ikuchitika m'dzina la Chisilamu inalibe chochita ndi chipembedzo chathu."

en: He escaped to Turkey in 2018 and was detained for a year there before being extradited to Morocco.
ny: Anathawira ku Turkey mu 2018 ndipo adamangidwa kwa chaka chimodzi asanatumizidwe ku Morocco.

en: He says he has now disavowed extremism.
ny: Iye wati tsopano wasiya kuchita zinthu monyanyira.

en: "That period of my life has passed," he said.
ny: “Nthaŵi imeneyo ya moyo wanga yapita,” iye anatero.

en: Numerous Moroccans have traveled to Syria, Iraq and elsewhere to join extremist groups. Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself. Five suicide attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.
ny: Anthu ambiri a ku Morocco apita ku Syria, Iraq ndi kwina kulikonse kuti agwirizane ndi magulu ochita zinthu monyanyira. Morocco idakumananso ndi ziwonetsero zingapo. Zigawenga zisanu zodzipha ku Casablanca mu 2003 zidapha anthu 33. Mu 2011, kuphulika kunawononga cafe ku Marrakech, kupha anthu 17, ambiri mwa iwo ndi alendo obwera kunja.

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.
ny: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, katswiri wa zamaganizo komanso membala wa komiti ya sayansi ya pulogalamuyi, adati mwa anthu 156 omwe adatulutsidwa atapita ku maphunzirowa, m'modzi yekha wagwidwanso akuchita mlandu.

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.
ny: Munthu ameneyo adapezeka ndi mlandu wosagwirizana ndi uchigawenga, adatero.

en: Iran Gets Opportunity to Sell Auto Parts to Russian Carmaker
ny: Iran Imapeza Mwayi Wogulitsa Zida Zagalimoto kwa Wopanga Magalimoto waku Russia

en: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.
ny: Wa membala wa bungwe la Iran la opanga zida zamagalimoto akuti opanga aku Iran ali ndi mwayi wotumiza katundu wawo kwa wopanga magalimoto aku Russia, atolankhani aboma atero.

en: The late Monday report quoted Hossein Bahrainian as saying "a prominent Russian car maker" requested parts from Iran. He did not name the manufacturer. He said it requested brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner parts and other components.
ny: Lipoti lakumapeto Lolemba lidagwira mawu a Hossein Bahrainian akuti "wopanga magalimoto otchuka ku Russia" adapempha magawo ku Iran. Sanatchule wopanga. Iye adati idapempha ma brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner ndi zina.

en: Both Iran and Russia are under U.S. sanctions but the export of Iranian cars and car parts is not subject to sanctions.
ny: Onse a Iran ndi Russia ali pansi pa zilango za US koma kutumiza kunja kwa magalimoto aku Iran ndi zida zamagalimoto sikuloledwa.

en: The import of automobiles to Iran is also not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.
ny: Kulowetsedwa kwa magalimoto ku Iran sikukhalanso ndi zilango. Komabe, Tehran sanalowetse magalimoto kuchokera ku 2018, United States itachoka pa mgwirizano wa nyukiliya pakati pa Iran ndi maulamuliro apadziko lonse ndikuika zilango zamafuta ndi mabanki ku Iran.

en: Western nations stopped exporting to Russia after the invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Mayiko akumadzulo adasiya kutumiza ku Russia pambuyo pa kuwukira kwa Ukraine.

en: Iran in recent years has exported car radiators and suspension systems to Russia. In the past it exported cars to Iraq, Syria and Venezuela.
ny: Iran m'zaka zaposachedwa yatumiza ma radiator amagalimoto ndi makina oyimitsa ku Russia. M'mbuyomu idatumiza magalimoto ku Iraq, Syria ndi Venezuela.

en: Tehran and Moscow have had close relations in recent years, especially after Iran's sole nuclear power plant went online in 2011 with help from Russia.
ny: Tehran ndi Moscow akhala ndi ubale wapamtima m'zaka zaposachedwa, makamaka makina a nyukiliya a Iran okha atapita pa intaneti mu 2011 mothandizidwa ndi Russia.

en: Separately on Tuesday, Iran said it has played a mediatory role in the war in Ukraine.
ny: Payokha Lachiwiri, Iran idati idachita nawo gawo pankhondo yaku Ukraine.

en: "So far twice I have conveyed messages from the foreign minister of Ukraine to my Russian counterpart," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian in a phone conversation with his Irish counterpart. He said Iran supports diplomatic solutions for restoring peace and stability.
ny: "Kufikira pano kawiri ndapereka mauthenga ochokera kwa nduna yakunja ya Ukraine kwa mnzanga waku Russia," adatero Nduna Yowona Zakunja Hossein Amir Abdollahian polankhula pafoni ndi mnzake waku Ireland. Anati Iran ikuthandizira njira zothetsera mtendere ndi bata.

en: Abdollahian did not elaborate but said Iran "opposes war and displacement of human beings in Ukraine," and other paces like Yemen, the Palestinian lands and Afghanistan.
ny: Abdollahian sanafotokoze zambiri koma adati Iran "ikutsutsa nkhondo ndi kusamuka kwa anthu ku Ukraine," ndi maulendo ena monga Yemen, maiko a Palestina ndi Afghanistan.

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
ny: Kusiyanasiyana, Malingaliro Atsopano Amagwiritsidwa Ntchito ku Middle East Coverage

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
ny: Natalia Sancha wakhala akugwiritsa ntchito njira yothandizana ndi utolankhani. Akapita kukatumikira, amalankhula ndi anthu ena nkhani yofanana ndi ya maganizo awo.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
ny: Izi zina zimachokera ku chidwi chofuna kukamba nkhani zomwe sizinafotokozedwe bwino, koma monga mtolankhani wachikazi m'dera lomwe muli amuna ambiri, akuti mgwirizano ndi kuthandiza amayi omwe amagwira nawo ntchito zakhala zofunikira nthawi zonse.

en: "I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story," the 42-year-old journalist said.
ny: "Ndimayankhula ndi atolankhani aamuna ndi aakazi, ndipo nthawi zonse ndimazindikira kuti amayi anali ndi maganizo ofanana, chifukwa tinali ndi zochitika zofanana pamene tikulemba nkhaniyi," adatero mtolankhani wazaka 42.

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
ny: Mgwirizanowu udayamba kugwira ntchito mu 2020 pomwe wofalitsa adafunsa Sancha ngati akufuna kulemba buku lonena za Syria.

en: She countered with a better offer.
ny: Iye adatsutsa ndi kupereka kwabwinoko.

en: "I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect," she said. "I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense."
ny: "Ndidamuuza kuti zomwe atolankhani achikazi amafotokozera m'derali zitha kukhala ndi zotsatira zina," adatero. "Ndikadatha kulemba bukhulo ndekha, koma silikanakhala ndi malingaliro ofanana."

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
ny: Sancha anachokera ku Andalusia kum'mwera kwa Spain, zaka 14 zapitazi ku Middle East akufotokoza za mikangano ya ku Iraq, Syria ndi Yemen, komanso ku Egypt, Lebanon ndi Tunisia.

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
ny: Agwira ntchito posachedwa ndi dipatimenti yolumikizirana ndi European Union, atachoka ku Beirut pazifukwa zaumoyo kutsatira kuphulika kwakukulu komwe kudagwedeza mzindawu mu 2020.

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to. Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
ny: Azimayi "ali ndi zochitika zosiyana chifukwa tikanapita kumalo omwe anzathu achimuna sankazolowera. Osati chifukwa ndife ochenjera, koma chifukwa chakuti ambiri a m'derali akadali Aarabu, Asilamu komanso osagwirizana ndi amuna ndi akazi," Sancha adauza VOA. .

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
ny: Kukhala ndi atolankhani achikazi kumakhudza, adatero.

en: "If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict."
ny: "Ndikadakhala ngati wowerenga, ndingakonde kukhala ndi mkazi wondiuza nkhaniyi chifukwa ikhala pafupifupi 100 peresenti ya anthu, zomwe zikutanthauza kuti mukhala ndi nkhani yophatikizana pa kusamvana. ."

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
ny: Kwa bukhu lake, Sancha adafikira azimayi ena omwe amafotokoza za Middle East, kuti awonetsetse malingaliro osiyanasiyana kuchokera kwa atolankhani akunja ndi akumaloko.

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
ny: Zotsatira za mgwirizano wazaka ziwiri ndi Bullets for All, yomwe inatulutsidwa mu Spanish mu April.

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
ny: M'bukuli, "tikufotokoza nkhani imodzi ndi mawu osiyanasiyana omwe amaimira amayi onse" ochokera m'derali, adatero Sancha.

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war. It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
ny: Iliyonse imapereka malingaliro ake pazokhudza mbiri yakale, kuphatikiza kugwa kwa maboma odziyimira pawokha, ziwonetsero zodziwika bwino komanso nkhondo. Ikuunikanso tsankho ndi nkhanza zomwe amayi amakumana nazo m'chipinda cha nkhani komanso pa ntchito.

en: Making connections
ny: Kupanga migwirizano

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
ny: Kumvetsetsa chinenero ndi chikhalidwe kumathandiza kwambiri kuti zinthu zipite patsogolo m’derali, akutero Maya Gebeily. Mkulu wa bungwe la Reuters ku Lebanon, Syria ndi Jordan ndi m'modzi mwa omwe adapereka bukuli.

en: "There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting," she said.
ny: "Pali zambiri zonena ndikuwonetsa momwe atolankhani achimayi amawonera omwe adakhudzidwanso ndi azimayi omwe adakumana nawo pomwe amalemba," adatero.

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
ny: Wobadwira ku US kwa makolo aku Lebanon, Gebeily adayamba ntchito yake ya utolankhani mu 2013 ndi tsamba lazankhani ku Beirut, Lebanon. Adapitilira kudera lonse la Agence France-Presse asanalowe ku Reuters.

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting. Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
ny: Gebeily adati mbiri yake yaku America ndi Lebanon idamuthandiza kumvetsetsa bwino derali, zomwe zidapangitsa kuti afotokozere. Kudziwa chinenero cha m’deralo n’kofunika kwambiri.

en: "When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust," she said. "If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything. It grants you a very beautiful kind of access."
ny: "Pofunsa nduna kapena munthu wothawa kwawo kapena womenyera ufulu wawo, chinthu chofunikira kwambiri ndikuwakhulupirira," adatero. "Ngati mumatha kulankhula chinenerocho ndikuwapangitsa kukhala omasuka kuyambira pachiyambi, amasintha chirichonse. Zimakupatsani mwayi wokongola kwambiri."

en: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
ny: Kuphatikiza pa Iraq ndi Lebanon, Gebeily, wazaka 30, wapitanso ku Syria kukamenya nkhondo yolimbana ndi zigawenga za Islamic State (IS).

en: "Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out," she said.
ny: "Ndakhala ndi mwayi wofikira madera ena mwachindunji popanda kugwira ntchito ndi womasulira kapena wokonza, zomwe zimapanganso momwe nkhanizo zimakhalira," adatero.

en: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
ny: Mtolankhani waku Syria ndi aku Kurd, Khabat Abbas, yemwe adalembapo nkhani zankhondo ku Syria, akutsimikizira kufunika kwa izi.

en: "Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you," she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
ny: "Kudziwa chilankhulo komanso chikhalidwe chomwe chimapatsa anthu chitonthozo kuti akumasulireni," adauza VOA kuchokera ku Qamishli, Syria.

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria and interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
ny: Chidziwitso chimenecho chinathandiza pamene Abbas, 34, anali pa ntchito ndi Sancha mu March 2021. Iwo anapita ku ndende ya Kurdish kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Syria ndipo anafunsa a jihadists achikazi omwe amagwirizana ndi IS, chifukwa cha nkhani ku El Pais.

en: "While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the camp refused to talk to them," Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
ny: "Ndili ku Qamishli [kumpoto chakum'maŵa kwa Syria], ndidakumana ndi atolankhani awiri aku Britain, anzanga abwino kwambiri, omwe adakhumudwitsidwa Shamima Begum ndi azimayi ena pamsasawo adakana kulankhula nawo," adatero Sancha, ponena za mtsikana wina. yemwe adachoka kunyumba kwawo ku Britain wazaka 15 kuti alowe nawo IS.

en: "Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents," Sancha said.
ny: "Wowakonza anali mwamuna, kotero akazi a Jihadist sanalankhule nawo chifukwa ndi okhwima, ndipo samayankhula ndi amuna. Koma ndinatha kukhala ndi Shamima ndi amayi ena, omwe adayankhulana modabwitsa kuchokera m'mahema awo, " Sancha anatero.

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.
ny: Abbas adatenga nawo gawo polankhula ndi azimayiwo, adawonjezera.

en: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Sancha ndi Gebeily, Abbas anakulira m'dera lachi Kurdish la Syria, komwe mpaka nkhondo inayamba mu 2011, utolankhani kunalibe.

en: "Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines," Abbas said. "It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues."
ny: "Anthu wamba m'dera lathu adazolowera kuwona azimayi akunyamula zida ndikumenya nkhondo, koma anali atazolowera kuwona mkazi atagwira kamera m'misewu komanso kutsogolo," adatero Abbas. "Zinanditengera nthawi yambiri kuti nditsimikizire banja langa ndi anthu kuti ndili bwino, ngati si bwino, monga anzanga achimuna."

en: Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.
ny: Utolankhani unamusangalatsa chifukwa nkhani ya ku Middle East nthawi zambiri imanenedwa ndi atolankhani achimuna, akumaloko komanso akunja.

en: "The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East, that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.
ny: "Nkhaniyi sinasinthe chifukwa cha izi, koma ngati atolankhani azimayi am'deralo ndi apadziko lonse lapansi apeza mwayi weniweni wofotokoza nkhani ya Middle East, nkhaniyo imatha kusintha, zomwe zingakhudze momwe ena amawonera dera lino," adatero Abbas.

en: Sancha also believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are viewed in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.
ny: Sancha akukhulupiriranso kuti amayi omwe ali mu utolankhani amakhudza momwe nkhani zimawonera m'derali, kuphatikizapo kupsinjika maganizo pambuyo pa zoopsa komanso zotsatira zake pa thanzi la amayi, komanso nkhani monga chiwawa ndi mowa.

en: "We talk about all these issues that men normally wouldnt not speak about," she said.
ny: "Timakambirana za nkhani zonsezi zomwe amuna sanganene," adatero.

en: Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction
ny: Mtsogoleri wa Alonda aku Iran ati Israeli Ikupanga Zoyenera Kudziwononga Yekha

en: Israel's actions are creating conditions for its own destruction, Irans Revolutionary Guards commander on Friday told a Jerusalem Day rally at which the countrys new domestically-made Kheibar Buster missile was displayed.
ny: Zochita za Israeli zikupangitsa kuti ziwonongedwe, mkulu wa asilikali a Irans Revolutionary Guards Lachisanu adauza msonkhano wa Jerusalem Day pomwe zida za Kheibar Buster zopangidwa mdziko muno zidawonetsedwa.

en: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.
ny: Kanema wa kanema wa boma adati mamiliyoni aku Iran adalowa nawo misonkhano yokondwerera Tsiku la Quds, dzina lachiarabu la Yerusalemu, pamaulendo oyendetsedwa ndi boma m'dziko lonselo.

en: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.
ny: Zinawonetsa mbendera ya Israeli ikuwotchedwa ndipo magulu a anthu kuzungulira dzikolo akufuula mokweza mawu akuti "Imfa ku America, Imfa kwa Israeli".

en: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.
ny: Mtsogoleri wamkulu Ayatollah Ali Khamenei adanena m'mawu ake pawailesi yakanema kuti zionetsero zotsutsana ndi Israeli ndi kuwukira zikuwonetsa kuti anthu aku Palestine amakana kusagwirizana ndi akuluakulu achiarabu ndi Israeli.

en: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
