en: Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel forces played a pivotal role in the countrys 1994 genocide in which hundreds of thousands of people were killed.
ny: Karugarama adati Mbarushimana ndi zigawenga zake za FDLR adachita gawo lalikulu pakuphana kwamtundu wa 1994 komwe anthu masauzande ambiri adaphedwa.

en: "We believe that, in the next couple of weeks after due process has taken place in France, he should be able to be transferred to The Hague in the Netherlands to face charges and be prosecuted for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed within the territory of the DRC."
ny: "Tikukhulupirira kuti, m'masabata angapo otsatira pambuyo poti ndondomeko yachitika ku France, akuyenera kusamutsidwira ku The Hague ku Netherlands kuti akaimbidwe milandu ndikuimbidwa milandu yankhondo komanso milandu yolimbana ndi anthu yomwe idachitika m'derali. ku DRC."

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.
ny: Nduna ya Zachilungamo idatinso Kigali igwirizana ndi International Criminal Court pakuzenga mlandu kwa Mbarushimana.

en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18
ny: Nduna Zakunja zaku Britain, ku France Kulimbikitsanso Njira Yamtendere ku DRC - 2002-01-18

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
ny: Atumiki akunja aku Britain ndi France apita ku Democratic Republic of Congo Lolemba kukayamba ulendo wamasiku atatu wa mayiko anayi kudera lamavuto la Central Africa.

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
ny: Ntchitoyi idzatsogoleredwa ndi Mlembi wa Zakunja ku Britain Jack Straw ndi mnzake waku France Hubert Vedrine.

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
ny: Adzacheza ku Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi ndi Uganda.

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
ny: Cholinga chawo chachikulu ndikupumira moyo watsopano munjira yamtendere ku Congo yomwe ili ndi nkhondo.

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
ny: Makamaka, aku Britain ndi a ku France akufuna kuwona kuchotsedwa kwa asitikali akunja omwe amathandizira boma la Kongo (n Kinshasa, kuchotsedwa kwa zigawenga zomwe zimatenga theka la dzikolo, ndi zokambirana zamtendere kuti athetse mkangano.

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
ny: Mlembi Wachilendo Wachilendo ku Britain Straw adati ntchitoyi ilinso ndi cholinga chofuna kuonetsetsa kuti dziko la Congo lisakhale Afghanistan ina.

en: "The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states," he said.
ny: "Pa 11 Seputembala wapangitsa kuti zikhale zofunikira kwambiri kuti tichitepo kanthu polimbana ndi zomwe zidalephera, komanso mayiko omwe adalephera," adatero.

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
ny: Ku Kinshasa, ndunazi zikumana ndi Purezidenti wa Congo Joseph Kabila. Anatenga ulamuliro chaka chimodzi chapitacho, bambo ake, pulezidenti Laurent Kabila, ataphedwa ndi mmodzi mwa omwe ankamuteteza.

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
ny: Malo awo otsatira adzakhala Kigali kukakambirana ndi Purezidenti wa Rwanda Paul Kagame, ndi mtsogoleri wa zigawenga za Rally for Congolese Democracy, Adolphe Onusumba.

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
ny: Ndunazi zicheza mwachidule ku Burundi kukakambirana za nkhondo yapachiweniweni yomwe ili mdzikolo ndi Purezidenti Pierre Buyoya.

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
ny: Ulendowu ukathera ku Uganda, komwe kukukonzekera misonkhano ndi Purezidenti Yoweri Museveni ndi Jean-Pierre Bemba, yemwe amatsogolera zigawenga za Movement for the Liberation of Congo.

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
ny: UNICEF Ikankhira Kuthetsa Child Solliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum. The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations loona za ana la UNICEF likukakamira kuti ana a asilikali achotsedwe m'madera a Nyanja Yaikulu mu Africa, pamene maulendo angapo amtendere akuwonjezeka. Bungweli lati ndalama zilipo zothandizira anawa kusiya usilikali ndikuyambanso moyo wawo.

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units. "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations. We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group. But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la UNICEF loona za chitetezo cha ana, Manuel Fontaine, wati ntchito zamtendere ku Uganda, Democratic Republic of Congo ndi Rwanda zikuthandizira kuti ana ambiri osakwanitsa zaka 18 achoke m'magulu omenyera nkhondo. "Tikulimbikira kuti asilikali a ana akhoza kuchotsedwa, ngakhale pakakhala mikangano. Sitiyenera kudikirira mtendere kuti titulutse ana amtundu uliwonse wa zida zankhondo. Koma, mwachiwonekere, ndiyo nthawi yabwino pakali pano. Ndizothandiza kwambiri kuti anthu athetsedwe. " Bambo Fontaine anatero.

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army. He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
ny: Iye wati pakadali pano kuli asilikali ana 1,200 ku Uganda, omwe akumenyana makamaka ndi zigawenga za Lord's Resistance Army. Iye wati pazaka 14 zapitazi, gululi labera ana pafupifupi 10,000, anyamata kuti amenyane komanso atsikana kukhala akapolo ogonana.

en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
ny: Bungwe la UNICEF linanena kuti dziko la Democratic Republic of Congo lidakali ndi ana pafupifupi 10,000 olembedwa ntchito yomenya nkhondo, pamene Rwanda ili ndi ana okwana 2,000 omenya nawo nkhondo.

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers. They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
ny: Bungwe la UNICEF limati, ngakhale kuti ana ena samenya nawo nkhondo mwachindunji, amakumana ndi zoopsa zambiri. Atha kugwiritsidwa ntchito monga onyamula katundu, onyamula katundu wolemera kwambiri, kapena ngati amithenga kapena akazitape opereka chidziŵitso ndi kufufuza dera la adani.

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases. The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
ny: Nthawi zina, anyamata, koma makamaka atsikana, amagwiritsidwa ntchito ngati akapolo ogonana. Amakumana ndi ziwawa komanso HIV-AIDS ndi matenda ena opatsirana pogonana. Atsikana atha kutenga mimba, zomwe zimapangitsa kuti zikhale zovuta kuti abwerere m'madera awo.

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money. He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units. Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
ny: Manuel Fontaine wa UNICEF akuti kutsitsa anthu kumatenga nthawi komanso ndalama. Iye akuti anawo ayenera kuwapeza kaye, kenako n’kuchotsedwa m’boma lawo kapena magulu oukira boma. Kenako, pakufunika ndalama zowathandiza kumanganso moyo wawo. Izi zimaphatikizapo kupereka masukulu, maphunziro a ntchito zamanja ndi chisamaliro chaumoyo.

en: "You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them. They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited. So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: "Simukufuna kuwasala komanso kuwasankha payekhapayekha. Iwo akubwerera kumadera kumene kuli ana ena ambiri, omwe ambiri mwa iwo adavutika ndi zotsatira za nkhondo, ngakhale sanalembedwe. Choncho, mukuyesera kuti apange ntchito m'madera omwe ali ndi ntchito zambiri, zomwe zingaperekedwe kwa ana onsewo," a Fontaine adatero.

en: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children. He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough. He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
ny: Bambo Fontaine akuti, monga gawo la mabungwe osiyanasiyana amtendere m'dera la Great Lakes, Banki Yadziko Lonse ndi mabungwe ena akupereka ndalama zokwana madola 500 miliyoni kuti athandize kuthetsa ana. Iye wati, mwatsoka, mabungwe omwe akufunika m’boma sadakhazikikebe m’maiko ena kuti ntchitoyi ichitike mwachangu. Akuti ndichifukwa chake bungwe la UNICEF likufunitsitsa kuti nyumba zoterezi zitheke, kuti ana abwerere kunyumba ndikuyambanso kukhala ndi moyo wabwinobwino.

en: Goma Residents Hopeful Rebel Withdrawal Spells Peace in Eastern Congo
ny: Anthu okhala ku Goma Akufuna Kusiya Zigawenga Zikutanthauza Mtendere ku Eastern Congo

ny: DRC Imatsutsa zigawenga za M23 pa zipolopolo za Rwanda

ny: Palibe media media yomwe ilipo pakadali pano

ny: Zigawenga za M23 Akuchoka Pamalo ku E. Congo

ny: Tanzania Yapempha Uganda Kuti Ithandize Kuthetsa Maubwenzi ndi Rwanda

ny: Rwanda Imadzudzula DRC Kuwombera M'malire

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
ny: Banki Yadziko Lonse, Nike Agwirizana ndi Initiative ya 'The Girl Effect'

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
ny: Bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative limagwirizana ndi World Bank, Nike Foundation ndi maboma a mayiko omwe akutukuka ndi otukuka kuti athe kulimbikitsa atsikana m'mayiko osauka.

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
ny: Pulogalamuyi ya zaka ziwiri ikuthandiza atsikana ku Asia, Africa ndi Middle East kupeza maphunziro ndi luso lomwe akufunikira kuti asinthe ntchito.

en: "My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh," American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
ny: "Dzina langa ndi Sanchita. Ndimachokera kumudzi wawung'ono wotchedwa Ishwarpur ku Bangladesh," wojambula wa ku America Anne Hathaway anapereka mizere yake mwamphamvu kuchokera kuseri kwa nsanja ku World Bank monga momwe amachitira pawindo lasiliva, akufotokoza nkhani ya mtsikana wosauka. .

en: "When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy," she continued. "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
ny: "Mwana akabadwa ku Ishwarpur, mabanja amayembekeza kuti adzakhala mnyamata," adatero. "Zakhala motere kwa nthawi yayitali monga aliyense angakumbukire.

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
ny: Amakhulupirira kuti anyamata adzathandizira ndalama za banja kumalo kumene anthu ali osauka kwambiri.

en: "These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
ny: "Zinthuzi ndizodziwika bwino kwa omwe amapindula ndi Adolescent Girls Initiative.

en: Who benefits?A dozen such teenage girls and young women visited the World Bank from developing Asian, Middle Eastern and African countries.
ny: Ndani amapindula? Atsikana ndi atsikana khumi ndi awiri otere adapita ku World Bank kuchokera kumayiko omwe akutukuka ku Asia, Middle East ndi Africa.

en: They were just a few of the girls who benefit from training and education programs that help them transition from school to employment.
ny: Anali ochepa chabe mwa atsikana omwe amapindula ndi maphunziro ndi maphunziro omwe amawathandiza kusintha kuchoka kusukulu kupita kuntchito.

en: Hathaway told the audience that, with the help of a development organization, Sanchita gained an education and borrowed $60 to buy a cow and start a vegetable garden.
ny: Hathaway anauza omvera kuti, mothandizidwa ndi bungwe lachitukuko, Sanchita adaphunzira maphunziro ndipo adabwereka $ 60 kuti agule ng'ombe ndikuyamba munda wamasamba.

en: The teenage girl could then afford to pay her own school fees, as well as her brother's, and contribute to her family in such a way that Sanchita's parents hope she does not marry any time soon.Hathaway spoke of her own childhood in a comfortable suburban U.S. neighborhood, and of a time when she had no idea about the kind of circumstances Sanchita faced nor how much girls need safe spaces for education.
ny: Kenako mtsikanayo akanatha kudzilipirira yekha fizi ya kusukulu, komanso ya mchimwene wakeyo, n’kuthandizanso banja lake m’njira yoti makolo a Sanchita ayembekezere kuti sadzakwatiwa posachedwa. Oyandikana nawo aku US, komanso nthawi yomwe samadziwa za mtundu wamavuto omwe Sanchita amakumana nawo komanso kuchuluka kwa atsikana omwe amafunikira malo otetezeka kuti aphunzire.

en: "Places that could teach them how to take the light they have as girls and ignite the world," explained Hathaway.
ny: "Malo omwe angawaphunzitse momwe angatengere kuwala komwe ali nako ngati atsikana ndikuyatsa dziko," adatero Hathaway.

en: "I wouldn't know how much the world needs 'The Girl Effect.'"  Girl power"The Girl Effect" is what the Adolescent Girls Initiative wants to see happen for 600 million girls in developing countries.
ny: "Sindikanadziwa kuti dziko likufunikira zochuluka bwanji 'The Girl Effect.'" Mphamvu ya Atsikana"The Girl Effect" ndi zomwe bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative likufuna kuti zichitike kwa atsikana 600 miliyoni m'mayiko osauka.

en: Overall, an estimated one-third of young women in developing nations are not employed and not in school.World Bank President Robert Zoellick said underinvesting in girls impedes development.
ny: Ponseponse, pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a atsikana achichepere m’maiko otukuka kumene salembedwa ntchito kapenanso kusukulu.Pulezidenti wa Banki Yadziko Lonse Robert Zoellick anati kusaika ndalama mochepera kwa atsikana kumalepheretsa chitukuko.

en: He added that educating girls also makes sense for poor families, noting that an extra year of secondary schooling can raise their wages by 10 to 20 percent.
ny: Iye adaonjeza kuti kuphunzitsa atsikana kumamvekanso kwa mabanja osauka, ponena kuti chaka chowonjezera kusukulu ya sekondale akhoza kukweza malipiro awo ndi 10 mpaka 20 peresenti.

en: "If they earn greater income they also have greater access to reproductive health information and services, so then more likely to delay marriage and childbirth, have healthier babies and attain higher literacy rates," Zoellick said.
ny: "Ngati amalandira ndalama zambiri amakhalanso ndi mwayi wopeza zambiri zokhudzana ndi uchembere wabwino ndi ntchito, motero amatha kuchedwetsa kulowa m'banja ndi kubereka, kukhala ndi ana athanzi komanso odziwa kuwerenga," adatero Zoellick.

en: "The evidence strongly suggests that investing in adolescent girls is a key way to break inter-generational patterns of poverty."
ny: "Umboni umasonyeza kuti kuyika ndalama kwa atsikana achichepere ndi njira yaikulu yothetsera umphawi wapakati pa mibadwo."

en: Current operations The Adolescent Girls Initiative public-private partnership, with its $20 million in funds, is already at work in seven countries, with plans to expand to Haiti and Yemen.         Mayra Buvinic talks about the Adolescent Girls Initiative
ny: Ntchito zomwe zikuchitika panopa The Adolescent Girls Initiative mgwirizano pakati pa anthu ndi payekha, ndi ndalama zake zokwana madola 20 miliyoni, zikugwira ntchito kale m'mayiko asanu ndi awiri, ndikukonzekera kufalikira ku Haiti ndi Yemen. Mayra Buvinic amalankhula za Adolescent Girls Initiative

en: "So where we are in Liberia and Nepal, young women are completing the first rounds of training," explained Mayra Buvinic, director of Gender and Development at the World Bank.
ny: "Choncho komwe tili ku Liberia ndi Nepal, atsikana akumaliza maphunziro oyambirira," adatero Mayra Buvinic, mkulu wa Gender and Development ku World Bank.

en: "In South Sudan, 100 adolescent girls' clubs will have opened in four states by the end of this month. In Jordan, female community college graduates are gaining access to vouchers.
ny: “Ku South Sudan, makalabu 100 a atsikana achichepere adzakhala atatsegulidwa m’maboma anayi kumapeto kwa mwezi uno. Ku Jordan, omaliza maphunziro a koleji aakazi akupeza ma vocha.

en: In Afghanistan, Lao PDR and Rwanda, assessments are being completed, and the projects will be launched at the end of this quarter.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, Lao PDR ndi Rwanda, zowunika zikumalizidwa, ndipo mapulojekiti adzakhazikitsidwa kumapeto kwa kotala ino.

en: "Thanks and praise Kebbeh Kamara tells the audience how she's benefited from the World Bank/Nike initiative
ny: "Zikomo ndi kutamanda Kebbeh Kamara akuuza omvera momwe adapindulira ndi ntchito ya World Bank/Nike.

en: Kebbeh Kamara said she has benefited from training in Greater Monrovia, Liberia.
ny: Kebbeh Kamara adati adapindula ndi maphunziro ku Greater Monrovia, Liberia.

en: Wearing a pink dress and sporty black headband decorated with rhinestones, she addressed the World Bank audience from the stage.
ny: Atavala diresi la pinki ndi chovala chakuda chakuda chokongoletsedwa ndi ma rhinestones, adalankhula ndi omvera a World Bank kuchokera pa siteji.

en: "I learned how to start a business, how to earn money on your own, how to be self-sustainable," she said, "how to save money and what to spend money for.
ny: Iye anati: “Ndinaphunzira mmene ndingayambitsire bizinezi, kupeza ndalama pawekha, kukhala wodzisamalira,” iye anatero, “kusunga ndalama ndiponso kugwiritsa ntchito ndalama.

en: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, 19, of Juba, Southern Sudan, told VOA she is enjoying her first trip to the United States and all the empowerment training and activities.
ny: Sarah Poni Saturnino, wazaka 19, waku Juba, Southern Sudan, adauza VOA kuti akusangalala ndi ulendo wake woyamba wopita ku United States komanso maphunziro onse opatsa mphamvu.

en: She said she hopes to take the lessons she has learned here in workshops back to the Adolescent Girls Initiative clubs in Southern Sudan.
ny: Iye adati akuyembekeza kutenga maphunziro omwe aphunzira pano mu zokambirana zobwerera ku makalabu a Adolescent Girls Initiative ku Southern Sudan.

en: "I learned about how to express yourself. Eye contact. Speak loud," explained Saturnino. "This way can give me really a voice to speak in front of people.
ny: Saturnino anati: “Ndinaphunzira mmene mungadzifotokozere. "Njira iyi ingandipatse mawu oti ndiyankhule pamaso pa anthu.

en: And even if I go back home, I'm not longer Sarah again -- I'm somebody now." Somebody who has earned the admiration of a fellow Southern Sudanese citizen, child-soldier-turned-rapper Emmanuel Jal.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale nditabwerera kunyumba, sindinenso Sarah -- ndine winawake tsopano." Wina yemwe adakopeka ndi nzika ya Southern Sudan, msilikali yemwe adasandulika kukhala rapper Emmanuel Jal.

en: A supporter of the Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal performed at the World Bank event.
ny: Wothandizira wa Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal adachita nawo mwambo wa World Bank.

en: The girls joined him on stage, beaming as they danced behind him -- as did at least one World Bank official -- while the audience of staffers in business suits took to their feet and raised their hands in the air as well.
ny: Atsikanawo adalowa naye pa siteji, akuwoneka ngati akuvina kumbuyo kwake - monga momwe adachitira wamkulu wa Banki Yadziko Lonse - pomwe omvera omwe adavala masuti abizinesi adayimilira ndikukwezanso manja awo m'mwamba.

en: Activists Press for Better Help to End Congo Rapes
ny: Omenyera ufulu Akufuna Thandizo Bwino Pothetsa Kugwiririra ku Congo

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.
ny: Pamene nthumwi ya bungwe la United Nations loona za nkhanza zokhudza kugonana pamikangano a Margot Wallstrom akuyamba ulendo watsopano wopita ku Democratic Republic of Congo, anthu awiri omenyera ufulu wawo posachedwapa adamaliza ntchito zokopa anthu ku United States kuti achitepo kanthu poyesa kuthetsa kugwiriridwa kokhudzana ndi mikangano ku Congo.

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
ny: Mmodzi mwa iwo, Justine Masika Bihamba, adauza msonkhano wa Washington, DC, ophunzira aku yunivesite ndi nzika zokhudzidwa kuti dera lomwe akugwirira ntchito, Beni, m'chigawo cha North Kivu, lidakalipobe ndi zigawenga za ku Uganda zomwe zimagwiririra amayi nthawi zonse. zinthu izi akazi amaonedwa ngati ozunzidwa, ndipo sakhudzidwa ndi kufunafuna mtendere.

en: Striving for peace in the region
ny: Kuyesetsa kuti pakhale mtendere m'derali

en: Bihamba coordinates an organization called the Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.
ny: Bihamba amayang'anira bungwe lotchedwa Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.

en: Counselors with the group have been attacked and threatened because of their work. When Bihamba was at work one day, Congolese soldiers attacked her home, and sexually assaulted one of her daughters.
ny: Alangizi omwe ali ndi gululi akhala akuwukiridwa ndikuwopsezedwa chifukwa cha ntchito yawo. Tsiku lina Bihamba ali kuntchito, asilikali a ku Congo anaukira nyumba yake, ndi kugwirira mwana wake wamkazi mmodzi.

en: Bihamba explained that what is needed - above all - is peace in eastern Congo.
ny: Bihamba anafotokoza kuti chofunika - koposa zonse - ndi mtendere kum'mawa kwa Congo.

en: She said she believes sexual crimes would go down drastically if fighting stopped.
ny: Anati akukhulupirira kuti ziwawa zakugonana zitsika kwambiri ngati ndewu itasiya.

en: Activist Donatella Rostagno, from the European network for Central Africa, accompanied Bihamba on her trip to the United States.
ny: Womenyera ufulu Donatella Rostagno, wochokera ku European network ku Central Africa, adatsagana ndi Bihamba paulendo wake wopita ku United States.

en: She said she supports the work being done by the U.N. special representative for sexual violence in conflict.
ny: Anati amathandizira ntchito yomwe ikuchitidwa ndi nthumwi yapadera ya UN yokhudzana ndi nkhanza zogonana pamikangano.

en: Rostagno also said feels, however, the international community is not doing enough to stop Congo's war, despite having a large U.N. peacekeeping mission there.
ny: Rostagno adatinso akumva, komabe, mayiko sakuchita mokwanira kuti aletse nkhondo ya ku Congo, ngakhale ali ndi ntchito yayikulu yosunga mtendere wa UN kumeneko.

en: "The majority of the actions is made to look at the consequences, to work with the women who are victims, but not enough is done to look at the causes of the rapes and the conflict," said Rostagno.
ny: "Zambiri zomwe zimachitika kuti ziwone zotsatira zake, kugwira ntchito ndi amayi omwe akuzunzidwa, koma sikokwanira kuyang'ana zomwe zimayambitsa kugwiriridwa ndi mikangano," adatero Rostagno.

en: Deteriorating situation amid global concern
ny: Kuipa kwa zinthu pakati pa nkhawa zapadziko lonse lapansi

en: She fears the overall situation in eastern Congo is getting worse, not better - despite the international attention - with rebels, militias, and renegade soldiers still running rampant.
ny: Akuwopa kuti zinthu zonse kum'mawa kwa Congo zikuipiraipira, osati bwino - ngakhale mayiko akuyang'aniridwa - ndi zigawenga, zigawenga, ndi asitikali achiwembu akuchulukirachulukira.

en: "A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us," said Rostagno.
ny: "Ambiri mwa magulu owukirawa akukonzedwanso, ndipo akulowa mumgwirizano kotero mayendedwe omwe tikuwona mderali akutidetsa nkhawa," adatero Rostagno.

en: "I think we were more optimistic on this region six months ago than today.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti tinali ndi chiyembekezo chachikulu m'derali miyezi isanu ndi umodzi yapitayo kuposa lero.

en: "The United Nations has identified three armed groups that gang raped dozens of people about two months ago in a week-long attack in Luvungi, another part of North Kivu province.
ny: “Bungwe la United Nations lazindikira magulu atatu ankhondo omwe adagwiririra anthu ambiri miyezi iwiri yapitayo pa chiwembu chomwe chidachitika sabata yatha ku Luvungi, dera lina la North Kivu.

en: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
ny: Omwe akukhudzidwa ndi a Mai Mai Cheka, a Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, komanso otsatira a Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.

en: Proposals for improvementDuring their presentation, the two activists, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete proposals to make the situation better.
ny: Malingaliro oti achite bwinoPanthawi yowonetsera, omenyera ufulu awiriwa, Bihamba ndi Rostagno, adaperekanso malingaliro otsimikizika kuti zinthu zikhale bwino.

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
ny: Rostagno adalongosola kuti mabungwe omwe siaboma akunja amapeza ndalama zothandizira kuthana ndi nkhanza zogonana, koma mabungwe am'deralo nthawi zambiri amanyalanyazidwa.

en: She said complex applications to get outside funding favor bigger organizations.
ny: Anati zopempha zovuta kuti apeze ndalama zakunja zimakonda mabungwe akuluakulu.

en: "They can just do it, they send it, they receive the money.
ny: "Atha kungochita, kutumiza, kulandira ndalama.

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno.Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
ny: Vuto ndiloti ndalamazo nthawi zambiri zimagwiritsidwa ntchito kulipira mtengo wokhazikika wa bungwe, malipiro a anthu ochokera kunja omwe amabwera kudera ndi kudziko, pamene mabungwe omwe si aboma, omwe amagwira ntchito ndi midzi, ndi amayi, ndi ana, m’midzi, amene akusowa ndalama kuti apulumuke kuti agwire ntchito yawo alibe mwayi,” adatero Rostagno. kudzera mwa akuluakulu awo.

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
ny: Bihamba adati ndi dongosolo lomwe lilipo amalandira pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a malipiro awo, zomwe zimapangitsa kuti asilikali ena azibera komanso kugwiririra.

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice. In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
ny: Adapemphanso khoti lapadziko lonse lapansi loti dziko la Congo lithandizire kuthetsa kusakhudzidwa kwa anthu onse, komanso makhoti ambiri am'deralo okhudza omwe adagwiriridwa kuti apeze chilungamo. Ku North Kivu, komwe kuli anthu opitilira 5 miliyoni, adati kuli makhoti atatu okha.

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
ny: Desmond Tutu Wapuma Pantchito Pagulu

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
ny: Desmond Tutu anamenyana ndi tsankho ku South Africa, ndipo ankatsutsa nkhondo ku Iraq.

en: "We waged a war that shouldn't have happened," he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
ny: Iye anati: “Tinamenya nkhondo imene sinkayenera kuchitika.” Analankhulanso potsutsa kuphana kwa mafuko ku Rwanda.

en: "God have mercy on us," he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
ny: Iye anati: “Mulungu atichitire chifundo. " adatero.

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
ny: Tutu ananyamuka kupita ku mpingo wa Anglican ku South Africa kuti akhale bishopu wamkulu wa Anglican wakuda ku Capetown.

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid. Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
ny: Iye anali wodzudzula kwambiri boma lolamulidwa ndi azungu la South Africa ndipo analimbikitsa kusachita zachiwawa kuti athetse tsankho. Tutu adalandira mphotho zambiri, ndipo mu 1984, adalandira Mphotho ya Mtendere ya Nobel chifukwa cholimbikitsa "chitukuko cha demokalase ndi chilungamo popanda magawano amitundu.

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa. After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
ny: "Anagwiritsa ntchito chidziwitsochi kuti apititse patsogolo ntchito yolimbana ndi tsankho, ndikuyitanitsa kuti dziko la South Africa liwononge chuma. Pambuyo pa kutha kwa tsankho, Tutu adatcha tsiku lodabwitsa pamene Nelson Mandela adagonjetsa chisankho choyamba cha mitundu yonse ku South Africa.

en: "I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.
ny: "Ndinganene kuti mfundo yayikulu kwambiri kwa ine inali pomwe ndidayima pakhonde mu 1994 kudziwitsa Purezidenti wathu watsopano ku South Africa ndi dziko lonse lapansi," adatero.

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
ny: Kuti athandize dzikoli, Pulezidenti Mandela anasankha Tutu kukhala mkulu wa bungwe la Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Gululo lidapereka lipoti lomwe lidaphatikizirapo anthu ambiri ovomereza kulakwa pa nthawi ya tsankho pofuna kuti akhululukidwe.

en: "It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur," Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
ny: "Zimapanga malingaliro enieni a momwe tingakhazikitsire chikhalidwe cha ufulu waumunthu ndi zomangamanga kuti titsimikizire kuti nkhanza za m'mbuyomo sizidzachitikanso," adatero Tutu.

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
ny: M'zaka zaposachedwa, adawonetsa kukhumudwa kwake mu South Africa pambuyo pa tsankho, makamaka kuchuluka kwa ziwawa zachiwawa.

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
ny: Ngakhale atasiya moyo wapagulu, Tutu akuti apitiliza kuthandizira maziko ake amtendere ndipo akhalabe m'gulu la akuluakulu aboma omwe akuchita kampeni yolimbikitsa mtendere ndi ufulu wachibadwidwe.

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
ny: Koma Tutu akuti sadzaperekanso zoyankhulana ndipo, monga adanenera, nthawi zambiri "adzatseka."

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.
ny: "Ndakhala nawo pankhondo yathu yomenyera ufulu ndi demokalase, ndipo ndili nawo pachikondwerero chomwe tidachita bwino," adatero. "Ndakhala mbali ya nthawi ya tsankho ndipo ndikufuna kuti tichite bwino kwambiri." Ambiri amati mawu ake samveka.

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas
ny: Sukulu ya ana amasiye ku Malawi ya Jacaranda Ikondwerera Khrisimasi

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
ny: Akuluakulu a sukulu ya ana amasiye ya Jacaranda mu mzinda wa Blantyre mu mzinda wa Blantyre anachitira phwando ana asukulu awo pomwe amatseka tchuthi cha Khrisimasi ndi Chaka Chatsopano.

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 500 kuphatikizapo ophunzira, ogwira ntchito ndi ena ochokera m’madera ozungulira adafika pamwambowo womwe unachitikira m’masukulu a m’dera la Chigumula.

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
ny: Phwandoli linaphatikizapo mphatso, Santa Claus, ndi "dansi show case" ndi ophunzira.

en: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
ny: Oyang'anira sukulu adauza VOA kuti chikondwerero cha pachaka chakhala mwambo wapasukulu kwazaka 13 zapitazi.

en: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
ny: Mkulu wa sukuluyo, Luc Deschamps, anati: “[Tikuona] kuti n’kofunika kwambiri kuti tizikondwerera Khirisimasi chifukwa ana alibe makolo.

en: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children. So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas. And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
ny: Amakhala ndi agogo aakazi kapena azakhali akutali kapena amalume, ndipo sangathe kuchita chikondwerero kunyumba kapena kukhala ndi phwando kapena maswiti pang'ono ndi keke za ana. Choncho, timapereka tsiku losangalatsa kwa ana kuti azikondwerera mzimu wa Khirisimasi. Komanso ndi njira ya ana athu kuphunzira kupatsa.”

en: No media source currently available
ny: Palibe media media yomwe ilipo pakadali pano

en: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
ny: Deschamps, yemwenso ndi Honorary Consul wa dziko la France m’Malawi, adati mwambo waukulu usanachitike anthuwa adalandira “chakudya chokoma” kuchokera kwa ophunzirawo.

en: "We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables. And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people," he said.
ny: "Tidadya chakudya chamasana chachikulu ndi nyama yabwino ndi mpunga, [mbale yopangidwa kuchokera ku ufa wa chimanga wotchedwa] nsima, ndithudi, ndi ndiwo zamasamba. Ndipo ophunzirawo ndi omwe amaphikira aliyense chakudya cha anthu oposa 500," adatero. adatero.

en: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ... I have enjoyed myself. I have eaten, and now I am here dancing. What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
ny: Mmodzi mwa ophunzirawo Eddah Zimba adati zikondwererozi ndi zoziziritsa kukhosi,...ndasangalala, ndadya, pano ndili pano ndikuvina chomwe chandisangalatsa kwambiri ndi mphatso yomwe talandira ngati imeneyi. zofuka, mabisiketi, sikwashi ndi kuvina."

en: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
ny: Iye anathokoza akuluakulu a sukulu chifukwa chochitira phwando la Khrisimasi kwa ophunzira omwe nthawi zambiri sakhala ndi zikondwerero zotere kunyumba.

en: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
ny: Wophunzira wina Emmanuel Chisale adati chakudya chabwino pambali, chochitikacho chamuphunzitsa mzimu wogawana.

en: "This party has brought a change in my life. I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing," he said.
ny: “Chikondwererochi chabweretsa kusintha kwa moyo wanga, ndaphunzira kuti tiyenera kukhala ndi mtima wogawana wina ndi mnzake monga momwe amachitira Father Christmas,” adatero.

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
ny: Sukulu ya Jacaranda School for Orphans yomwe idakhazikitsidwa m’chaka cha 2002 ndi yokha m’Malawi muno yomwe imapereka maphunziro aulere a pulaimale, sekondale ndi maphunziro apamwamba kwa ana opanda makolo.

en: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
ny: Mayi wina wa ku Malawi, Marie Da Silva, adayambitsa sukuluyi atabwera kuchokera ku United States komwe adakhala zaka khumi ndi zisanu ndi zinayi akugwira ntchito ya nanny.

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015
ny: Akatswiri azachuma Aneneratu za Bumpy Road for Economy ya Malawi mu 2015

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate. More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
ny: Akadaulo pazachuma m’dziko la Malawi ati m’chaka cha 2015 dziko lino likhoza kupitirizabe kukumana ndi mavuto azachuma pokhapokha ngati boma lingabweze chidaliro kwa mabungwe omwe amapereka thandizo la ndalama zokwana 40 pa 100 zilizonse chifukwa cha katangale wodziwika ndi dzina loti Cashgate. Ndalama zokwana madola 30 miliyoni zinabedwa m’thumba la boma pavutoli, ndipo anthu angapo, kuphatikizapo akuluakulu a boma, anamangidwa.

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
ny: Kukanidwa kwa thandizo la ndalama kwapangitsa kuti boma la Malawi likhazikitse bajeti yomwe imadziwika kuti Zero Aid mchaka cha 2014-2015. Akadaulo, monga mphunzitsi wa za chuma pasukulu ya ukachenjede ya Polytechnic College of Malawi, Abel Mwanyungwe, ati kuchepa kwa ndalama kwawononga chuma.

en: "This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance. We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals. In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Chaka chino chakhala chovuta chifukwa tikuchokera ku zotsatira za Cashgate zomwe zasokoneza kwambiri chuma. Tawona kuti nthawi zambiri maofesi osakhwima komanso ofunikira komanso opereka chithandizo akhudzidwa. Mzipatala mulibe mankhwala okwanira, m’sukulu pankhani ya aphunzitsi malipiro sali pa nthawi yake,” adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
ny: Mwanyungwe walumikizanso Cashgate ndi kutsika kwa mtengo wa ndalama ya Malawi kwacha posachedwapa komwe kwadzetsa sitalaka ya ogwira ntchito m’boma osiyanasiyana pofuna kukwezedwa malipiro.

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, ogwira ntchito m’mabwalo amilandu akhala akunyanyala ntchito kwa sabata zisanu ndi imodzi, pofuna kuti malipiro akwezedwe ndi 45 peresenti zomwe boma lati silingakwanitse chifukwa lilibe ndalama.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
ny: Ogwira ntchito ku bungwe lothana ndi ziphuphu la Malawi Anti-Corruption Bureau adanyanyala ntchito pofuna kuti akwezedwe malipiro a 70 peresenti mpaka boma lidawaopseza kuti liwachotsera malipiro awo a December ngati sabwerera.

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
ny: Mwanyungwe adati boma lingapewenso kunyanyala ntchito mu 2015 ngati litayesetsa kubwezeretsa chidaliro cha mathandizidwe pa kayendetsedwe ka chuma cha boma.

en: "My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy, we may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: “Mantha anga ndi akuti ngati sitikhala ndi chidaliro ndi thandizo la athandizi kuti abwerere ku chuma, titha kukakamiza boma kuti lichite zinthu zongongole zomwe zitha kubweretsa mavuto akulu pakukula kwa inflation, pachiwongola dzanja ndi izi. atha kukhala ndi vuto loti agwire,” adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
ny: Opereka ndalamawa, mwa zina, akufuna kuti boma lizengereze mlandu onse omwe akukhudzidwa ndi nkhaniyi komanso kulimbikitsa kasamalidwe ka chuma.

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
ny: Mtsogoleri wa bungwe la Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, Newton Kambala, adati mkanganowu wapangitsa kuti chaka cha 2014 chikhale choyipa kwambiri kwa bizinesi chifukwa cha ngongole zazikulu zomwe boma lili nalo.

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
ny: Anachenjeza kuti ngati zinthu zipitirira, "2015 idzakhala yoipa."

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
ny: M’mawu ake Loweruka lapitali, mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi a Peter Mutharika adati boma lake likuchita zotheka kuthana ndi mavuto omwe abwera chifukwa cha katangale wa Cashgate.

en: "My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi. We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
ny: “Boma langa lalimbitsa ndondomeko ya zachuma kuti Cashgate isabwerenso m’Malawi muno. bwezerani chuma chomwe chabedwa ngati nkotheka,” adatero Mutharika.

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
ny: A Mutharika adatinso boma lawo likukonza ndondomeko ya zachuma yomwe yangolandira kumene pofuna kukweza chuma cha dziko ndi 5.5 peresenti m’chaka cha 2014, kuchoka pa 5.0 peresenti m’chaka cha 2013.

en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
ny: Dziko la Malawi Kukayezetsa Khomo ndi Khomo

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year. Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily. Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
ny: Amalawi ali ndi maganizo osiyanasiyana ponena za ndondomeko ya boma yoyambitsa kuyezetsa magazi khomo ndi khomo kumayambiriro kwa chaka cha mawa. Othandizira ati ndondomekoyi ikufunika mwachangu chifukwa Amalawi 100 amadwala matendawa tsiku lililonse, ndipo pafupifupi 138 amamwalira ndi Edzi tsiku lililonse. Nduna ya za umoyo Jean Kalirani yalengeza za ndondomekoyi pa mwambo wokumbukira tsiku la Edzi padziko lonse posachedwapa m’boma la kumpoto kwa Karonga.

en: "We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not. And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need. And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
ny: "Tidzapita kumidzi kupempha magazi kuti awone ngati munthuyo ali ndi kachilombo ka HIV kapena ayi. Ndipo amene ati adzapezeke ali ndi kachilombo ka HIV adzapatsidwa chisamaliro chomwe akufunikira. Ndipo amene apezeka kuti alibe nawonso adzapatsidwa uphungu choncho kuti akhalebe alibe,” adatero Kalirani.

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services. She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030. Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
ny: Kalirani adati ntchitoyi iyamba m’katikati mwa mwezi wa March ndipo cholinga chake ndi kufikira anthu onse m’dziko muno kuphatikizapo anthu omwe ali kutali ndi zipatala zomwe zimapereka chithandizo choyezetsa HIV ndi uphungu. Iye adati kampeniyi ikugwirizana ndi cholinga chothetsa kachilombo ka HIV pofika m’chaka cha 2030. M’Malawi muno chiwerengero cha anthu omwe ali ndi kachilombo ka HIV chili pa 10 peresenti, chomwe chatsika pang’ono kusiyana ndi zaka zitatu zapitazo.

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
ny: Kulengezaku kwadzetsa mantha kwa Amalawi ena, monga Steven Jailosi, mphunzitsi wa pulaimale kumudzi wa Blantyre, omwe akuwona kuti kampeniyi isokoneza zinsinsi za anthu.

en: "I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy. HIV testing is supposed to be private. No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
ny: “Ndikuona kuti sibwino chifukwa akhala akusokoneza zinsinsi zathu, kuyezetsa kachirombo ka HIV kuyenera kukhala kwachinsinsi, palibe amene akuyenera kudziwa kuti ndinapita kukayezetsa ngati nditasankha kuwauza,” adatero Jailosi.

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
ny: Mlembi m’boma la Blantyre, Ester Makonokaya, adati ngakhale adayezetsa kale, akuona kuti kuyezetsa khomo ndi khomo kusokoneza chinsinsi cha anthu.

en: "Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions," said Makonokaya.
ny: M’malo mwake boma litenge zipatala zoyendayenda kumidzi komwe anthu azitha kuzipeza okha m’malo mongoyezera m’nyumba zawo, chifukwa zikhoza kutanthauza kuti ena mwa anthu omwe sakuyenera kudziwa za anthu ena azidziwa. chifukwa mukudziwa kuti munthu akayezetsa mumaonetsa mmene akumvera,” adatero Makonokaya.

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
ny: Mtolankhani mu mzinda wa Blantyre komanso mkonzi wa mapologalamu okhudza zaumoyo a Macpherson Maulana wauza VOA kuti boma lichita bwino kuphunzitsa Amalawi zakufunika koyezetsa kachilombo ka HIV kuti anthu azipita okha kukayezetsa popanda kukakamizika.

en: "I fear it could end up into fights. You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed. So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
ny: "Ndikuopa kuti zitha kukhala ndewu. Mukuwona zomwe zidachitika ku Liberia posachedwa pomwe anthu omwe amabwera kudzathandiza anthu omwe akuwaganizira kuti ali ndi Ebola adaphedwa. atuluka kukayezetsa modzifunira,” adatero Maulana.

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
ny: Komabe, mlangizi wa HIV/AIDS, David Odali, yemwe bungwe lake la Umunthu Foundation limayendetsa ntchito zokhudzana ndi HIV, wanenetsa kuti zinsinsi zitetezedwa.

en: "Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup. I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family. [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
ny: "Chinsinsi chidzasungidwa. Tiyeni tiganizire za dongosolo la banja. Ndikuganiza kuti chinthu choyamba chingakhale kupereka uphungu wamagulu kwa anthu a m'banja limenelo. [N'zoona] anthu akhoza kuyesedwa pamene ena akuyang'ana, koma pamene izo zifika poulula zotsatira. , mlangizi akuyenera kuwulula zotsatira zake kwa aliyense payekhapayekha," adatero Odali.

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
ny: Odali adati zikakhala kwa munthu yemwe wamuyeza kuti aulule momwe alili.

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people. The organization says it worked well.
ny: M’chaka cha 2006, bungwe lacharity Development Aid from People to People lidachita kuyezetsa khomo ndi khomo m’boma la Thyolo ndi Blantyre, zomwe zidafikira anthu 400,000. Bungweli likuti linayenda bwino.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
ny: Kusokonekera kwa Madzi Kukukulitsa Mantha a Matenda Obwera ndi Madzi M'Malawi

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water. But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
ny: Amalawi omwe ali likulu la zamalonda mdziko muno la Blantyre nthawi zambiri amadalira madzi apampopi. Koma kwa miyezi isanu yapitayi, nthawi zambiri mipopeyi yauma, zomwe zikupangitsa anthu kuti azitunga madzi kumalo opanda chitetezo monga mitsinje ndi zitsime, pamene ntchito ikugwiridwa pa malo opopera madzi mumzindawu. Chiopsezo chotenga matenda obwera chifukwa cha madzi chikuwonjezeka.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
ny: Ku Blantyre ndi madera ozungulira anthu akhala masiku asanu opanda madzi apampopi.

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
ny: Amayi, omwe mwachikhalidwe cha Malawi ndi omwe amagwira ntchito zapakhomo, akudandaula ndi zoopsa zomwe amakumana nazo akamatunga madzi ku mitsinje yakutali ndi komwe amakhala.

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky. "We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water. There are so many risks. You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
ny: Rhoda Milanzi, mayi wapakhomo komanso mayi wa ana atatu, akuuza VOA kuti maulendo odutsa m'misewu yamtchire ndi yowopsa. “Tsiku lililonse timadzuka 2 koloko, 1 koloko koloko kupita kukatunga madzi, pali zoopsa zambiri, mukuona, nthawi zina timakumana ndi mfiti, njoka m’njira,” akutero, “ngakhale afisi akhala akutithamangitsa. ."

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river. But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
ny: Milanzi akuti pofuna kuchepetsa mtolo wonyamula madzi osamba kunyumba, amayi amakonda kukasamba mumtsinje. Koma akuti asokonezedwa ndi achinyamata omwe amabisala m’tchire lapafupi.

en: "These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked. This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
ny: “Achinyamata amasiku anowa akamabwera kudzabisala penapake kuti atiwone tili maliseche, izi zakhala zamanyazi kwambiri, m’malo mwake tidadandaula kwa mafumu.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
ny: Anawalanga ena, koma mukudziwa kuti nthawi zina ankakwera m’mitengo kuti azingoyang’ana amayi achikulire ngati ife tikusamba,” akufotokoza motero.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
ny: Vuto la madzi lasokonezanso ntchito za umoyo.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
ny: Masabata atatu apitawa akuluakulu a pachipatala cha Queen Elizabeth Central mu mzinda wa Blantyre adatsimikiza kuti ayimitsa maopaleshoni chifukwa cha kusowa kwa madzi.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
ny: Omenyera ufulu wa zaumoyo akuchenjeza za kubuka kwa matenda obwera chifukwa cha madzi, makamaka m'madera omwe ali ndi anthu ambiri, ngati zinthu sizingathetsedwe.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.  Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
ny: Akuluakulu a bungwe la Blantyre Water Board anena kuti vutoli lachitika makamaka chifukwa cha ntchito yomwe bungwe la European Union lomwe likuchita ndi ndalama za bungwe la European Union lomwe likufuna kukhazikitsa makina atsopano opopera madzi pa Walkers Ferry, komwe ndi komwe amapopa madzi. Mneneri wa bungwe la Blantyre Water Board, Priscilla Mateyu, wati ntchitoyi ikuyembekezeka kuonjezera mphamvu yopangira madzi kufika pa ma cubic metres 105,000 patsiku kuchoka pa masiku 78,000 cubic metres omwe akupanga tsiku lililonse.

en: "January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015]. That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
ny: "January ndi pamene ntchitoyo ikutha. Koma kuti makina atsopano ndi zina zonse ziyambe kugwira ntchito bwino, tiyenera kudikirira mpaka March [2015]. Ndipamene timayembekezera kuti milingo idzawonjezeka komanso mphamvu zopanga zikuyenda bwino mpaka zomwe timayembekezera. zikhale,” Mateyu anatero.

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.  The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
ny: Bungwe loona za ufulu wa ogula la Consumers Association of Malawi lakhala likukonza zoti lizikhala tcheru ku bwalo la madzi mpaka madziwo akhazikike bwino, koma bungweli linapempha anthu ochita ziwonetserozo kuti ayime polonjeza kuti agawira madzi kwa anthu okhala m’matanki oyenda madzi. Bungwe loona za ufulu wa ogula lapatsa bungwe loona za madzi sabata ziwiri kuti likwaniritse zomwe walonjeza lisanayambe kuchita zionetsero.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
ny: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi Akwiya Popereka Ndalama kwa Atolankhani

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre. The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Malawi a Peter Mutharika akudzudzulidwa chifukwa chopereka ma envulopu omwe munali $125 kwa atolankhani oposa 80 pamwambo womwe adawakonzera mwezi watha mu mzinda wa Blantyre. Mkonzi wa Times Televizioni yachinsinsi adati atolankhani adauzidwa kuti ma envulopu omwe ali ndi mapulani a purezidenti pazofalitsa - zomwe zakhala zikudzudzula maboma pazachuma.

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
ny: M’gawo lake lofalitsidwa mu nyuzipepala ya Malawis Sunday Times, mkonzi Grecian Tukula adati sakudziwa chifukwa chake ndalamazo zidaperekedwa kwa atolankhani pa chakudya chamadzulo cha boma.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
ny: Tukula adati poyamba adaganiza zobweza ndalamazo koma adasintha zomwe adaganizazo kuti apewe "kupanga zochitika."

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
ny: Koma mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya Weekend Nation, George Kasakula, wauza VOA kuti adabweza ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo.

en: "I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it. My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me. But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
ny: “Ndinangoona kuti sibwino kuti ndilandire ndalamazo, ndiye ndidabweza. Koma pankhaniyi, sindinaone chifukwa chake ndiyenera kulandira ndalamazo chifukwa sindinawononge chilichonse kupita ku Sanjika [Palace],” adatero Kasakula.

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
ny: Nkhaniyi yakopa chidwi cha anthu ambiri pambuyo poulutsa nkhani yomwe kampani ya Capital Radio imayimba nkhani yofunsa tanthauzo la ndalama zomwe mtsogoleri wa dziko lino adapereka.

en: "As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public. This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
ny: "Ngati Capital FM timatumikira zofuna za anthu. Nkhaniyi yakhala ikufalikira m'malo ochezera a pa Intaneti, ndipo ngakhale ife ngati atolankhani timakhudzidwa [timakhulupirira] kuti ndikofunikira kuti tiwutsatire ndikupeza m'munsi mwa nkhaniyo. "Anatero Steven Dakalira, wamkulu wa nkhani ndi zochitika zamakono ku Capital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
ny: M’nkhani yake mu nyuzipepala ya Nyasa Times, pulofesa wa zamalamulo ku Malawi Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa wati zomwe mtsogoleri wa dziko lino Mutharika adachita popereka ndalama kwa atolankhani pamwambo wa nkhani ndi zofanana ndi ziphuphu. Iwo apempha a Mutharika kuti atule pansi udindo wawo kapena aimbe mlandu woti achotsedwe.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.
ny: Mabungwe amderali adati "pofuna kupereka ziphuphu kwa atolankhani" Mutharika adanyozetsa utsogoleri wake.

en: Meanwhile, some journalists are donating the money to charity.
ny: Padakali pano atolankhani ena akupereka ndalamazi ku bungwe lachifundo.

en: Brian Ligomeka, the Managing Editor for the Times Group, told Times Television that all four employees there have donated the money to an orphanage.
ny: Brian Ligomeka, yemwe ndi Managing Editor wa Times Group, adauza Times Television kuti ogwira ntchito onse anayi apereka ndalamazi ku nyumba ya ana amasiye.

en: "At first we decided to return the money to the president but we later thought it wise to buy assorted items like sugar, salt, notebooks and donate it to needy children," said Ligomeka.
ny: “Poyamba tidaganiza zobweza ndalamazo kwa mtsogoleri wa dziko lino koma pambuyo pake tidaona kuti ndi chanzeru kugula zinthu zosiyanasiyana monga shuga, mchere, zolembera ndikuzipereka kwa ana osowa,” adatero Ligomeka.

en: In his latest Sunday Times column, Raphael Tenthani, who also writes for BBC, apologized on behalf of other journalists "for letting down the public that trust journalists unreservedly."
ny: M'gawo lake laposachedwa la Sunday Times, a Raphael Tenthani, yemwenso amalembera BBC, adapepesa m'malo mwa atolankhani ena "chifukwa chokhumudwitsa anthu kuti akhulupirire atolankhani mosakayikira."

en: Tenthani has since donated the money for charity work and said that although the journalists could have done better if they returned the money right away, doing so would have been perceived as disrespect to the head of state.
ny: Tenthani wapereka ndalamazo zogwirira ntchito zachifundo ndipo wati ngakhale atolankhani akanachita bwino akanabweza ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo, kuteroko kukanaoneka ngati kusalemekeza mtsogoleri wa dziko.

en: Maclan Kanyangwa, who heads the Department of Journalism and Media Studies at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, said a media code of ethics bars journalists from accepting payment on a story.
ny: A Maclan Kanyangwa, yemwe ndi mkulu wa dipatimenti yoona za utolankhani ndi nkhani zofalitsa nkhani pasukulu ya ukachenjede ya Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, wati malamulo okhudza chikhalidwe cha atolankhani amaletsa atolankhani kuvomera kulipira nkhani.

en: "Obviously the meeting at the palace was the newsworthy event. There was a possibility that something was going to be published. And in the event that this payment would have influenced journalist decision [on news judgment], then that becomes a problem," said Kanyangwa.
ny: "Mwachiwonekere msonkhano wa ku nyumba yachifumu unali chochitika chodziwika bwino cha nkhani. Panali kuthekera kuti chinachake chikasindikizidwa. Ndipo ngati malipirowa akanakhudza chisankho cha mtolankhani [pa chiweruzo cha nkhani], ndiye kuti zimakhala zovuta," adatero. Kanyangwa.

en: Kanyangwa said he feels many journalists failed to return the money immediately because they might have been out of their ethical senses when they got the money.
ny: Kanyangwa adati akuwona kuti atolankhani ambiri adalephera kubweza ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo chifukwa mwina adasiya kutsatira malamulo pomwe adalandira ndalamazo.

en: Efforts to talk to Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala were not successful. But some government authorities say the payment was not a bribe but meant for a fuel refund to those who attended the night event.
ny: Zoyesayesa zolankhula ndi mkulu wa atolankhani a Purezidenti Fredrick Ndala sizinaphule kanthu. Koma akuluakulu ena aboma ati malipirowo sanali chiphuphu koma kuti abweze ndalama zamafuta kwa anthu omwe anafika pa mwambowo wausiku.

en: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty
ny: Report: Manufacturing Ikhoza Kumasula Mayiko Osauka Kwambiri Ku Umphawi

en: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
ny: Lipoti latsopano la United Nations likulimbikitsa maiko osauka kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi kuti asinthe kuchoka pakuchita zotsika mtengo kupita ku zokolola zambiri kuti apititse patsogolo chuma chawo.

en: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.
ny: M'nkhani yake yapachaka ya Maiko Osatukuka Kwambiri, UNCTAD - Msonkhano wa UN pa Zamalonda ndi Chitukuko - akuti mayikowa akuyenera kusintha chuma chawo kuti adzipulumutse ku "misampha yaumphawi," yomwe ikulepheretsa kukula kwachuma ndi chitukuko.

en: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.
ny: Mwa mayiko 48 omwe bungwe la UN likuwona kuti "Maiko Osatukuka Kwambiri" (LDCs), dziko limodzi lokha, Laos, lomwe lili panjira yokwaniritsa zolinga zisanu ndi ziwiri zonse za Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) pofika chaka cha 2015.

en: Only four African countries — Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda — are likely to meet a majority of these targets.
ny: Mayiko anayi okha a mu Africa - Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda ndi Uganda - ndi omwe angakwaniritse zambiri mwa zolingazi.

en: This assessment is particularly grim in light of the even greater challenges awaiting these countries in the coming years. The MDGs set a goal for nations to halve their poverty levels by 2015. The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.
ny: Kuwunikaku kumakhala kodetsa nkhawa makamaka chifukwa cha zovuta zazikulu zomwe mayikowa akuyembekezera m'zaka zikubwerazi. Ma MDGs adakhazikitsa cholinga choti mayiko achepetse umphawi wawo ndi theka pofika chaka cha 2015. Zomwe zimatchedwa Sustainable Development Goals, zomwe zimapitilira kuyambira pomwe MDGs zimasiyira, zimalimbikitsa kuthetsa umphawi pofika chaka cha 2030.

en: According to Taffere Tesfachew, an UNCTAD official who works with African nations, it would be nothing short of a miracle for the LDCs to pull this off.
ny: Malinga ndi a Taffere Tesfachew, wogwira ntchito ku UNCTAD yemwe amagwira ntchito ndi mayiko aku Africa, sizingakhale zodabwitsa kuti ma LDC achotse izi.

en: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.
ny: Kuti maiko osatukuka bwino akwaniritse chozizwitsachi, akuti afunika kusintha chuma chawo mwadongosolo.

en: He tells VOA this means shifting labor from activities with low productivity, such as small-scale agriculture and services to more dynamic activities with higher productivity, such as manufacturing and high-value services.
ny: Amauza VOA kuti izi zikutanthauza kusintha ntchito kuchokera ku ntchito zomwe zili ndi zokolola zochepa, monga ulimi waung'ono ndi mautumiki kupita kuzinthu zowonjezereka zomwe zimakhala ndi zokolola zambiri, monga kupanga ndi ntchito zamtengo wapatali.

en: "Countries that have moved up are the ones that are creating opportunities for those that are leaving agriculture to engage in things where they add value, where they get training and as it happens, manufacturing tends to have that sort of feature, that is why this call for manufacturing," he said. "Countries that are using policies to shift and influence capital and labor to move into this activity sector tend to do better."
ny: “Maiko amene atukuka ndi amene akupereka mwayi kwa omwe akusiya ulimi kuti achite zinthu zomwe amawonjezera phindu, komwe amaphunzira ndipo m’mene zimachitikira, kupanga kumakhala ndi zinthu zotere, n’chifukwa chake kuyitana kupanga, "adatero. "Maiko omwe akugwiritsa ntchito ndondomeko zosinthira ndi kulimbikitsa ndalama ndi ntchito kuti alowe m'gulu la ntchitozi amakonda kuchita bwino."

en: Tesfachew says these high-productivity sectors tend to pay higher wages and create a demand for goods. This, he says, encourages investment.
ny: Tesfachew akuti magawo opanga kwambiri awa amakonda kulipira malipiro apamwamba ndikupanga kufunika kwa katundu. Izi, akuti, zimalimbikitsa ndalama.

en: On the surface, it appears that the LDCs are not doing badly. UNCTAD economic data show growth in these poor countries between 2002 and 2008 exceeded the seven percent target set by the international community. And, even after the 2008 financial crisis, UNCTAD notes the LDCs grew faster than other developing countries, at an average of 5.7 percent per year.
ny: Pamwamba, zikuwoneka kuti ma LDC sakuchita zoyipa. Deta yazachuma ya UNCTAD ikuwonetsa kukula m'maiko osauka awa pakati pa 2002 ndi 2008 kudaposa 7 peresenti yomwe idakhazikitsidwa ndi mayiko. Ndipo, ngakhale pambuyo pavuto lazachuma la 2008, UNCTAD imanena kuti LDCs idakula mwachangu kuposa mayiko ena omwe akutukuka kumene, pa avareji ya 5.7 peresenti pachaka.

en: But U.N. economists say the outlook for the least developed countries in the short and medium term remains uncertain. They say increasing peoples productivity is the best way to break the patter of human and economic underdevelopment that continues to entrap them in poverty.
ny: Koma akadaulo azachuma a UN ati malingaliro a maiko osatukuka kwambiri munthawi yaifupi ndi apakatikati akadali osatsimikizika. Iwo ati kuchulukitsa zokolola za anthu ndiyo njira yabwino kwambiri yothanirana ndi kusokonekera kwachuma komanso kusatukuka kwa anthu komwe kukupitilira kuwatsekera muumphawi.

en: UN: Most African Nations to Miss 2015 MDG Goals
ny: UN: Mayiko Ambiri a ku Africa Aphonya Zolinga za 2015 MDG

en: Most African countries will not reach the Millennium Development Goals set for 2015 because of the gap between economic and human development. That is one of the conclusions in this years annual U.N. report on the Least Developed Countries, presented Thursday.
ny: Mayiko ambiri a mu Africa sangakwaniritse zolinga za Millennium Development Goals zomwe zakhazikitsidwa mu 2015 chifukwa cha kusiyana pakati pa chitukuko cha zachuma ndi chitukuko cha anthu. Ichi ndi chimodzi mwazomaliza mu lipoti lapachaka la UN lokhudza Maiko Osatukuka Kwambiri, lomwe laperekedwa Lachinayi.

en: Junior Davis, U.N. economic affairs officer for Africa, said African countries have not been able to translate their economic growth into structural transformation.
ny: Junior Davis, mkulu wa UN Economic Affairs ku Africa, adati mayiko a mu Africa alephera kumasulira kukula kwachuma chawo kukhala kusintha kwa kamangidwe.

en: "We think that is the case because these countries have not focused efficiently on building what we call their productive capacities," Davis said. "These are the basic human and economic development capacities that are needed to promote sustainable economic development. And the MDG, as they were constructed, largely ignored the need to develop the productive capacities."
ny: "Ife tikuganiza kuti ndi choncho chifukwa mayikowa sanakhazikike bwino pakupanga zomwe timatcha mphamvu zawo zopanga," adatero Davis. "Izi ndizo zofunikira zachitukuko cha anthu ndi zachuma zomwe zimafunikira kulimbikitsa chitukuko chokhazikika cha zachuma. Ndipo MDG, pamene inamangidwa, inanyalanyaza kwambiri kufunika kokhala ndi mphamvu zokolola."

en: Slow progress
ny: Kupita patsogolo pang'onopang'ono

en: African countries also are not on course to halve poverty by 2015, and their overall progress on reducing hunger is relatively slow. Poverty limits human development and undermines productivity. And economic development is needed to make gains in human development.
ny: Maiko aku Africa nawonso sali pa njira yochepetsera umphawi pofika chaka cha 2015, ndipo kupita patsogolo kwawo pakuchepetsa njala kukuchepa. Umphawi umachepetsa chitukuko cha anthu ndipo umalepheretsa zokolola. Ndipo chitukuko cha zachuma chimafunika kuti tipeze phindu pa chitukuko cha anthu.

en: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda and Malawi are the only African countries on track to reach the majority of the development goals. They are making progress because they heavily invested in areas that create sustainable development such as infrastructure, health and education.
ny: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda ndi Malawi ndi mayiko okhawo mu Africa omwe ali panjira yokwaniritsa zolinga zachitukuko. Akupita patsogolo chifukwa adayika ndalama zambiri m'malo omwe amapanga chitukuko chokhazikika monga zomangamanga, thanzi ndi maphunziro.

en: The post-2015 development agenda for fragile countries where governance remains an issue — such as South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo — will still largely depend on support from the international community to achieve social and economic development, Davis said.
ny: Ndondomeko yachitukuko ya 2015 ya mayiko osalimba omwe utsogoleri udakali nkhani - monga South Sudan ndi Democratic Republic of Congo - idzadalira kwambiri thandizo kuchokera ku mayiko a mayiko kuti akwaniritse chitukuko cha chikhalidwe ndi zachuma, Davis adatero.

en: Improvements in rural development, industrial productivity, agriculture and the services sectors in these countries will require "ways in which we can have a pattern of growth which is not just sustainable but jobs-rich," Davis said. "Because we see the growth in jobs and employment is central to any development strategy that aims to reduce poverty in a sustainable way."
ny: Kupititsa patsogolo chitukuko cha kumidzi, zokolola za mafakitale, ulimi ndi ntchito zamagulu m'mayikowa zidzafuna "njira zomwe tingakhale ndi njira yakukula yomwe siili yokhazikika koma yochuluka kwa ntchito," adatero Davis. "Chifukwa tikuwona kukula kwa ntchito ndi ntchito ndizofunikira pa njira iliyonse yachitukuko yomwe ikufuna kuchepetsa umphawi m'njira yokhazikika."

en: A country is placed on the Least Developed Countries list based on its per capita income, economic vulnerability, and human development indicators such as health and nutrition.
ny: Dziko laikidwa pamndandanda wa Maiko Osatukuka Potengera ndalama zomwe munthu amapeza, kusatetezeka pazachuma, ndi zizindikiro za chitukuko cha anthu monga thanzi ndi kadyedwe.

en: Of the 48 least developed countries in the world, 34 are in Africa. Three countries have graduated from their least developed status: Botswana, Cape Verde and Samoa.
ny: Mwa mayiko 48 otukuka kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi, 34 ali mu Africa. Maiko atatu amaliza maphunziro awo osatukuka kwambiri: Botswana, Cape Verde ndi Samoa.

en: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services
ny: Mgwirizano Wayimitsa Makhoti a Malawi

en: A week-long strike by the support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials. Court marshals, clerks and messengers are demanding the 30 percent salary increases promised by the government two years ago.
ny: Kunyanyala kwa sabata imodzi kwa ogwira ntchito m'mabwalo amilandu m'Malawi kwasokoneza mabwalo amilandu, zomwe zapangitsa kuti m'zipinda za apolisi muchuluke komanso kuyimitsidwa kwanthawi yayitali kwa milandu ikuluikulu - kuphatikiza kuzenga milandu m'boma. Atsogoleri a makhothi, akalaliki ndi ma mesenjala akufuna kuti malipiro akwezedwe ndi 30 peresenti yomwe boma linalonjeza zaka ziwiri zapitazo.

en: Chanting and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the onset of a sit-in last week.  Linley Hebert, a spokesperson for the striking workers, told VOA the strike is a result of the governments failure to honor a 2012 agreement.
ny: Kuyimba ndi kuyimba mozungulira bwalo lamilandu yakhala ntchito yosangalatsa kwa ogwira ntchito m'makhothi omwe adanyanyala ntchito kuyambira pomwe adayamba kukhala m'bwalo lamilandu sabata yatha. Mneneri wa ogwira ntchito omwe akunyanyala ntchito a Linley Hebert wauza VOA kuti sitirakayi idachitika chifukwa maboma alephera kulemekeza pangano la 2012.

en: "In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision," Hebert said.
