ny: “M’mwezi wa Okutobala [chaka chino], boma lidaunikanso za malipiro a ogwira ntchito m’boma, koma sitinaphatikizidwe m’kukonzansoko,” adatero Hebert.

en: "Yet in 2012, we had an agreement that each time they are revising the salaries of the civil servants, [they will be increasing our salaries as well].
ny: “Komabe m’chaka cha 2012, tidagwirizana kuti nthawi iliyonse akamakonzanso malipiro a ogwira ntchito m’boma, [atiwonjezerenso malipiro].

en: So, [after adhering to the agreement in 2013], we are surprised to see that this time we are left out."  Government authorities say the failure to increase judicial workers salaries this year is largely because of financial constraints, following a donor aid freeze against Malawi's government.
ny: Choncho, [titatsatira pangano la 2013], tikudabwa kuona kuti ulendo uno akutisiyidwa.” Akuluakulu aboma ati kulephera kuwonjezera malipiro a ogwira ntchito m’mabwalo amilandu chaka chino kudachitika makamaka chifukwa cha mavuto azachuma, kutsatira kuyimitsidwa kwa thandizo la opereka ndalama. motsutsana ndi boma la Malawi.

en: The freeze is a result of a government financial scandal in which more than $30 million was looted from government coffers.  Ministry of Finance spokesperson Nations Msowoya told a local radio station it is hard for the government to meet the workers' demand.
ny: Kuyimitsidwaku kudabwera chifukwa chavuto lazachuma la boma pomwe ndalama zoposa $30 miliyoni zidabedwa m'thumba la boma. Mneneri wa unduna wa zachuma, Nations Msowoya, wauza wailesi ya m’dziko muno kuti ndizovuta kuti boma likwaniritse zofuna za ogwira ntchito.

en: "It is difficult to promise what the treasury will do. But suffice to say that the prevailing economic circumstances and budgetary constraints will make a little bit difficult for the treasury to bow down to the demands," "Msowoya said.
ny: “N’zovuta kulonjeza zomwe nthambi ya chuma ichita. Koma tangokwana kunena kuti momwe chuma chilili komanso mavuto azachuma apangitsa kuti chuma chivutike kugwadira zomwe akufuna,” adatero Msowoya.

en: But according to Hebert, the strikers will not resume work until their demands are met.  "Since I was born [there has been] no time the government said it had some money.
ny: Koma malinga ndi Hebert, onyanyalawo sayambiranso ntchito mpaka zomwe akufuna zikwaniritsidwe. “Kuyambira pamene ndinabadwa [palibe] nthawi imene boma linanena kuti lili ndi ndalama.

en: It has its own means [of finding the money] and it will find the same means to give us the money," Hebert insisted.  The ongoing strike is hampering progress of trials, as court operations remain suspended.
ny: Lili ndi njira zakezake [zopezera ndalamazo] ndipo lipeza njira zomwezo kuti litipatse ndalamazo,” adatero Hebert.

en: Several trials, including that of former justice minister Ralph Kasambara, who is answering charges in connection with the financial scandal, were indefinitely suspended last week.
ny: Milandu ingapo, kuphatikizapo ya nduna yakale ya zachilungamo, Ralph Kasambara, yemwe akuyankha mlandu wokhudza nkhani ya zachuma, idayimitsidwa kwamuyaya sabata yatha.

en: Police are complaining of congestion in jail cells, as no suspects are being taken to court.
ny: Apolisi akudandaula za kuchulukana m’zipinda za ndende, chifukwa palibe amene akutengedwera ku khoti.

en: Malawi police spokesperson Rhoda Manjolo told VOA the only option they have is "giving police bail to those with minor offenses."   Human rights campaigners and legal experts say the strike is contributing to human rights violations.
ny: Mneneri wa apolisi ku Malawi Rhoda Manjolo wauza VOA njira yokhayo yomwe ali nayo ndi kupereka belo kupolisi kwa omwe ali ndi milandu ing’onoing’ono. Omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe komanso akadaulo azamalamulo ati kunyanyala ntchitoku kukuwonjezera kuphwanya ufulu wa anthu.

en: "There are those people who have to be taken to court within 48 hours," noted Lawyer George Kadzipatike who works in a private practice in the northern city of Mzuzu. "We cannot make application for them to be granted bail.
ny: “Pali anthu amene amayenera kuwatengera kukhoti pasanathe maola 48,” adatero Loya George Kadzipatike yemwe amagwira ntchito yapayekha mu mzinda wa Mzuzu kumpoto. “Sitingapemphe kuti apatsidwe belo.

en: There are those people who do not want to live with their partners, they would like the court to decree that they be divorced, we cannot file any petition through the courts."
ny: Pali anthu omwe safuna kukhala ndi anzawo, akufuna kuti khoti ligamule kuti asudzulane, sitingapereke chigamulo chilichonse kudzera m'makhothi."

en: Government authorities say closed door negotiations to resolve the matter continue in the capital, Lilongwe.  But the striking workers told VOA whatever the case, they will accept nothing short of a 30 percent increase in their salaries.
ny: Akuluakulu aboma ati zokambirana zotsekera zitseko zothetsa nkhaniyi zipitilira mu mzinda wa Lilongwe. Koma ogwira ntchito omwe akunyanyala ntchitowa auza VOA mulingo wotani, iwo sangalandire chilichonse kupatula kuonjezedwa ndi 30 peresenti ya malipiro awo.

en: A similar strike lasted three months in 2012 after the magistrates and judges joined the labor action.
ny: Kunyanyala kotereku kudatenga miyezi itatu mchaka cha 2012 pomwe oweruza ndi oweruza adalowa nawo ntchito.

en: Famine in Southern Africa Worse Than Predicted - 2002-07-24
ny: Njala Kummwera kwa Africa Yaipira Kuposa Imanenedweratu - 2002-07-24

en: The United Nations World Food Program says the famine in southern Africa is even worse than predicted. WFP officials are warning that 13 million people in six countries: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland and Mozambique are in danger of starvation if they do not get food aid.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations World Food Programme lati m’dera la kum’mwera kwa Africa muli njala yaikulu kuposa mmene ananeneratu. Akuluakulu a WFP akuchenjeza kuti anthu 13 miliyoni m'mayiko asanu ndi limodzi: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland ndi Mozambique ali pachiopsezo cha njala ngati salandira chakudya.

en: World Food Program officials say they need one million tons of food to alleviate hunger in southern Africa, but they are not confident they will get it. In an appeal to the international community at the beginning of July, WFP officials asked for more than $0.5 billion to buy food. So far they have received only 20 percent of that. WFP's director for the southern Africa region, Judith Lewis, says the situation is getting desperate. "The window of opportunity to avert what could be a major humanitarian crisis is closing," she said. "We need more assistance now. We need food on the high seas now, or we need cash to buy commodities that are still available in southern Africa, so we can avert this major, major crisis."
ny: Akuluakulu a bungwe la World Food Programme ati akufunika chakudya chokwana matani 1 miliyoni kuti athetse njala kum’mwera kwa Africa, koma alibe chidaliro choti apeza. Popempha mayiko padziko lonse kumayambiriro kwa mwezi wa July, akuluakulu a WFP adapempha ndalama zoposa $ 0.5 biliyoni kuti agule chakudya. Pakali pano angolandira 20 peresenti yokha ya zimenezo. Mkulu wa bungwe la WFP kuchigawo cha kummwera kwa Africa, Judith Lewis, ati zinthu zafika povuta. "Njira yopezera mwayi wopewa zomwe zitha kukhala vuto lalikulu lothandizira anthu ikutha," adatero. "Tikufuna thandizo lochulukirapo tsopano. Tikufuna chakudya m'mphepete mwa nyanja tsopano, kapena tikufuna ndalama kuti tigule zinthu zomwe zilipobe kum'mwera kwa Africa, kuti tipewe vuto lalikululi."

en: Currently, the WFP is assisting six million of the most vulnerable people in the six most severely affected countries. About half of these people are in Zimbabwe. The agency says it is sure the number of people needing its help will rise.
ny: Pakalipano, WFP ikuthandiza anthu mamiliyoni asanu ndi limodzi omwe ali pachiopsezo kwambiri m'mayiko asanu ndi limodzi omwe akhudzidwa kwambiri. Pafupifupi theka la anthuwa ali ku Zimbabwe. Bungweli lati likutsimikiza kuti chiwerengero cha anthu omwe akufunika thandizo chikwera.

en: The World Health Organization notes southern Africa, in addition to having the highest prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the world, also has the world's highest chronic malnutrition rates. It predicts about 300,000 people could die over the next six months from diseases related to malnutrition.
ny: Bungwe la World Health Organization linanena kuti kumwera kwa Africa, kuwonjezera pa kufala kwambiri kwa HIV/AIDS padziko lonse lapansi, kulinso anthu amene ali ndi vuto la kupereŵera kwa zakudya m’thupi. Ilosera kuti anthu pafupifupi 300,000 akhoza kufa m'miyezi isanu ndi umodzi ikubwerayi chifukwa cha matenda okhudzana ndi kuperewera kwa zakudya m'thupi.

en: Ms. Lewis says the dying has already begun. "We are seeing people moving from their villages," she said. "If they know there is going to be a food distribution, they immediately go there. The problem is we do not even have enough food to feed the people who are on the rolls, let alone add food for other people in the areas. Is there a potential to become chaotic? Yes. "
ny: Mayi Lewis akuti kufa kwayamba kale. "Tikuwona anthu akusuntha m'midzi yawo," adatero. "Ngati akudziwa kuti pagawidwe chakudya, nthawi yomweyo amapita komweko. Vuto ndilakuti tilibe ngakhale chakudya chokwanira kudyetsa anthu omwe ali m'mipukutu, ngakhale kuwonjezera chakudya cha anthu ena m'madera. Kodi zingatheke kukhala chipwirikiti? Inde. "

en: WFP'S Judith Lewis says at this time of year the agency is usually planning how to get food supplies into the region before the rainy season hits in October. But she says since the WFP is already having difficulty meeting its present targets, it can't even begin to plan for future food deliveries.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa bungwe la WFP, Judith Lewis, ati pa nthawi ino ya chaka bungweli nthawi zambiri likukonza njira zopezera chakudya m’derali nyengo ya mvula isanayambike mu October. Koma iye wati popeza bungwe la WFP likuvutika kale kukwaniritsa zomwe likufuna, silingayambe kukonzekera zokapereka chakudya mtsogolo.

en: Canadian PM Impressed With African Development Plan - 2002-04-05
ny: PM waku Canada Wachita Chidwi Ndi Mapulani Achitukuko A Africa - 2002-04-05

en: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien says he is impressed with the progress being made towards implementing an African development plan.
ny: Nduna ya dziko la Canada a Jean Chretien ati ndiwokondwa ndi momwe akuyendera pokwaniritsa ndondomeko yachitukuko mu Africa.

en: Mr. Chretien made the remarks Sunday after meeting with South African President Thabo Mbeki and other regional leaders in Pretoria.
ny: A Chretien anena izi lamulungu atakumana ndi mtsogoleri wa dziko la South Africa a Thabo Mbeki komanso atsogoleri ena a zigawo mu mzinda wa Pretoria.

en: Mr. Chretien, the current chairman of the group of the seven most industrialized nations plus Russia, is visiting Africa to discuss the New Partnership for Africa's Development, known as NEPAD.
ny: A Chretien, wapampando wapano wa gulu la mayiko asanu ndi awiri otukuka kwambiri kuphatikiza Russia, akupita ku Africa kukakambirana za New Partnership for Africa Development, yotchedwa NEPAD.

en: He said NEPAD will be one of the top agendas at the June G-8 summit in Kananaskis, Canada.
ny: Ananenanso kuti NEPAD ikhala imodzi mwazokambirana zapamwamba pa msonkhano wa June G-8 ku Kananaskis, Canada.

en: The G-8 nations are Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United States and Russia.
ny: Mayiko a G-8 ndi Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, United States ndi Russia.

en: Mr. Chretien says topics such as human rights, democracy the rule of law, transparency and good governance will be discussed at the G8 summit.
ny: A Chretien ati nkhani monga za ufulu wachibadwidwe, demokalase ulamulilo wa malamulo, kuwonekera poyera ndi ulamulilo wabwino zidzakambidwa pa msonkhano wa G8.

en: NEPAD outlines objectives of promoting democracy and good governance in Africa in return for Western economic assistance. It seeks to achieve an annual growth rate of seven-percent on the African continent by 2015.
ny: NEPAD ikufotokoza zolinga zolimbikitsa demokalase ndi utsogoleri wabwino mu Africa pobwezera thandizo lazachuma la Azungu. Ikufuna kukwaniritsa chiwonjezeko chapachaka cha 7 peresenti ku Africa pofika 2015.

en: South African President Mbeki said he is convinced that Africa is ready for NEPAD saying there has been definite progress toward democracy in the continent.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la South Africa Mbeki wati ali ndi chikhulupiliro kuti Africa ndi yokonzeka ku NEPAD ponena kuti pakhala chitukuko chotsimikizika ku demokalase ku kontinenti.

en: Later, Mr. Chretien and Mr. Mbeki were joined by presidents Festus Mogae of Botswana, Bakili Muluzu of Malawi, Joaquim Chissano of Mozambique, Sam Nujoma of Namibia, Benjamin Makapa of Tanzania and Vice President Enoch Kavindele of Zambia.
ny: Pambuyo pake, a Chretien ndi a Mbeki adatsagana ndi pulezidenti Festus Mogae wa Botswana, Bakili Muluzu wa Malawi, Joaquim Chissano wa Mozambique, Sam Nujoma wa Namibia, Benjamin Makapa wa Tanzania ndi Vice Presidenti Enoch Kavindele wa Zambia.

en: Zimbabwe's President Robert Mugabe, who won re-election in disputed voting last month, was not invited.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa dziko la Zimbabwe Robert Mugabe, yemwe adapambananso pa chisankho mwezi watha, sanayitanidwe.

en: Reuters news agency reports the Canadian prime minister who has already visited Morocco, Algeria and Nigeria on his six-nation tour will visit Ethiopia and Senegal after South Africa.
ny: Bungwe latolankhani la Reuters likuti nduna yayikulu yaku Canada yomwe idayendera kale Morocco, Algeria ndi Nigeria paulendo wake wamayiko asanu ndi limodzi adzayendera Ethiopia ndi Senegal pambuyo pa South Africa.

en: Some information for this report provided by Reuters and AFP.
ny: Zambiri za lipotili zoperekedwa ndi Reuters ndi AFP.

en: Child Labor in Malawi - 2002-02-28
ny: Kugwiritsa Ntchito Ana M'Malawi - 2002-02-28

en: The organization, Eye of the Child, is expressing concern about what is says is a large number of children who are being forced to work due to poverty.
ny: Bungwe la Eye of the Child lati likukhudzidwa ndi zomwe akuti ndi kuchuluka kwa ana omwe akukakamizidwa kugwira ntchito chifukwa cha umphawi.

en: It says these children risk being abused.
ny: Limanena kuti ana amenewa akhoza kuchitiridwa nkhanza.

en: Some under aged children work as mini – bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre. They are some of the many children who have been forced into employment because of poverty.
ny: Ana ena osakalamba amagwira ntchito ngati mamini - mabasi oitanira anyamata m'boma la Limbe mumzinda wa Blantyre. Ndi ena mwa ana ambiri omwe amakakamizika kulowa ntchito chifukwa cha umphawi.

en: Maxwell Matewere is the executive director of Eye of the Child. He says many of the children come from rural areas. He says, "Currently we havent done a data analysis but the Ministry of Labor intends to do that as soon as possible with financial resources from the International Labor Organization.
ny: Maxwell Matewere ndi mkulu wa Eye of the Child. Iye wati ana ambiri amachokera kumidzi. Iye akuti, "Pakadali pano sitinafufuze deta koma Unduna wa Zantchito ukukonzekera kuchita izi posachedwa ndi ndalama zochokera ku International Labor Organisation.

en: But basing on our own assessment and through our works, we feel child labor is a serious problem particularly in the rural areas and you can tell that from trafficking of children from rural areas to urban areas where most of the young people are working in peoples houses.
ny: Koma potengera kuwunika kwathu komanso ntchito zathu, tikuwona kuti kugwiritsa ntchito ana ndi vuto lalikulu makamaka kumidzi ndipo mutha kudziwa kuti kuyambira pakugulitsa ana kuchokera kumidzi kupita kumizinda komwe achinyamata ambiri akugwira ntchito m'nyumba za anthu. .

en: " Mr. Matewere says poor children often find work on large farm estates.
ny: “A Matewere akuti ana osauka nthawi zambiri amapeza ntchito m’minda yaikulu.

en: He said, "We have noticed that there are some indications that there are children who are working in tea estates and tobacco estates.
ny: Iye anati: “Taona kuti pali ana amene akugwira ntchito m’malo olima tiyi komanso m’minda ya fodya.

en: There also are children who are working in brick making mostly their parents will facilitate for them to work in those kinds of employment. "
ny: Palinso ana omwe akugwira ntchito youmba njerwa makamaka makolo awo amawathandizira kuti azigwira ntchito zamtunduwu. "

en: Mr. Matewere says the Eye of the Child has established that there are gross violations of children rights in the country. These include, rape, defilement and being overworked.
ny: Bambo Matewere ati Diso la Mwana latsimikiza kuti m’dziko muno muli kuphwanya ufulu wa ana kwadzaoneni. Izi zikuphatikizapo, kugwiriridwa, kudetsedwa komanso kugwiritsiridwa ntchito mopitirira muyeso.

en: He says this violates the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.
ny: Iye akuti izi zikuphwanya mgwirizano wa United Nations pa Ufulu wa Mwana.

en: "If you look at the Convention of the Rights of a Child," he said, "you will see that it provides for the protection for children from any kind of exploitation from any kind of harmful activities or act which threatens their health, their development which is a threat to education.
ny: "Mukayang'ana Pangano la Ufulu wa Mwana," adatero, "mudzawona kuti limapereka chitetezo kwa ana kumtundu uliwonse wa ntchito zovulaza kapena kuchita zinthu zomwe zingawononge thanzi lawo, chitukuko chawo. zomwe zikuwopseza maphunziro.

en: So children who are found working in tea estates, who are found in brick making, obvious, their rights as it is provided for in the Convention for the Rights of the Children as well as in the constitution are violated. "
ny: Choncho ana amene amapezeka akugwira ntchito m’minda ya tiyi, amene amapezeka kuumba njerwa, zodziwikiratu, ufulu wawo monga waperekedwa mu Convention for the Rights of the Children komanso m’malamulo amaphwanyidwa. "

en: The Eye of the Child executive director says his organization is looking at ways of protecting the rights of a child.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la Eye of the Child wati bungwe lawo likuyang’ana njira zotetezera ufulu wa ana.

en: He says to achieve this, the group has started a number of programs. "We have recently started a new program and what we are trying to do is to inform the general public on the best interests of the child and to inform them on the rights of a child.
ny: Iye wati kuti izi zitheke, gululi layambitsa mapologalamu angapo. “Posachedwapa tayamba pulogalamu yatsopano ndipo chomwe tikuyesetsa kuchita ndikudziwitsa anthu onse zokomera mwana komanso kuwadziwitsa za ufulu wa mwana.

en: At the same we want also to build up the capacity of the children themselves so that may be they can be use their authentic voice out their concerns. "
ny: Momwemonso tikufunanso kukulitsa luso la anawo kuti athe kugwiritsa ntchito mawu awo enieni pofotokoza nkhawa zawo. "

en: According to the Ministry of Labor authorities, many children are forced to leave school and find work because parents cannot afford school fees.
ny: Malinga ndi unduna wa zantchito, ana ambiri amakakamizika kusiya sukulu ndi kukapeza ntchito chifukwa makolo sangakwanitse kulipirira sukulu.

en: Although primary school is free in Malawi, most children do not attend due to lack of necessities like clothes.
ny: Ngakhale sukulu za pulaimale ndi zaulere ku Malawi, ana ambiri sapita chifukwa chosowa zofunika monga zovala.

en: Over 60 per cent of Malawis nearly 11 million people live below the poverty line.
ny: Anthu opitilira 60 pa 100 aliwonse amalawi pafupifupi anthu 11 miliyoni ali pa umphawi.

en: Malawi Court Convicts 12 People in Albino Attack
ny: Khothi la Malawi Lagamula Anthu 12 Olakwa Pachiwembu cha Albino

en: A high court in Malawi has convicted five people of murder for the 2018 killing of a 22-year-old albino man, including the victims brother.
ny: Bwalo lalikulu la milandu ku Malawi lagamula anthu 5 olakwa pa mlandu wopha munthu wa zaka 22 wa chialubino mu 2018.

en: The court convicted seven other people of selling the victim's body parts.
ny: Khotilo lagamula anthu ena 7 olakwa pa mlandu wogulitsa ziwalo za munthu wophedwayo.

en: Malawi officials say more than 170 albinos have been attacked in the country since 2014 by people who believe their body parts bring luck and wealth.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma la Malawi ati maalubino oposa 170 akhala akumenyedwa mdzikolo kuyambira 2014 ndi anthu omwe akukhulupirira kuti ziwalo zawo zimabweretsa mwayi komanso chuma.

en: Family members of the deceased, MacDonald Masambuka, left the courtroom Thursday with hopes of justice being served after the court convicted all 12 people accused in his death.  F
ny: Achibale a malemu, MacDonald Masambuka, adatuluka m’bwalo lamilandu Lachinayi ndi chiyembekezo kuti chilungamo chichitika pomwe bwalo lidapeza olakwa onse 12 omwe adawaganizira pa imfa yake. F

en: amily members, including Masambukas mother, appeared calm and composed as Judge Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga read the judgments.
ny: achibale, kuphatikizapo mayi a Masambukas, adawoneka odekha ndipo adalemba mawu pomwe Jaji Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga amawerenga zigamulo.

en: Those convicted included a Catholic priest, Father Thomas Muhosa, police officer Chikondi Chileka, clinician Lumbani Kamanga, and the deceaseds brother, Cassim Masambuka. Charges included murder, extracting human tissues, causing harm to a person with disability, and trafficking in persons.
ny: Opezeka olakwa ndi wansembe wa mpingo wakatolika, Bambo Thomas Muhosa, wapolisi Chikondi Chileka, sing’anga Lumbani Kamanga, komanso m’bale womwalirayo, Cassim Masambuka. Mlanduwo unaphatikizapo kupha, kuchotsa minofu ya anthu, kuvulaza munthu wolumala, ndi kuzembetsa anthu.

en: Kamanga convicted the victims brother and four others of murder.
ny: Kamanga adagamula mchimwene wawo ndi ena anayi olakwa pakupha.

en: The court convicted seven other people, including the priest and police officer, of selling the victim's body parts.
ny: Bwaloli lagamula anthu ena 7 kuphatikizapo wansembe komanso wapolisi chifukwa chogulitsa ziwalo za munthu wophedwayo.

en: Business with tissue  According to the court, Muhosha, Chileka and others offered to conduct business using human tissue extracted from a human corpse.
ny: Bizinesi ndi minofu Malinga ndi bwalo, Muhosha, Chileka ndi ena adadzipereka kuchita bizinesi pogwiritsa ntchito minofu yamunthu yotengedwa mumtembo wamunthu.

en: The judge said the state proved beyond reasonable doubt the 12 people conspired to kill Masambuka to extract his bones based on a perception they would benefit financially.
ny: Woweruzayo adati boma latsimikizira mosakayikira kuti anthu 12 adakonza chiwembu chopha Masambuka kuti amuchotse mafupa poganizira kuti apindula ndi chuma.

en: She said Masambuka is the latest victim of violent attacks on persons with albinism who have not been protected by the community.
ny: Iye adati Masambuka ndi omwe adachitiridwa nkhanza kwa anthu achialubino omwe sadatetezedwe ndi anthu ammudzi.

en: Director of Public Prosecutions Steve Kayuni represented the state in the case. He said he was pleased the court agreed on all the seven charges he presented.
ny: Director of Public Prosecutions Steve Kayuni ndiye adayimira boma pamlanduwo. Iye adati ndi wokondwa kuti khotilo lidavomereza milandu isanu ndi iwiri yonse yomwe adapereka.

en: "Its really something overwhelming on the part of the state considering that this matter, if you notice, there is a police officer involved, a priest involved and there is a brother involved.
ny: “Ndi chinthu chovuta kwambiri m’boma poganizira kuti nkhaniyi, mukazindikira, pali wapolisi, wansembe amene akukhudzidwa ndipo pali m’bale amene akukhudzidwa.

en: If you notice, it all revolves around the position of trust — that somebody like the late Macdonald Masambuka trusted so much, they are the ones who ended up betraying him," Kayuni said.
ny: Ngati mukuona, zonse zimayenderana ndi kukhulupilika - kuti munthu ngati Malemu Macdonald Masambuka ankamukhulupirira kwambiri, ndi amene anamaliza kumupereka,” adatero Kayuni.

en: Masambuka went missing from his village on March 9, 2018, and his limbless body was found buried in a garden on April 2, 2018, in his home district of Machinga south of Malawi.
ny: Masambuka adasowa m’mudzi mwawo pa 9 March, 2018, ndipo thupi lake lopanda manja linapezeka litakwiriridwa m’dimba pa 2 April, 2018, m’boma la Machinga kumwera kwa dziko la Malawi.

en: Enticement  Court documents show that Masambuka was enticed by his brother to meet his friends, who he claimed had found a girl for him to marry.
ny: Zikalata za khothi zikusonyeza kuti Masambuka adanyengedwa ndi mchimwene wake kuti akakumane ndi anzake omwe amati adamupezera mtsikana woti akwatire.

en: But when they reached the scene, the alleged friends grabbed Masambuka by the neck and dragged him to a garden where they killed him. Here, his assailants cut off his limbs, burned his body using petrol and buried it there.
ny: Koma atafika pamalopo, akuti anzawowo adamugwira pakhosi Masambuka ndikumukokera kumunda komwe adamupha. Apa, achiwembu ake adamudula miyendo, kuwotcha thupi lake ndi petulo ndikulikwirira komweko.

en: This was the first such case involving high-profile community members involved in attacks on persons with albinism.
ny: Uwu unali mlandu woyamba woterewu wokhudza anthu odziwika bwino mdera lawo omwe akukhudzidwa ndi nkhanza za maalubino.

en: Masauko Chamkakala, the lawyer for the 12 defendants in the case, said he would comment once he had gone through the judgment.
ny: Loya wa anthu 12 omwe akuzengedwa mlanduwo, Masauko Chamkakala, wati apereka ndemanga akamaliza chigamulo.

en: "We are still waiting to see the perfected judgment so that we can read it and study it and talk to our clients," Chamkakala said.
ny: Tikuyembekezerabe kuwona chiweruzo changwiro kuti tiwerenge ndikuwerenga komanso kukambirana ndi makasitomala athu,” adatero Chamkakala.

en: Rights activists said they expected the court to give stiffer punishment to those convicted.
ny: Omenyera ufulu adati amayembekezera kuti khotilo lipereka chilango chokhwima kwa omwe apezeka olakwa.

en: 'Serious sentencing'
ny: 'Chilango chachikulu'

en: Ian Simbota represented the Association of Persons with Albinism at the court.
ny: Ian Simbota yemwe adayimira bungwe la Association of Persons with Albinism ku bwaloli.

en: "When the judge was reading, what concerned me was that part of a [Priest] Father Muhosha [and others] who have been convicted of transacting body parts.
ny: “Pomwe woweruza amawerenga, chomwe chidandidetsa nkhawa chinali mbali ya [Wansembe] Bambo Muhosha [ndi ena] omwe adapezeka ndi mlandu wophwanya ziwalo zathupi.

en: If you go to the Anatomy Act, it is not so hard on such offenses.
ny: Ngati mupita ku Anatomy Act, sizovuta kwambiri pazolakwa zotere.

en: So, we are really looking forward to the judge, if at all its possible, to put a human face to the case so that at least we really need to see serious sentencing on this case," Simbota said.
ny: Choncho, tikuyembekezera kuti woweruza ngati n’kotheka aike nkhope ya munthu pamlanduwo kuti tingoona kuti mlanduwu ukuperekedwa mwamphamvu,” adatero Simbota.

en: The high court is expected to sentence the perpetrators on May 30.
ny: Khothi lalikulu likuyembekezeka kugamula olakwawo pa 30 May.

en: In another case, a high court on Thursday sentenced a 37-year-old man to life in prison for the 2020 murder of a 14-year-old-boy with albinism in Phalombe district.
ny: Pamlandu wina, bwalo lalikulu la milandu Lachinayi lagamula bambo wina wa zaka 37 zakubadwa kuti akakhale kundende kwa moyo wawo wonse pamlandu wopha mwana wa zaka 14 wachialubino m’chaka cha 2020 m’boma la Phalombe.

en: Zimbabwe Official Defends Crackdown on Protests, Urges Patience with Economy
ny: Akuluakulu a Zimbabwe Ateteza Kuwonongeka kwa Ziwonetsero, Apempha Kuleza Mtima ndi Zachuma

en: Zimbabwe's minister of foreign affairs and international trade on Monday defended crackdowns on anti-government demonstrations and urged patience in turning around the country's foundering economy.
ny: Nduna yowona za maiko akunja ndi malonda akunja ku Zimbabwe Lolemba idateteza ziwonetsero zotsutsana ndi boma la Zimbabwe ndipo yalimbikitsa kudekha posintha chuma chomwe chidayambitsa dzikolo.

en: Though "everybody's got the right to demonstrate," there have "been a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence," Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview. Citing public safety, he endorsed a Zimbabwe court's ruling hours earlier to uphold a police ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.
ny: Ngakhale "aliyense ali ndi ufulu wowonetsa," pakhala "zambiri zopeka ndi ziwawa," Sibusiso B. Moyo adauza VOA poyankhulana. Potengera chitetezo cha anthu, adavomereza chigamulo cha khothi la Zimbabwe maola angapo m'mbuyomo kuti apolisi aletse ziwonetsero zomwe zidakonzedwa ndi mgwirizano wotsutsa wa Movement for Democratic Change (MDC).

en: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government. They had organized a demonstration Monday in Bulawayo, the country's second-largest city, but police authorities banned it hours before its intended start. Two other opposition demonstrations still are planned this week: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.
ny: Atsogoleri a Alliance akukakamiza Purezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa ndi chipani cholamula cha ZANU-PF kuti alowe m'boma losintha. Iwo adakonza ziwonetsero Lolemba mu mzinda wa Bulawayo, womwe ndi mzinda wachiwiri kwa akuluakulu mdzikolo, koma apolisi adaletsa ziwonetserozo kutatsala maola angapo kuti ziyambe. Ziwonetsero zina ziwiri zotsutsa zikuyembekezeka sabata ino: zapakati pa mzinda wa Gweru Lachiwiri komanso kumwera chakum'mawa kwa Masvingo Lachitatu.

en: Police also had pre-emptively banned a demonstration in Harare last Friday, a decision upheld by a Zimbabwe court. Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police. Video and photographs showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.
ny: Apolisi adaletsanso ziwonetsero ku Harare Lachisanu lapitali, chigamulo chomwe bwalo lamilandu la Zimbabwe linatsatira. Otsatira mazana a MDC adanyalanyaza chiletsocho, zomwe zidayambitsa mikangano pakati pa anthu wamba ndi apolisi. Makanema ndi zithunzi zidawonetsa apolisi akumenya ndi kukankha ziwonetsero zina zomwe zidadzetsa madandaulo amphamvu kwambiri kuchokera kumagulu omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe, kuphatikiza ofesi ya United Nations yoona za ufulu wachibadwidwe.

en: Police, not demonstrators, showed up in force on Bulawayo streets Monday, with foot patrols wielding shields, batons and, in some cases, pistols. The Associated Press reported police trucks and water cannons positioned in the downtown area.
ny: Apolisi, osati ochita ziwonetsero, adawonekera Lolemba m'misewu ya Bulawayo, ndi oyendayenda omwe ali ndi zishango, ndodo komanso mfuti. Nyuzipepala ya Associated Press inanena kuti magalimoto apolisi ndi mizinga yamadzi yomwe ili mkatikati mwa tawuni.

en: A young man in Bulawayo, identifying himself only as James, told VOA that negotiations between the government and opposition leaders were even more important than demonstrations.
ny: Mnyamata wina mumzinda wa Bulawayo, yemwe akudzitchula kuti ndi James yekha, wawuza VOA kuti zokambirana zapakati pa boma ndi atsogoleri otsutsa ndizofunika kwambiri kuposa ziwonetsero.

en: "Honestly, to demonstrate, we can end up being hurt by being beaten, being chased around. There's really nothing that we see coming out of it," James said. "But these men should sit down and see what they can do for us, especially us, the youth. … We have been affected a lot, and we are getting old just running."
ny: "Kunena zoona, kusonyeza, tikhoza kuvulazidwa ndi kumenyedwa, kuthamangitsidwa. Palibe kwenikweni chomwe timawona chikutuluka," adatero James. "Koma amunawa akhale pansi ndikuwona zomwe angatichitire, makamaka ife achinyamata. … Takhudzidwa kwambiri, ndipo tikukalamba ndikungothamanga."

en: Moyo, the foreign minister, told VOA the administration is "undertaking economic reforms [that] are fundamental and they are key to ensuring that even the youth would finally have jobs created for them, so that we can create an environment where investors and the capital will find it easy to come into this country, where jobs will be created, and the youth will be part and parcel of economic activity."
ny: A Moyo, nduna ya zakunja, adauza VOA kuti akuluakulu aboma "akupanga kusintha kwachuma [zomwe] ndizofunikira kwambiri ndipo ndizofunikira kwambiri pakuwonetsetsa kuti ngakhale achinyamata apeza ntchito zowapezera, kuti tithe kukhazikitsa malo omwe osunga ndalama ndi likulu. ziwona kukhala kosavuta kubwera m'dziko lino, momwe ntchito zidzakhazikitsidwa, ndipo achinyamata adzakhala mbali imodzi yazachuma."

en: Moyo said Zimbabwe is midway into a two-year "transition stabilization program" to revive the country's devastated economy: "We have got one year to go and we are saying we should by then be out of the doldrums."
ny: Moyo wati dziko la Zimbabwe lili mkati mwa zaka ziwiri za "transition stabilization programme" yokonzanso chuma chomwe chawonongeka mdzikolo: "Tatsala ndi chaka chimodzi kuti tithe ndipo tikunena kuti tikhala titachoka m'mavuto."

en: The southern African country of nearly 16 million is experiencing its worst financial crisis since 2008, beset by hyperinflation and the fallout of decades of corruption. Many struggle to buy basics such as food and medicine. With the poor economy and crops devastated by drought and a spring cyclone, the UN World Food Program anticipates that 5.5 million people will need emergency food aid by next April.
ny: Dziko lakummwera kwa Africa lomwe lili ndi anthu pafupifupi 16 miliyoni likukumana ndi vuto lalikulu lazachuma kuyambira 2008, lomwe lakhudzidwa ndi kukwera kwa mitengo komanso kugwa kwa ziphuphu zazaka zambiri. Ambiri amavutika kuti agule zinthu zofunika monga chakudya ndi mankhwala. Chifukwa chachuma komanso mbewu zomwe zawonongeka chifukwa cha chilala komanso chimphepo chamkuntho, bungwe la UN World Food Programme likuyembekeza kuti anthu 5.5 miliyoni adzafunika thandizo lachangu pofika Epulo wamawa.

en: Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube, who had predicted 3.1% growth for 2019, offered a sobering update to Zimbabwe's parliament in early August. "The revised 2019 GDP growth is expected to be negative," Reuters news service reported him as saying.
ny: Nduna ya Zachuma Mthuli Ncube, yemwe adaneneratu za kukula kwa 3.1% mu 2019, adapereka zosintha ku nyumba yamalamulo ku Zimbabwe kumayambiriro kwa Ogasiti. "Kukula kosinthidwa kwa GDP kwa 2019 kukuyembekezeka kukhala koyipa," atero a Reuters.

en: Ncube did not provide any updated figure.
ny: Ncube sanaperekepo zina zomwe zasinthidwa.

en: Civil Society Workers Run Afoul of Tanzania Security Officials in Sign of Increasing Clampdown
ny: Ogwira ntchito m'mabungwe a Civil Society Athamangitsana ndi akuluakulu a chitetezo ku Tanzania Posonyeza Kuwonjezeka kwa Kuchepetsa

en: African civil society campaigners attending a conference in Tanzania were questioned and warned over the weekend, in what human rights activists say is part of a continuing clampdown on free speech in the East African nation.
ny: Omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe ku Africa omwe adachita nawo msonkhano ku Tanzania adafunsidwa mafunso ndikuchenjezedwa kumapeto kwa sabata, zomwe omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe akuti ndi gawo limodzi loletsa kupitiliza kuletsa ufulu wolankhula m'dziko la East Africa.

en: Details are still emerging over what exactly happened to at least 40 civil society workers who ran afoul of security officials at this year's summit of the Southern African Development Community in Dar es Salaam.
ny: Tsatanetsatane idakalipobe pa zomwe zidachitikira anthu osachepera 40 ogwira ntchito m'mabungwe omwe adasemphana ndi akuluakulu achitetezo pamsonkhano wachaka chino wa Southern African Development Community ku Dar es Salaam.

en: But rights experts said Monday that the episode is another worrying sign of heightened paranoia and harassment from the government.
ny: Koma akatswiri a zaufulu ati Lolemba kuti gawoli ndi chizindikiro china chodetsa nkhawa chakuchulukirachulukira komanso kuzunzidwa ndi boma.

en: Catherine Eden, a lawyer for the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, says the incident stemmed from a misunderstanding. South African delegates to the 15-nation conference, she said, wanted to hold a short commemoration of the seventh anniversary of South Africa's deadly Marikana mine massacre on Aug. 16. Thirty-four striking miners were killed by police in the deadliest security incident since the end of apartheid in 1994.
ny: Loya wa bungwe lomenyera ufulu wa anthu la Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, Catherine Eden, akuti izi zidachitika chifukwa cha kusamvetsetsana. Nthumwi za ku South Africa ku msonkhano wa mayiko 15, adatero, zikufuna kuchita mwambo wokumbukira wachisanu ndi chiwiri wa kuphedwa kwakupha kwa mgodi wa Marikana ku South Africa pa Aug 16. kutha kwa tsankho mu 1994.

en: So delegates at a side event sang the South African anthem, held a moment of silence and availed on their government to better protect its people. But something they wrote on a piece of paper convinced security police the delegates had bigger plans.
ny: Chifukwa chake nthumwi pamwambo wapambali zidaimba nyimbo ya South Africa, zidakhala chete ndipo zidathandizira boma lawo kuteteza bwino anthu ake. Koma zomwe adalemba papepala zidatsimikizira apolisi achitetezo kuti nthumwizo zinali ndi mapulani akulu.

en: "They wrote some messages on the flip charts, of which the little content that was captured in the flip charts read, 'Stop killing our people,'" she said. "... So I think there was a national security person in that meeting and he saw those messages and so he interpreted that as a plan to demonstrate. But if you look closely, you can't see any relationship as to why they would want to demonstrate for the Marikana shootings in Tanzania."
ny: "Adalemba mauthenga ena pazithunzi, zomwe zina zomwe zidajambulidwa m'mapepala akuluakulu zimati, 'Lekani kupha anthu athu,' adatero. "... Ndiye ndikuganiza kuti pamsonkhanowo panali munthu wachitetezo cha dziko ndipo adawona mauthengawo ndipo adatanthauzira ngati ndondomeko yowonetsera. Koma ngati mutayang'anitsitsa, simungathe kuona ubale uliwonse chifukwa ndikufuna kuwonetsa zakuwombera ku Marikana ku Tanzania."

en: It's not clear if anyone was actually arrested. Other rights groups say that some foreign campaigners were arrested, but not interrogated.
ny: Sizikudziwika ngati wina adamangidwa. Mabungwe ena omenyera ufulu amati ena ochita kampeni akunja adamangidwa, koma osafunsidwa.

en: 'Afraid, insecure'
ny: 'Mantha, osatetezeka'

en: Eden says she was summoned by authorities as she went to the police station Friday night to meet with a local coordinator and then was let go with a warning. Police later went to delegates' hotel rooms looking for materials that they thought were a security threat. They found nothing, she said.
ny: Eden akuti adayitanidwa ndi aboma pomwe adapita kupolisi Lachisanu usiku kukakumana ndi wogwirizira m'deralo ndipo adamusiya ndi chenjezo. Pambuyo pake apolisi anapita m’zipinda za nthumwi za m’mahotela kufunafuna zinthu zimene ankaganiza kuti zingawononge chitetezo. Sanapeze kalikonse, adatero.

en: Janet Zhou, director of the Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, was one of the campaigners questioned by security forces at her hotel.
ny: Janet Zhou, mkulu wa bungwe la Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, anali m'modzi mwa omwe adafunsidwa mafunso ndi achitetezo ku hotelo yake.

en: "I was afraid, I was insecure, I was traumatized to say the least," she told VOA, after returning home to Harare. "Because seven security details coming over after midnight and questioning me about a demonstration and placards that I wasn't going to be able to give them, was something else. I didn't understand it. It left me really terrified."
ny: "Ndinali mantha, ndinali wosatetezeka, ndinali wokhumudwa kunena pang'ono," adauza VOA, atabwerera kwawo ku Harare. "Chifukwa zidziwitso zisanu ndi ziwiri zachitetezo zomwe zidabwera pakati pausiku ndikundifunsa za ziwonetsero ndi zikwangwani zomwe sindingathe kuwapatsa, zinali zina. Sindinamvetse. Zinandisiya ndili ndi mantha."

en: She said police then told her — and her 40-person delegation — to remain in their hotel all day Saturday. She asked them if they were under arrest, to which they did not reply.
ny: Anati apolisi kenako adamuuza - ndi nthumwi zake za anthu 40 - kuti azikhala mu hotelo yawo Loweruka lonse. Anawafunsa ngati anamangidwa, koma sanayankhe.

en: 'Perfectly valid'
ny: 'Zabwino kwambiri'

en: Oryem Nyeko, a Kampala-based researcher for Human Rights Watch, noted that Tanzanian police didn't do anything technically illegal. But, he said, that doesn't make it right, either.
ny: Oryem Nyeko, wofufuza za Human Rights Watch ku Kampala, adati apolisi aku Tanzania sanachite chilichonse chophwanya malamulo. Koma, iye anati, izo sizikupanga izo, ngakhale.

en: "I think it's a perfectly valid thing for police to do," he said. "However, the challenge with that is that it speaks to a wider problem in Tanzania as far as a closing civic space and the opportunities that people in civic society have to freely express themselves. This is part of a wider pattern of civic repression in the country."
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti ndichinthu choyenera kuti apolisi achite," adatero. "Komabe, vuto lomwe lili ndi izi ndikuti likunena za vuto lalikulu ku Tanzania pomwe dziko latsala pang'ono kutha komanso mwayi womwe anthu amtundu wa anthu ali nawo olankhula momasuka. dziko."

en: International groups like the Committee to Protect Journalists have also warned of increased repression. Ahead of the SADC summit, the watchdog group noted its concerns about a "deeply troubling erosion of press freedom," and of "attacks on individual journalists, media suspensions, internet shutdowns, and restrictive legislation."
ny: Magulu a mayiko monga Komiti Yoteteza Atolankhani achenjezanso za kuwonjezeka kwa kuponderezana. Msonkhano wa SADC usanachitike, gulu loyang'anira lidazindikira nkhawa zake za "kusokonekera kwakukulu kwa ufulu wa atolankhani," komanso "kuukira kwa atolankhani aliyense, kuyimitsidwa kwa media, kuyimitsidwa kwa intaneti, komanso malamulo oletsa."

en: The CPJ made special mention of Tanzanian journalists Azory Gwanda, who has been missing since 2017, and Erick Kabendera, who was arrested last month and charged with economic crimes, which the organization says is in retaliation for his critical journalism.
ny: Bungwe la CPJ lidatchula mwapadera atolankhani aku Tanzania, Azory Gwanda, omwe adasowa kuyambira 2017, ndi Erick Kabendera, yemwe adamangidwa mwezi watha ndikuyimbidwa mlandu wokhudza zachuma, zomwe bungweli lati likubwezera zomwe adalemba.

en: Kabendera remains behind bars. On Monday, Eden, his lawyer, said the court decided to adjourn to give prosecutors more time to investigate. That will keep him in jail for more than a week longer, until Aug. 30.
ny: Kabendera amakhala kundende. Lolemba, Eden, yemwe ndi loya wake, adati khotilo lidaganiza zoyimitsa kaye kuti oimira boma apereke nthawi yochulukirapo kuti afufuze. Izi zidzamusunga m’ndende kwa nthawi yoposa mlungu umodzi, mpaka pa Aug. 30.

en: 'Worrying trend'
ny: 'Worrying trend'

en: Anna Henga, director of the Legal and Human Rights Center, said police actions only further a worrying trend in Tanzania under President John Magafuli, whom critics say is becoming increasingly authoritarian.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la Legal and Human Rights Center, Anna Henga, adati zomwe apolisi akuchita zikungowonjezera nkhawa ku Tanzania muulamuliro wa Purezidenti John Magafuli, yemwe otsutsa akuti akuchulukirachulukira.

en: "This means the continuation of a limited civic space. Because this has happened since 2016. There are a lot of issues, there is a negative development toward limited civic space. And it is targeted to people like civil society organizations, the media, hindering the freedom of speech, the freedom of association."
ny: "Izi zikutanthauza kupitiriza kwa malo ochepa a anthu. Chifukwa izi zakhala zikuchitika kuyambira 2016. Pali nkhani zambiri, pali chitukuko choipa chokhudza malo ochepa a anthu. ufulu wa kulankhula, ufulu wosonkhana."

en: Few Demonstrators Turn Up for Zimbabwe Protest in Bulawayo
ny: Anthu Ochepa Ochita ziwonetsero ku Zimbabwe achita ziwonetsero ku Bulawayo

en: Few people have turned up for an opposition protest in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe's second city, on Monday as armed police maintained heavy presence on the streets and at a courthouse where the opposition is pressing to be allowed to hold the demonstration.
ny: Ndi anthu ochepa amene achita zionetsero zotsutsa ziwonetsero ku Bulawayo, mzinda wachiwiri ku Zimbabwe, Lolemba pamene apolisi omwe ali ndi zida akugwirabe ntchito m'misewu komanso m'bwalo lamilandu komwe otsutsa akukakamiza kuti aloledwe kuchita ziwonetserozo.

en: Business in Bulawayo's usually bustling downtown was subdued with the most traffic from police trucks, water cannons and dozens of police officers patrolling on foot.
ny: Bizinesi mutawuni ya Bulawayo yomwe nthawi zambiri imakhala yodzaza ndi anthu, idagwa pomwe magalimoto ambiri amagalimoto za apolisi, mizinga yamadzi komanso apolisi ambiri akuyenda wapansi.

en: The opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change, had called the protest as part of a planned series of demonstrations to push President Emmerson Mnangagwa to agree to a transitional government amid a rapidly deteriorating economy and rising political tensions.
ny: Chipani chotsutsa, Movement for Democratic Change, chidayitana ziwonetserozi ngati gawo limodzi la ziwonetsero zomwe zikufuna kukakamiza Purezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti avomere boma losintha pomwe chuma chikuwonongeka komanso kusamvana kwandale.

en: But the police banned the protest in the southern city, citing security concerns. A Bulawayo magistrate is hearing the opposition party's challenge to the ban.
ny: Koma apolisi adaletsa zionetserozi mu mzinda wa kumwera chifukwa cha chitetezo. Woweruza milandu mumzinda wa Bulawayo akumva zomwe zipani zotsutsa zikutsutsana ndi chiletsocho.

en: The protest was planned as a follow up to demonstrations held in the capital, Harare, on Friday when several hundred demonstrators marched in defiance of a police ban that was upheld by the High Court. Police used tear gas and beatings with batons to quell the Harare protest.
ny: Ziwonetserozi zidakonzedwa potsatira ziwonetsero zomwe zidachitika mu likulu la Harare, Lachisanu pomwe ziwonetsero mazana angapo adachita ziwonetsero zonyoza chiletso cha apolisi chomwe khothi lalikulu lidavomereza. Apolisi adagwiritsa ntchito utsi wokhetsa misozi komanso kumenya ndi ndodo kuti athetse ziwonetsero za mumzinda wa Harare.

en: Zimbabweans Claim Police Brutality During Economic Protests
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe Ati Achita Nkhanza Za Apolisi Pazionetsero Zazachuma

en: Zimbabweans defied a police ban Friday and held demonstrations to protest the country's deteriorating economy.
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe adakana chiletso cha apolisi Lachisanu ndipo adachita ziwonetsero zotsutsa kuwonongeka kwa chuma cha dzikolo.

en: Despite the High Court ban on planned protests, members of the Movement for Democratic Change took to the streets and clashed with police. Some of the injured accused police of derailing protests, which they said were meant to persuade President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government to breathe life into Zimbabwe's moribund economy.
ny: Ngakhale Khothi Lalikulu laletsa ziwonetsero zomwe zidakonzekera, mamembala a Movement for Democratic Change adalowa m'misewu ndikumenyana ndi apolisi. Ena mwa anthu ovulalawo adadzudzula apolisi kuti asokoneza zionetsero zomwe adati cholinga chake chinali kunyengerera boma la Purezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti lithandizire kukulitsa chuma cha Zimbabwe chomwe chikusokonekera.

en: With tears on her cheeks, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her degree had not helped her get anything for her three children.
ny: Misozi ili m’masaya, Tafadzwa Bvuta wa zaka 32 wati digiri yake sidamuthandize kupeza kalikonse kwa ana ake atatu.

en: "They beat us up," she said of the police. "What have we done? All these security forces are supposed to protect us all — not just one person. Where will we go and survive? Shall we kill our kids since we are struggling to take care of them?"
ny: "Anatimenya," adatero ponena za apolisi. "Tapanga chiyani? Magulu onse achitetezowa akuyenera kutiteteza tonse - osati munthu m'modzi. Tipita kuti tikapulumuke? Tipha ana athu popeza tikuvutikira kuwasamalira?"

en: Make Nyashanu, 27, said he would continue protesting because he is miserable about being unemployed.
ny: Make Nyashanu, 27, adati apitiliza kuchita ziwonetsero chifukwa ndi womvetsa chisoni chifukwa chosowa ntchito.

en: He said police were indiscriminately beating demonstrators — even elderly ones and people not protesting. "Is this democracy?" he asked, adding that it was a peaceful demonstration but police were causing chaos.
ny: Iye adati apolisi amamenya ziwonetsero mosasankha - ngakhale achikulire ndi anthu osachita ziwonetsero. "Kodi iyi ndi demokalase?" Adafunsa motele adawonjeza kuti chinali chionetsero chamtendere koma apolisi akuyambitsa chipwirikiti.

en: The opposition said it will hold another protest Monday in Zimbabwe's second largest city, Bulawayo, and will go to other cities and places until the government addresses the economy.
ny: Otsutsa ati achitanso ziwonetsero Lolemba mu mzinda wachiwiri waukulu ku Zimbabwe, Bulawayo, ndipo apita m'mizinda ndi malo ena mpaka boma litakambirana za chuma.

en: Government response
ny: Yankho la boma

en: Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa called the protests counterproductive, saying January's demonstrations against fuel price increases resulted in $20 million to $30 million in losses for businesses from looting and non-productive days.
ny: Nduna ya zofalitsa nkhani, Monica Mutsvangwa, yati ziwonetserozi sizinaphule kanthu, ponena kuti ziwonetsero za mu January zotsutsa kukwera kwa mitengo ya mafuta zidapangitsa kuti mabizinesi atayike pakati pa 20 miliyoni ndi $30 miliyoni chifukwa chobedwa komanso masiku osagwira ntchito.

en: "Government calls on all progressive Zimbabweans to desist from being used by negative forces to destabilize their own country, as this will only prolong the hardships which the government is tirelessly trying to address in a more sustainable manner," she said. "I wish to reiterate the call by His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic Zimbabweans to resort to dialogue as a means to solve the challenges we face as a nation."
ny: "Boma likupempha anthu onse a ku Zimbabwe omwe akupita patsogolo kuti asiye kugwiritsiridwa ntchito ndi zinthu zoipa pofuna kusokoneza dziko lawo, chifukwa izi zidzangowonjezera mavuto omwe boma likuyesetsa kuthana nawo mokhazikika," adatero. "Ndikufuna kubwereza pempho la Wolemekezeka Comrade ED Mnangagwa loti anthu onse okonda dziko la Zimbabwe ayambe kukambirana ngati njira yothetsera mavuto omwe tikukumana nawo ngati dziko."

en: Daniel Molokhele, the spokesman for the opposition, said his party was against Mnangagwa leading talks and accused him of stealing Zimbabwe's last election in 2018. He said the protests would continue until Zimbabwe's economy gets back on track.
ny: Mneneri wa zipani zotsutsa a Daniel Molokhele wati chipani chawo chikutsutsa zoti Mnangagwa atsogolere zokambiranazo ndipo amamudzudzula kuti adaba zisankho zomaliza za dziko la Zimbabwe mu 2018. Iye wati zionetserozi zipitilira mpaka chuma cha dziko la Zimbabwe chitayamba bwino.

en: UN Condemns Government Crackdown on Peaceful Protests in Zimbabwe
ny: UN Ikudzudzula Boma Loletsa Ziwonetsero Zamtendere ku Zimbabwe

en: The U.N. human rights office is condemning a crackdown Friday in Zimbabwe by riot police on peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare. The agency is calling for an investigation into excessive use of force by security forces.
ny: Ofesi ya United Nations yoona za ufulu wachibadwidwe ikudzudzula zigawenga zomwe zachitika Lachisanu ku Zimbabwe ku Zimbabwe zomwe zikuchita ziwonetsero zamtendere mumzinda wa Harare. Bungweli likufuna kuti pakhale kafukufuku wokhudza kugwiritsa ntchito mphamvu mopitirira muyeso kwa achitetezo.

en: U.N. Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville says there are better ways to deal with the populations legitimate grievances on the economic situation in the country than by cracking down on peaceful protestors.
ny: Mneneri wa UN Human Rights, Rupert Colville, akuti pali njira zabwino zothetsera madandaulo ovomerezeka a anthu pazachuma m'dzikolo kusiyana ndi kuletsa anthu ochita ziwonetsero mwamtendere.

en: "We are deeply concerned by the socio-economic crisis that continues to unfold in Zimbabwe. While acknowledging efforts made by the government, the international community and the U.N. in Zimbabwe to mitigate the effects of the crisis and reform process, the dire economic situation is now impacting negatively on the realization of economic and social rights of millions of Zimbabweans," Colville said.
ny: "Tili okhudzidwa kwambiri ndi mavuto azachuma omwe akupitirirabe ku Zimbabwe. Ngakhale kuti tikuvomereza zoyesayesa zomwe boma, mayiko ndi bungwe la UN ku Zimbabwe likuchita pofuna kuchepetsa zotsatira za mavuto ndi ndondomeko yokonzanso zinthu, vuto lalikulu la zachuma ndi tsopano zikusokoneza pakukwaniritsidwa kwa ufulu wachuma ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu mamiliyoni ambiri aku Zimbabwe," adatero Colville.

en: Zimbabwes citizens are struggling with hyperinflation, which has sent prices soaring for essential commodities such as fuel, food, transportation and health care. Compounding the problems is the ongoing impact of cyclone Idai that hit Zimbabwe in March and a severe drought.
ny: Nzika za dziko la Zimbabwe zikulimbana ndi vuto la hyperinflation, lomwe lapangitsa kuti mitengo ya zinthu zofunika kwambiri monga mafuta, chakudya, mayendedwe ndi chisamaliro chikwere. Chowonjezera mavutowa ndi kugwa kwa mphepo yamkuntho ya Idai yomwe idagunda ku Zimbabwe mu Marichi komanso chilala chowopsa.

en: The United Nations says one third of Zimbabwes population of 16 million people is in need of humanitarian aid.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations lati munthu mmodzi mwa atatu mwa anthu 16 miliyoni a ku Zimbabwe akufunika thandizo.

en: The fallout in terms of casualties and possible arrests from Fridays protests is not yet clear. But Colville tells VOA his office has received disturbing reports of human rights violations over the past few months.
ny: Kugwa kwa anthu ovulala komanso kumangidwa komwe kungachitike chifukwa cha ziwonetsero za Lachisanu sikunadziwikebe. Koma Colville wawuza VOA ofesi yake yalandira malipoti okhumudwitsa ophwanya ufulu wa anthu miyezi ingapo yapitayi.

en: "There are, as I said, reports coming through right now of very recent abductions, beatings and so on of activists or human rights defenders. We have not had a chance to verify those and look in detail apart from the two that occurred a few days ago," Colville said. "So, it is clearly a very tense situation."
ny: "Pali monga ndanenera, malipoti akubwera pompano okhudza kubedwa, kumenyedwa ndi ena omenyera ufulu wachibadwidwe kapena omenyera ufulu wa anthu. Sitinapeze mwayi wotsimikizira izi ndikuyang'ana mwatsatanetsatane kupatula ziwiri zomwe zidachitika pang'ono. masiku apitawo," adatero Colville. "Choncho, zikuwoneka kuti ndizovuta kwambiri."

en: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.
ny: Colville ati akuluakulu aboma ali ndi udindo wowonetsetsa kuti anthu ali ndi ufulu wolankhula komanso kuteteza ufulu wosonkhana mwamtendere.

en: The U.N. human rights office is urging the government to engage in a national dialogue to ensure that civil society in all its guises can carry out its activities without fear of intimidation or reprisals for its work.
ny: Ofesi ya bungwe la United Nations yoona za ufulu wachibadwidwe ikulimbikitsa boma kuti lichite nawo zokambirana zapadziko lonse pofuna kuwonetsetsa kuti mabungwe adziko lonse atha kuchita ntchito zake popanda mantha kapena kubwezera chilango chifukwa cha ntchito yake.

en: Despite Oil and Gas Reserves, Africa Feels Pressure of Rising Energy Costs
ny: Ngakhale Malo Osungira Mafuta ndi Gasi, Africa Imamva Kupanikizika Chifukwa Chokwera Mtengo Wamagetsi

en: Africans are feeling the pinch caused by soaring global energy prices, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that are major exporters of crude oil.
ny: Ofufuza akutero, anthu a ku Africa kuno chifukwa cha kukwera kwa mitengo ya magetsi padziko lonse, ngakhale m’mayiko monga Nigeria ndi Angola omwe ndi amene amatumiza mafuta osapsa kunja.

en: While that handful of oil producers is seeing an increase in revenue – especially since the Russian invasion of Ukraine on February 24 – much of the continent lacks refining capability, forcing countries to pay high prices to import gasoline and other petroleum products from Asia and Europe.
ny: Ngakhale kuti opanga mafuta ochepawo akuwona kuwonjezeka kwa ndalama - makamaka kuyambira pamene Russia inaukira Ukraine pa February 24 - zambiri za kontinenti zilibe mphamvu zoyenga, zomwe zimakakamiza mayiko kulipira mitengo yapamwamba kuti atenge mafuta ndi mafuta ena ochokera ku Asia ndi ku Ulaya.

en: The continent is further affected by increasing costs for natural gas, a key component of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.
ny: Kontinentiyi ikukhudzidwanso ndi kukwera mtengo kwa gasi, chigawo chachikulu cha feteleza wa nayitrogeni omwe amagwiritsidwa ntchito popanga chakudya.

en: With salaries largely stagnant, more than two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rising prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, founding president of the Ghana-based Imani Center for Policy and Education.
ny: Ndi malipiro omwe amakhala osasunthika, oposa awiri mwa atatu mwa anthu aku Africa akumva kukakamizidwa ndi mitengo yomwe ikukwera, adatero Franklin Cudjoe, pulezidenti woyambitsa wa Imani Center for Policy and Education ku Ghana.

en: "The continent is affected simply because we depend largely on global oil suppliers, since not many African countries have [their own] oil products," Cudjoe told VOA.
ny: "Kontinenti ikukhudzidwa chifukwa chakuti timadalira kwambiri ogulitsa mafuta padziko lonse lapansi, popeza si mayiko ambiri a mu Africa omwe ali ndi mafuta [awo]," Cudjoe adauza VOA.

en: Prices spiked on the global oil market after the invasion of Ukraine triggered a wave of international sanctions against Russia, one of the worlds leading exporters of crude. The price briefly climbed to over $120 per barrel this month before settling down to $103 per barrel on Friday.
ny: Mitengo idakwera pamsika wapadziko lonse wamafuta pambuyo poti dziko la Ukraine litawukira dziko la Ukraine zidayambitsa zilango zapadziko lonse lapansi motsutsana ndi Russia, m'modzi mwa mayiko otsogola padziko lonse lapansi ogulitsa zinthu zopanda mafuta. Mtengowu udakwera pang'ono mpaka $120 pa mbiya mwezi uno usanatsike mpaka $103 pa mbiya Lachisanu.

en: The surge in energy prices is helping to fuel inflation across Africa. In Ghana, for example, overall consumer price inflation was pegged at 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the countrys Statistical Service said last week.
ny: Kukwera kwamitengo yamagetsi kukuthandizira kukwera kwamitengo ku Africa konse. Ku Ghana, mwachitsanzo, kukwera kwamitengo ya ogula kudakwera 15.7% pachaka mu February poyerekeza ndi 13.9% mu Januware, mayiko Statistical Service adati sabata yatha.

en: In Zimbabwe, prices are climbing sharply – even overnight. At a TM supermarket in the capital of Harare, a crate of 30 eggs cost the $6.70 on Tuesday and about $7.81 on Wednesday. The price of a loaf of bread went from $1.49 to $1.84; for a kilo of beef, the price jumped from $3.35 to $5.22.
ny: Ku Zimbabwe, mitengo ikukwera kwambiri - ngakhale usiku wonse. Pamalo ogulitsira a TM ku likulu la Harare, krete ya mazira 30 idagula $6.70 Lachiwiri ndi pafupifupi $7.81 Lachitatu. Mtengo wa buledi unachokera pa $1.49 kufika pa $1.84; pa kilogalamu imodzi ya ng’ombe, mtengo wake unakwera kuchoka pa $3.35 kufika pa $5.22.

en: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
ny: Mtengo wa petulo wakweranso. Ku Harare, mtengo wa lita imodzi udakwera kuchokera pa $ 1.41 mpaka $ 1.69 kuyambira Lachiwiri mpaka Lachitatu.

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
ny: Kukwera kwamitengo yazakudya kunali koyendetsa kwambiri kukwera kwa mitengo ya ogula ku Egypt, kudakwera ndi 8.8% mu February - kukwera kwambiri kwazaka pafupifupi zitatu, malinga ndi bungwe lowerengera boma, CAPMAS.

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
ny: Cudjoe adati ndikofunikira kuti maboma ndi mabungwe am'madera monga African Union apange chitetezo chothandizira ogula panthawi yamavuto azachuma.

en: "Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food," said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
ny: "Ngakhale zikutanthawuza kumanga chitetezo popereka chakudya," adatero Cudjoe, akuwonjezera kuti, "Ndikhoza kulingalira Nigeria, ngati ikanakhala ndi njira yake, ikanakhala ikugulitsa zakudya ku mayiko ambiri pamtengo wochepa pofika pano."

en: "There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world."
ny: "Payenera kukhala changu chodzipangira okha chitetezo, ndalama zomwe zingatipangitse kudzisamalira - makamaka kutiletsa kuti tisawonongedwe kwathunthu ndi zosatsimikizika izi padziko lapansi."

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
ny: Katswiri wazachuma ku likulu la dziko la Zambia ku Lusaka, Chibamba Kanyama, adati kuyimitsa misonkho yamafuta ndi "chinthu choyenera kuchita pakalipano" pochepetsa ogula ndi mafakitale.

en: "African governments must find a way of responding," he said. 'It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
ny: "Maboma aku Africa akuyenera kupeza njira yoyankhira," adatero. "Ndi kusankha ngati kuchepetsa misonkho kuti mutsitse mitengo kapena kusunga mitengo yamtengo wapatali ndikugwiritsa ntchito ndalama zothandizira anthu omwe ali pachiopsezo chachikulu."

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
ny: Koma Kanyama adanenanso kuti vuto lazandale lomwe likukhudza Russia ndi Ukraine - onse ogulitsa mbewu zazikulu ku Africa - litha kubweretsa mwayi kwa alimi aku Africa.

en: "Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
ny: Mayiko ogulitsa monga South Africa, okhala ndi makina olimba komanso opangidwa mwaluso, atha kupeza mwayi wotumizira [zinthu] kunja monga tirigu ndi zinthu zina kuti atseke mipata yomwe Russia ndi Ukraine idasiya," adatero Kanyama.

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.
ny: Kanyama adatinso thandizo lochokera kumayiko ena - mwachitsanzo, popereka ngongole ku mayiko ena a mu Africa - ndilolandiridwa.

en: He noted that the Group of 20 – which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union – "is trying to offer some debt relief."
ny: Ananenanso kuti Gulu la 20 - lomwe limaphatikizapo mayiko asanu ndi awiri olemera, mayiko ena omwe ali ndi chuma champhamvu kapena chomwe chikukula mofulumira, ndi European Union - "akuyesera kupereka ngongole."

en: "Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis," Kanyama added.
ny: "Maiko ena, monga Zambia, ali ndi ndondomeko yokonzanso ngongole ndi ndondomeko ya IMF, ndipo kwa ine, iyi ndi njira yokhayo yothetsera vutoli," anawonjezera Kanyama.

en: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
ny: Nkhaniyi idachokera ku VOA ya English-to-Africa service, ndi zopereka zochokera ku Zimbabwe.

en: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
ny: WHO Ikuti Katemera waku Africa wa COVID Adakwera ndi 15% mu February

en: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
ny: Bungwe la World Health Organisation lati katemera waku Africa COVID-19 adakwera ndi 15% pakati pa Januware ndi February, pomwe mayiko angapo adayambitsa njira zopangira katemera kuti awonjezere kufalitsa komanso kuteteza anthu ku mliriwu.

en: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year. The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.
ny: Boma la Zimbabwe lati likuyambitsa "dziko lonse la katemera" lomwe likufuna anthu omwe sanalandirebe katemera m'dziko lomwe lakhala vuto lokana katemera kuyambira pomwe pulogalamuyo idayamba chaka chatha. Izi zikubwera pomwe boma likukhudzidwa ndi kuchuluka kwa milandu ya COVID-19. Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, mkulu wa WHO m'chigawo cha Africa, adanena kuti kuwonjezeka kwa katemera wa COVID-19 ku kontinentiyi kudachitika makamaka ndi kampeni m'maiko omwe ali ndi anthu ambiri, kuphatikiza Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, ndi Nigeria.

en: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
ny: Dr. Thierno Balde, woyang'anira zochitika za WHO ku Africa ku COVID-19, akuti kontinenti iyenera kukhala tcheru.

en: "We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible. We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally. The situation might change. So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination," Balde said.
ny: "Tawona zomwe zikuchitika kuzungulira, ku China, komanso chiopsezo chokhala ndi zotengera zatsopano, mitundu yatsopano ikadali yotheka. Tiyenera kupitilizabe kuteteza anthu athu potenga katemerayu posapumula kwathunthu. Zinthu zitha kusintha. tikuyenera kupitiliza kusintha zina mwazinthu izi komanso kuti tipeze katemera," adatero Balde.

en: The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.
ny: Bungwe la WHO lidati kuti lipititse patsogolo kuvomereza katemera waku Africa COVID-19, iwo ndi mabungwe ena amathandizira kuyendetsa katemera wambiri m'maiko osachepera 10 kuti afikire anthu 100 miliyoni kumapeto kwa mwezi wamawa.

en: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind.
ny: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, acting Minister of information in Zimbabwes, wati dziko lawo silidzasiyidwa.

en: "Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date. The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
ny: "Ponena za pulogalamu ya katemera, kuyambira pa Marichi 15, 2022, mlingo wachitatu wa 159,628 waperekedwa mpaka pano. Kampeni ya katemera wa dziko lonse iyamba Lolemba, 21 Marichi, 2022, ndipo [boma] likulimbikitsa omwe sanalandirebe katemera kuti agwiritse ntchito mwayi umenewu,” adatero Ndlovu.

en: A number of Zimbabweans have refused vaccination, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines. The country has lately recorded a rise in new infections – now cumulatively at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.
ny: Anthu angapo aku Zimbabwe akana katemera, ponena kuti sakukhulupirira katemera wa Sinopharm ndi Sinovac wopangidwa ku China. Dzikoli lawonetsa kukwera kwa matenda atsopano - tsopano 244,012 ndi anthu 5,418 omwe afa, malinga ndi a Johns Hopkins University, omwe akutsatira zomwe zachitika padziko lonse lapansi.

en: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, attributes that to the recent lifting of restrictive measures, such as lockdowns. He says, however, it is not time to panic, just to enforce WHO protocols, such masking and social distancing.
ny: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, pulezidenti wa Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, anena izi chifukwa cha kuchotsedwa kwaposachedwa kwa zoletsa, monga zotsekera. Akuti, ino si nthawi yochita mantha, kungokakamiza kutsatira malamulo a WHO, kubisala komanso kusamvana.

en: "After relaxing measures, it is expected that cases will slightly go up. But I also think that it is too early to make any meaningful conclusions, I think it is just an opportunity for us to strengthen our preventative measures and continue highlighting to the rest of the population that COVID is still with us. The good news, though, is that severe cases have not gone up. What we need to do is to continue to get vaccinated and what is important is that the government should – as it is doing – is monitor these numbers. There is no cause for alarm or cause for us to introduce new measures," Chimbetete said.
ny: "Pambuyo popumula, zikuyembekezeka kuti milandu ikwera pang'ono. Koma ndikuganizanso kuti kwatsala pang'ono kupanga ziganizo zomveka, ndikuganiza kuti ndi mwayi chabe kuti tilimbitse njira zathu zopewera ndikupitiliza kuwunikira ena onse. Chomwe tikuyenera kuchita ndikupitilizabe kulandira katemera ndipo chofunikira ndi chakuti boma lichite - monga momwe likuchitira. - ndikuyang'anira manambalawa. Palibe chifukwa chodandaulira kapena chifukwa choti tibweretse njira zatsopano," adatero Chimbetete.

en: Zimbabwe had a target of vaccinating at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a figure that some say was difficult to reach given the scarcity of resources and hesitance. It has yet to announce when it plans to achieve herd immunity.
ny: Dziko la Zimbabwe linali ndi cholinga chopereka katemera kwa anthu osachepera 10 miliyoni pofika kumapeto kwa chaka chatha, chiwerengero chomwe ena akuti chinali chovuta kuchipeza chifukwa cha kuchepa kwa zipangizo komanso kukayikira. Iyenera kulengezabe nthawi yomwe ikukonzekera kukwaniritsa chitetezo cha ziweto.

en: Finland Crowned World's Happiest Nation for Fifth Year
ny: Dziko la Finland Lidavala Korona Dziko Losangalala Kwambiri Padziko Lonse kwa Chaka Chachisanu

en: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year running, in an annual U.N.-sponsored index that again ranked Afghanistan as the unhappiest, followed closely by Lebanon.
ny: Dziko la Finland latchulidwa kuti ndi dziko losangalala kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi kwa chaka chachisanu, mu ndondomeko yapachaka yothandizidwa ndi UN yomwe inaikanso dziko la Afghanistan kukhala losasangalala kwambiri, kutsatiridwa ndi Lebanon.

en: Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania recorded the biggest boosts in wellbeing. The largest falls in the World Happiness table, released on Friday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.
ny: Serbia, Bulgaria ndi Romania adalemba zolimbikitsa kwambiri pazaumoyo. Kugwa kwakukulu kwambiri pa tebulo la World Happiness, komwe kunatulutsidwa Lachisanu, kunabwera ku Lebanon, Venezuela ndi Afghanistan.

en: Lebanon, which is facing economic meltdown, fell to second from last on the index of 146 nations, just below Zimbabwe.
ny: Lebanon, yomwe ikuyang'anizana ndi kusokonekera kwachuma, idatsika mpaka yachiwiri kuchokera komaliza pamndandanda wamayiko 146, kumunsi kwa Zimbabwe.

en: War-traumatized Afghanistan, already bottom of the table, has seen its humanitarian crisis deepen since the Taliban took power again last August.  U.N. agency UNICEF estimates one million children under five could die of hunger this winter if not aided.
ny: Afghanistan yomwe yakhudzidwa ndi nkhondo, yomwe ili pansi pa tebulo, yawona mavuto ake azaumphawi akuya kuyambira pomwe a Taliban adatenganso mphamvu mu Ogasiti watha. Bungwe la UNICEF likuyerekeza kuti ana miliyoni imodzi osakwana zaka zisanu akhoza kufa ndi njala m'nyengo yozizira ngati sathandizidwa.

en: "This (index) presents a stark reminder of the material and immaterial damage that war does to its many victims," co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said. The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's own assessment of their happiness, as well as economic and social data.
ny: "Ichi (chilolezo) chikupereka chikumbutso champhamvu cha kuwonongeka kwa zinthu ndi kosatheka komwe nkhondo imawononga ambiri omwe akuzunzidwa," wolemba mnzake Jan-Emmanuel De Neve adatero. Lipoti la World Happiness Report, lomwe tsopano lili m’chaka chake cha 10, lazikidwa pa kudzipenda kwa anthu ponena za chimwemwe chawo, limodzinso ndi deta yazachuma ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu.

en: It assigns a happiness score on a scale of zero to 10, based on an average of data over a three-year period. This latest edition was completed before the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Imapatsa chisangalalo pamlingo wa ziro mpaka 10, kutengera kuchuluka kwa data pazaka zitatu. Kusindikiza kwaposachedwa kumeneku kunamalizidwa kusanachitike kuukira kwa Russia ku Ukraine.

en: Northern Europeans once again dominated the top spots -- with the Danes second behind the Finns, followed by the Icelandic, the Swiss and the Dutch. The United States rose three places to 16th, one ahead of Britain, while France climbed to 20th, its highest ranking yet.
ny: Anthu akumpoto ku Europe adalamuliranso malo apamwamba - ndi a Danes achiwiri kumbuyo kwa Finns, kutsatiridwa ndi Icelandic, Swiss ndi Dutch. United States idakwera malo atatu mpaka 16, imodzi patsogolo pa Britain, pomwe France idakwera mpaka 20, yomwe ili pamwamba kwambiri.

en: As well as a personal sense of wellbeing, based on Gallup polls in each country, the happiness score takes account of GDP, social support, personal freedom and levels of corruption.
ny: Komanso kukhala ndi moyo wabwino, kutengera zisankho za Gallup m'dziko lililonse, kuchuluka kwachisangalalo kumatengera GDP, chithandizo chamagulu, ufulu wamunthu komanso kuchuluka kwa ziphuphu.

en: This year the authors also used data from social media to compare people's emotions before and after the Covid-19 pandemic. They found "strong increases in anxiety and sadness" in 18 countries but a fall in feelings of anger.
ny: Chaka chino olembawo adagwiritsanso ntchito zidziwitso zapa TV kuyerekeza momwe anthu akumvera mliri wa Covid-19 usanachitike komanso pambuyo pake. Anapeza "kuwonjezeka kwakukulu kwa nkhawa ndi chisoni" m'mayiko 18 koma kugwa kwa mkwiyo.

en: "The lesson of the World Happiness Report over the years is that social support, generosity to one another and honesty in government are crucial for wellbeing," report co-author Jeffrey Sachs wrote.
ny: “Phunziro la World Happiness Report m’zaka zapitazi ndiloti kuthandizana kwa anthu, kuwolowa manja kwa wina ndi mnzake ndiponso kuona mtima m’boma n’kofunika kwambiri kuti pakhale moyo wabwino,” analemba lipotilo wolemba mnzake Jeffrey Sachs.

en: "World leaders should take heed."
ny: "Atsogoleri adziko lapansi ayenera kusamala."

en: The report raised some eyebrows when it first placed Finland at the top of its listings in 2018.
ny: Lipotilo lidadzutsa nsidze pomwe idayika dziko la Finland pachimake pamndandanda wake mu 2018.

en: Many of the Nordic country's 5.5 million people describe themselves as taciturn and prone to melancholy, and admit to eyeing public displays of joyfulness with suspicion.
ny: Ambiri mwa anthu okwana 5.5 miliyoni a m'dziko la Nordic amadzitcha kuti ndi osasunthika komanso okonda kukhumudwa, ndipo amavomereza kuti amayang'anitsitsa masewero a anthu akusangalala ndi kukayikira.

en: But the country of vast forests and lakes is also known for its well-functioning public services, ubiquitous saunas, widespread trust in authority and low levels of crime and inequality.
ny: Koma dziko la nkhalango zazikulu ndi nyanja limadziŵikanso chifukwa cha ntchito zake zapagulu zogwira ntchito bwino, malo osambira osambira opezeka paliponse, kukhulupirira maulamuliro kofala ndi upandu wochepa ndi kusalingana.
